Reviews.Title: “Full Marks to this Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: manojgurbani
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Parkroyal from 17th to 20th march 2012 and were very satisfied with the services provided.We booked for a superior room but on arrival we were upgraded to a family room.The front desk staff and all other staff were very cordial.The location,near the MRT, from an Asian point of view was very good, with good Indian restaurants all around the hotel.The room was very comfortable and services were upto the mark.The daily breakfast buffet was adequate and satisfactory.Overall, an enjoyable experience worth repeating.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Thampi1974
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Parkroyal during 6th to 9th April 2012. Though we checked in at around 03.00 am in the morning , the front desk ladies were quite lively and responsive. The check in got over in a jiffy. We had actually booked for a superior room but it was finally upgraded to a deluxe room. The rooms were very neat with all the facilities ...The breakfast was a treat to the palate with excellent spread of indian cuisine. The hotel was just adjacent to Mustafa Shopping centre and at a vantage point to all the major tourist spots in singapore ... We had pleasant stay at Parkroyal and would definitely choose the same hotel if we get an opportunity to visit Singapore again

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel...Not so good location”
Reviews.Author: Garima V
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at Park Royal because it’s near to the MRT and Little India. But we got very disappointed by the room and the location. The hotel lobby and the food were good. But once you step out of the hotel you see a mob of people going here and there. The place little India is a very crowded place which you do not want to see if you are on a honeymoon or looking for a relaxing vacation. It is the best place to stay for vegetarians because of many veg restaurants surrounding the hotel. I would not prefer to stay at this place if I visit Singapore again. Clark Quay has many better hotel and much better location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: AmritB
Reviews.Content: You enter Singapore and take a taxi to Kitchener Road, every Taxi guy knows the Hotel. It takes around 19 SGD to this place. It's a good hotel, clean and has a nice smelling lobby. The rooms are well appointed and value for money. They have all basic amenities and are all Air Conditioned. Sadly the compressor can't be switched off and we were feeling cold even after we switched off the AirCon. Food is okay and we only ordered once, Spaghetti from the Kid's Room Service Menu. The main disadvantage of this hotel is bad check-in. It took us whole 2 hours to Check in. First the check-in time is 2 PM and they do not allow early check-ins at all. After 2 PM they were not able to meet our requirement of Non-Smoking Nearby rooms with our friends. They gave us rooms on different floors. Reception staff is rude some times and starts to raise their voices on petty issues. I was just explaining about our requirement as 2 families and she wouldn't listen. Anyways, the main ease of this hotel is vicinity to Little India and Mustafa Shopping Centre which is a bliss to us Indians. Awesome food nearby and you wouldn't want to eat at the hotel at all if you like Indian Food. All in all a pleasant experience with little headaches due to bad check-in.

Reviews.Title: “Could use an update..”
Reviews.Author: KaiZ
Reviews.Content: Located across from the MRT station is the reason why I chose this hotel and of course besides the awesome deal I got. It's in Little India, across from a mall and food. Shopping district is less than 15 mins away via subway. Hotel has a nice pool area, gym and a restaurant. The room's clean and looked like they did some upgrade to the bathroom but room furnishing is pretty dated. Had a positive experience with this hotel with no issues at all.

Reviews.Title: “Very Spoilt”
Reviews.Author: Maureen L
Reviews.Content: After finally arriving at our hotel we were pleasantly surprised by the warmth and help from the concierge and were ferried straight to the Orchid Room (Club area).We again were welcomed very warmly and received terrific advice and tips on locations and how to get there. As soon as you enter the Orchid room they were there to offer you a drink. it wasa very intimate room so we met some great people which again made it a great stay.We were very close to a train station so getting around was easy. The hotel itself was brilliant and we would stay there again when in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location....”
Reviews.Author: bat31
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel many times over the years, the latest being in March 2012. The hotel is conveniently located in Little India, bang opposite a small mall and MRT station, behind the hotel is the Mustafa Shopping centre and a plethora of restaurants, mostly Indian. The check in at the hotel is usually a bit slow, since this is generally full..maybe they should have a couple of more staff at the reception during the peak hours. This time, I was upgraded to a superior room on the top floor. The room was very nice, with a great bed, built-in flatscreen TV, mini-bar, coffee machine, and the bathroom was OK, with good quality of soaps/ shampoo/ creams etc. There is a nice pool. Since the hotel is used by many tour groups, especially from India, the lobby can be crowded sometimes, and the check-in and check-outs can be slow, so be sure to leave yourself sufficient time. Overall, a nice place to stay and shop in Singapore, especially if you are from the Indian subcontinent!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Ravneet249
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during my honeymoon for 3 nights , the staff is very courteous and helpful. Room and toilet was very clean and equipped with all facilities. Located near Little India easy to access to cabs, metro station and market (Mustafa is just behind the hotel). The breakfast buffet was yummy and elaborated - from prata to fruits to to sambhar everything thing was on display. Overall a a very nice experience and would surely love to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place At An Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: arviChennai
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 21st to 23rd and again 25th to 27th march. Unlike other travellers who mentioned slow check in we had a fairly quick check in. Both instances we were upgraded and also given a late check out. Hotel is located very conveniently with a mall and mrt station just across and a plethero of dining options both in the mall and around the hotel especially for Indians more so for Vegetarians. With the MRT just across getting to anypart of singapore is just a breeze. The hotel staff are very polite and any service call is attended without delay. We had an underworking AC in our room when we complained we were given an opton of room change which we were reluctant bcoz it was only underperforming and our goods were all over the room immediately a rotating pedestal fan was brought . The concern for the comfort of the guests is appreciable. Bathroom and toileteries are good. Breakfast is widespread. A spl mention about the concierge service -very helpful. one point i would like to mention is that they dont have a cloak room free of cost for guest coming back within a day or two.overall would come back there .

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay, and upgrade..”
Reviews.Author: ExpatBren
Reviews.Content: Check In is very painful and slow in this hotel, and this is clearly something they need to look at. However I got a double upgrade to a lovely suite, so I guess I should not complain too much about the waiting. The bathrooms are not the cleanest, but the beds are VERY comfortable, and not the usual hard style that some Singapore hotels use. The internet is fast enough to be no issues, and plenty of TV channles for everyone. The buffet breakfast is still very good. Lots of options, plus fresh coffee machines to help yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Jeff H
Reviews.Content: If you are willing to stay a little out of the city centre in the heart of Little India, this hotel will work very well and is much cheaper than hotels of comparable quality in the city centre. It is across the road from a very good new mall with many dining options. The pool is clean and well maintained. One nice touch is that the hotel has a self serve laundry facility on the pool level. $7 a load but still much cheaper than hotel service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel with access to everything”
Reviews.Author: alfyjohn
Reviews.Content: Excellent stay with best of amenties,courteous staff and handy location to access all services.

Reviews.Title: “What a little Gem”
Reviews.Author: hilary506
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel:) Nothing too flash but really comfortable, clean and great service. The food was a bit expensive so we went for a walk and found all sorts of little gems as we strolled the streets. We liked the location and got to explore areas we wouldn't have otherwise looked at. Will definitely go back

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: italianshoemanoo8
Reviews.Content: Have just spent four nights in this hotel,and found it to be first class,on a arrival we were given an upgrade to a executive suite which was very nice,the hotel is in a good location in Little India,about a thirty minute walk to Orchard Road,across the road from the hotel is a shopping Mall with two food courts which are very cheap 2x Soup 2x Main courses £7,and the food was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Vdawar
Reviews.Content: I went to Singapore in November 2011 with my wife on a vacation. First of all, Singapore is a very beautiful and safe destination for foreigners. There are some very exciting places especially for youngsters like us ...wink wink :). we stayed at Hotel Park Royal on Kitchner Road. Being an Indian, it was a very comfortable stay as Little India is right next to the Hotel. Biggest Shopping mall of Singapore i.e. Mustafa is adjoining the hotel. One can easily get Foreign Exchange Shops, Food, Shopping esp. electronics at a walking distance. Farer Park Metro Station is opposite to the Hotel, if you want to go anywhere it is very easy to board the Metro. All in all it was a very safe and comfortable stay. If someone wants any further information about Singapore or Hotel Park Royal, please write down to me I would be happy to help you.

Reviews.Title: “First Stay = Last Stay”
Reviews.Author: PL T
Reviews.Content: Long medical trip of more than a week and all I need is a comfortable bed to rest after my surgery. Indicated my preferences upon reservation, but it was clearly not noted. Check-in process was tedious as I had to beg for a king bed. The young lady at the Front Desk was kind enough to re-assign the room for me after I prompted I was here for a medical treatment. Did I mention that I had to wait in line without any acknowledgment and the only Front Desk agent on duty assisted someone else who jumped the queue? The same Front Desk agent then assisted a group with elevator access and watched the elevator door close right in front of me. Sigh! Where is the hospitality? Room is small, TV is really old, but most importantly, cleanliness must be improved. Upon entering the room for the first time, the side of the basin was smeared with blue toothpaste and the shelf below had coffee stains. There were hair in the drawer and the trash was not emptied. Anti-slip mat was filthy and bed linen was stained. I cleaned up whatever I could as I did not want to bother the Housekeepers. There was no turndown service and bathrobes. I did not even have a room service menu until I asked for it. When I finally got hold of one, I ordered Chicken Caeser Salad which came without the chicken. Hilarious? This was all true. Each time I put the “Do Not Disturb” light on, Housekeeping will call me again and again to ask if I require any service. On two separate occasions I switched on the “Housekeeping Service” light deliberately and strangely Housekeeping did not clean my room. Imagine coming back from your medical treatment after 4 hours to a dirty room! Well, I thought I was being too picky and told myself to lower my expectations. I swear I did. Ordered a wake-up call at 0600hrs and got it at 0615hrs. That was totally fine as I managed to wake myself up timely for my medical appointment. But it gets better when I got a wake-up call at 0600hrs on the following day when I did not request for any! I got up at 0600hrs for nothing! I doubt anyone else could engineer a more miserable experience than mine.

Reviews.Title: “Great Situation for Shopping, Metro, Family”
Reviews.Author: tigertraveller65
Reviews.Content: Was a real hastle this trip (4th) to just book a room from 7am to 7pm without their system wanting to charge a full 2 days. ie 2pm to the previous day till 10am then 2pm till the next day when we just wanted the Day use of the room. Check in was Pathetically slow even though there were only 5 persons checking in or out. Over 48 minutes to get to the counter then another 30 minutes sorting out the Day Room Hire even though I had confirmed by 2 emails my requirements. Check out was painfully slow too. However the Rooms and facilities all make up for the above minor hastle. Love this place to stay with its great pool and fitness facility, bars and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Fantasitic child friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kirsten R
Reviews.Content: We are a 5 person Family travelling with 3 children aged 7,4,3. This hotel was great. We came from Europe jet lagged and the Parkroyal was in a perfect location for us. We ate in the buffet restarant most of the time as the kids were by this stage over going out to eat! The staff were very friendly especially with the children. They loved the buffet style eating and tried different things.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place!”
Reviews.Author: Harshad C
Reviews.Content: I had been here a few months before. Stayed in a superior room on the 8th floor. The room was cosy but was a bit smaller than the industry standards. It was nevertheless fully equipped with all the amenities that one would require. The spice brassiere restaurant provides a decent buffet breakfast spread. Got chance to have breakfasts only here as we had all our dinners while out. The housekeeping and other staff were quite friendly too. In short, a decent place to stay. A bit on the costly side for being in Little india but better than most the hotels around. A mall right in front of the hotel adds on to the nice location. Ideal for Indians because of the location.

Reviews.Title: “stop over”
Reviews.Author: NMinx2012
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in Little India with a MRT station very close at hand,but otherwise it's a distance from most of the tourist attractions. I'd recommend Orchard road and towards the marina for tourists. The hotel is clean and the rooms average sized and clean. The reception staff we didnt find very helpful esp after arriving at 11am,tired and in need of a shower to find no rooms ready til 3pm,when 1 of our 2 booked rooms was ready. We complained several times to no avail. The pool is small but lovely and the bar didnt seem to open til after 6pm during our stay. Breakfast was very good with a large selection buffet still.

Reviews.Title: “nice rooms and good location”
Reviews.Author: homemadetravels
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in Little India, 2 minutes away from the Farrer park MRT station, very close to 24 hour open Mustafa shopping centre. And just across there is City Square Shopping Mall. The lobby was nice, our room was quite big and the bathroom was really clean, the breakfast was continental. There was also free wifi in the hotel. My only complaint about the hotel was that our room was not ready until 15:00 pm, we made complaints to the reception, they were friendly, helpful so they upgrade our room.

Reviews.Title: “Feel pampered!!!”
Reviews.Author: Rgkaria
Reviews.Content: Amazing service of the house keeping n hotel stafff... Got a priority for checkin also. The housekeeping staff make sure dat u get watever u hav asked for at their earliest n they try their best to make u comfortable. Only thing that irritated me was a lady staff at the breakfast restaurant, who bluntly denied on making an egg omelette without oil. She was xtremely rude n adamant on few other things also... But the other staff was really gud.... Very comfortable stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: mshiros
Reviews.Content: stayed for 4 days in July 2011. I had actually booked for a Superior room , however i was upgraded to a deluxe room. There was quite some queue while checking in. I think its quite official with this hotel as I have seen the same with reviews from other people. The deluxe rooms are pretty great- fine interiors, with all amenities, relaxing cot, with large lcd tv, Toilets were neat, well maintained. However the outside view from the room was not quite great. The house keeping staff too do a great job, was pretty much satisfied by their work though out the stay. The pool, gym and spa are also worth a try. Breakfast buffet is quite good. A good variety of dishes and fruits. They also have a sushi bar. Musthafa market is just around the corner, as well as there is a mall just opposite the hotel. Over all- would recommend anyone anyday.

Reviews.Title: “My first time in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: nomadladymedic
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Singapore and it was work related. When I arrived at the hotel, there was a group of us checking in so it took a little bit, but the staff was very polite and professional. I was the only one in my group that there was not a reservation for, but the staff quickly gave me a room anyway. I was impressed by the location of the hotel and the nearby shopping and bars and food. The room was to my liking and I liked the design. The bathtubs are a little on the small side and you have to step up or down, which with wet feet could prove difficult. The bartender was knowledgeable and quick. All in all, I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in Little India”
Reviews.Author: K9Asia
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a superior room for 3 nights in October 2011. Have frequently stayed there since 1998 when it was known as the New Park Hotel. Handy location in Little India just around the corner from Mustafa 24 hour shopping centre. New shopping centre across the road from the front of the hotel. Entrance to Farrer Park MRT station is just across the road. Good choice of breakfast dishes at the hotel and plenty of eateries nearby for lunch and dinner. Expensive hotel when compared to other cities in Asia but that applies to Singapore in general.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: SANJEEV C
Reviews.Content: Rooms are good, clean and reasonably sized but bathroom and bathtub are very small. Location is good and easily approachable. Staff is good & cooperative. Lobby at reception needs improvement. Reasonably good place to stay in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: VeeBee80
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was nice, a nice size room and a nice size bathroom. The room was clean which is the main thing for us. The breakfast was nice with lots off choice! In terms of food, there are plenty of places to eat nearby. We walk to most places when on holiday,we found that most sites where easy and not so far to get to on foot. However there is good public transport links near the hotel. In terms of staff, a mixture. So stuff were really helpful and others not so helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Good bt nothing special except for a low cost package”
Reviews.Author: Abhishek n
Reviews.Content: The park royal at Kitchener road is very strategically located. Mustafa center is just a hop skip & a jump away, a pleasure to all shoppers. The park royal is sandwiched between Sernagoon plaza & Mustafa centre. You can walk up to the Farrer park station and take a train to anywhere in Singapore. There is also a bus stop just outside the hotel. Taxi services are very much available at any time in the city. Also don’t forget to visit marina square and Suntec city but they are a little away from the hotel. We booked a 4 day & 3 night Singapore package from Antilog Vacations , a bulk dealer of Singapore & Malaysia packages in India.They give quite low rates & first class services.Choosing a bulk dealer helps one save costs & enjoy nice services as well.In India Thomas Cook & Antilog r the bulk sellers for Singapore. The starting category room is the superior room which is around 28 square meters. The room has all basic facilities. The room is located from the 6th to 12th floor. Any guest can request a city or pool view. The deluxe rooms are located from the 13th to 18th floor & few rooms on the 20th floor. The hotel also has the family room which can accommodate a family of three or 4. Guests can make their choice f a smoking or non smoking room at time of check in. The next category is the executive king suite which measures around 53 square meters. These rooms have a separate parlor for entertainment. Like all hotels the club suite is called the orchid club room and is located on the grand 19th floor. I would suggest the orchid club room for all business travelers as you can use the meeting room everyday for about an hour. Laundry services are also free for 2 pieces of clothing. Breakfast is provided. There are many special offers extended by the hotel. Like corporate offers & weekend gateways which serve to both romantic and business travelers. Overall a nice hotel to have a stay in.

Reviews.Title: “NOT WORTH SEEKING OUT”
Reviews.Author: jim c
Reviews.Content: After an 8hr flight and a 30min cab ride we arrived at the beautiful Park Royal on Kitchener. Lovely entrance and foyer area it is a pity the same attention to detail was not applied to the rooms!! Check in and out was EXTREMELY slow and they gave us keycards that didn't work, twice!! Rooms are a good size and clean. We travelled with our teenage sons and had a family room which was two rooms interconnecting. We couldn't close the door because the handle was broken on one side. There were broken electrical switches and the bed, we are positive, was a billiard table with a blanket on it. This was supposed to be a stop over to refresh in preparation for an ongoing flight, but we didn't receive the rest we were hoping to get. There is a pool which is nice with a bar. The restaurant is fair but over priced as well. The location is a bit too far away from the attractions of Singapore. Overall, we were very disappointed and feel that we did not get value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Not at all worth the place to even try once”
Reviews.Author: AR R
Reviews.Content: Horror is the one word to describe my stay now in Feb 2012 -every thing here is terrible- check in takes ages-they sent me to a room where there was no room but it was a godown. Next had to run down from 14th floor to front desk , get an another room in 7th floor-the room never opens with the key given by them. This after 8 hours of flight from Japan , tired and half an hour it took to check in-added is their lift-it takes 10 minutes each time you wait for it-then with wrong key of the room, you can't operate the lift to go up or down. If some one has lots of patience and time, still is not worth at all, to try.The lobby is always crowded like a railway station , takes ages to check in, the staff are poor trained, with local English accent ,and added is not with a helpful nature at all.They feel they are obliging the guests by giving a room. Finally they gave a room in 7th floor -resembling a suite but not much to talk about after an hour of going up and down. Finally my sincere advise is-if you have lots of luck and patience try this place- Except it is in Serangoon road and next to Md. Mustafa dept. stores, nothing much to about.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel and overpriced. Look for discount rate.”
Reviews.Author: DanoCanada
Reviews.Content: We’ve been to Singapore over 10 times in the last 8 years. This year, we have stayed at the Wangz, the Albert Court Village and the Park Royal on Beach. Its sister hotel on Kitchener is priced slightly lower, serves quite a different clientele and is located in Little India, which is also quite different. But it’s still a good hotel for its price. Granted we got it at a fantastic price, over 50 per cent off on Agoda ($98), so my comments have to be taken in that light. But the Park Royal on Kitchener is a comfortable, clean hotel if you can get it for a good price and you don’t mind a bit of a metro ride to get to the heart of Singapore. It does not warrant the rack rate of $200++, but is very good value at the $90 to $110 range. Pluses: 1. Room size: The rooms are a good size, but not as big as at the Park Royal on Beach and a slightly more tired looking. They have a mini fridge and very comfortable bed. 2. Service: We had good service. Everyone was courteous, helpful, and responsive. But the front desk service was quite slow (see below). Staff were quite good, however, about ordering taxis and suggested that we save $8 for the booking charge by simply getting one off the street. They have a nifty system of turning on a lighted sign by the roadside, which alerts passing taxis. We were able to get a taxi in 5 minutes at 3:30 a.m. without any difficulty this way. 3. Restaurants: We didn’t eat there, mainly because there are so many more affordable restaurants in the mall across the street and in Little India. But they do have a Happy Hour. 4. Location – This is not as well located as the Park Royal on Beach unless you want to be in Little India, but there is the Farrer Park MRT (metro) across the street and two shopping malls and lots of restaurants. By metro it is not far to anywhere in Singapore. 5. Free wifi was included in our room. 6. Pool – It’s not a big or as nice as at the Beach location, but it is adequate. 7. Business centre: Services are chargeable. One plus, however, is the post office on the lower level under the hotel. 9. Free daily newspaper 10. Noise: Our room was exceptionally quiet even though we faced the mall and a busy street. Negatives: 1. Front Desk: Checking in and out can be a problem because of the bus tours and large groups that seem to book here. The lobby area was always crowded in marked contrast to the Park Royal on Beach where it was always quiet and never busy. It serves quite a different clientele than the Beach road hotel – more tour groups and less business people. 2. Breakfast was not included at the rate we got, but that is understandable. However, we had to request the free bottles of water standard in every hotel we have stayed at in Southeast Asia and they made an exception for us. But we had to argue for them every day. 3. The elevators are small and extremely slow. 4. TV was an older model (not LCD) with very limited English channel selection. 5. Location: It’s not as conveniently located as the other hotels we stayed at downtown even with the MRT at the door. Taxi rides from the centre will be more expensive. 6. Noise: There is a power plant or large AC unit on the third floor in the northwest corner of the building that is very noisy. Our room wasn’t located near it, so it was not a problem for us, but it might be for rooms in that area.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean, and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: easybus
Reviews.Content: Used as a getting to know Singapore location. Very good location for ease of getting around, rooms were spacious and clean. Not a great deal of interaction with staff as we were always out, but the times we needed them they were very helpful. Shops and restaurants within spitting distance, as was the railway connection. Gym and pool very nice as well!

Reviews.Title: “The ONLY good thing about this hotel is the location.”
Reviews.Author: HolyBrother
Reviews.Content: Room is amazingly small, and those who are suffering from claustrophobia be warned! The counter staff look like they wish to not to be there. However credit must go to Murugan who actually tried his best to make me feel welcome. The shower head will spray water everywhere except on your body! The best part about this hotel is actually the things that are outside of the hotel, for example the Toastbox cafe that is located just the opposite of the hotel where you can get good local breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “4* Budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Globetrotter4ever9
Reviews.Content: Good and compact rooms, very near to Mustafa 24 hour shopping centre. Not much to see from the hotel rooms other than sky scrappers. good food and ambience. Very near to Farrer park MRT and Serangoon Taxi stand. It is a good 4* hotel with reasonable room rates but the location is very crowded and noisy at times. Good for the travellers who just wants a room to refresh and sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Good place for Indians to stay”
Reviews.Author: Pacholee
Reviews.Content: Park Royal is situated in the area known as 'Little India' and is a great place to stay at if you're an Indian and apprehensive about your first visit to Singapore. You get Indian food all around the hotel (even Sarvanna Bhavan is located within a minute's walk!). And if it's shopping that you are interested in - Mustafa's is right next to the hotel and is the ideal place for shopping for discount branded electronics (and probably everything under the sun). The hotel has excellent rooms with views, the staff is genuinely courteous and helpful - during check-in, my room was taking time to clean up so they upgraded me for free! And unlike most hotels, the WiFi is free, so you can stay connected all the time. All in all, a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “No way a 5 star.”
Reviews.Author: MazzaMortdale
Reviews.Content: My girl friend & I arrived at this hotel at 11pm, all booked in by our Sydney travel agent. We were to be in a superior room. Our first room was on level 13. What a huge disappointment. The curtains were really old with holes all over it. The room stunk of cigarette. The bathroom was very old & the hair dryer looked like from the 1960's. We refused to accept that room. We were then sent to a deluxe room. Which was more comfortable. The walls are paper thin & u feel like your in the same room as the people in the next room. You hear everything going on in the next room. Can be very noisy. Depending on who's next to you. The breakfast was average. My friend complained about the milk that was always warm. After 5 days of breakfast it was somewhat repetitive. After walking around S'pore, we will never stay in the little India end again. If you want to walk to everything choose a hotel on orchard road .

Reviews.Title: “Best location and big rooms”
Reviews.Author: Selina23
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was the best cause it was behind the Mustaffa Shopping Centre and infront of City Square Mall. The staffs were very friendly and helpful. The rooms were very big and comfortable. The swimming pool was very clean and they have gym. Will stay again, if we visit Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly service, great Club rooms!”
Reviews.Author: bimdonesia
Reviews.Content: My first stay in this hotel. Unfortunately only one night as we were in transit. We were upgraded to a very tasteful Club room by an extremely friendly receptionist. We were offered late check-out but unfortunately couldn't enjoy this because our flight the next day left in the late morning. There is a dedicated lift for guests staying on the Club floors. The room was very spacious and had a lovely view of Little India and the city, as well as the pool downstairs. Modern room with a flat-screen TV, good and clean bathroom and comfortable lounge chair. The bed was so comfortable! As it was at Christmas, we also received some traditional and delicious savoury biscuits to enjoy with our newspaper in the morning. We took our breakfast downstairs, though on reflection probably could have used the Club room on our floor. I was very impressed with the breakfast, especially as a vegetarian I found a special selection with great Chinese and Indian dishes. There is also western food like omelets, bakery items, etc. Staff here were also very good-- I asked for coffee and later realised it was self-service, but the staff member smilingly served me coffee to my table. Check-out was fast and friendly, thanks to the receptionist who happily recommended some places to go at our next destination. I wish we could have stayed longer. It is in a great location near the Little India MRT station, and I just love the South Indian vegetarian restaurants in the neighbourhood. Thali is so cheap and so delicious. I would love to stay here again! I highly recommend it to all travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, poor service!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sankara Raman M
Reviews.Content: After an overnight flight, the check in took about 40 minutes (the queue was not organized properly, there were more counters serving check out than check in - as mentioned by the board placed there etc). The Manager on duty apologised that she was new there and that this would have been the worst check in ever! She informed me that she would charge me one day early check in (she gave me a voucher that I signed too). I also informed her that I am not looking for a room change from queen to king as per my booking and she confirmed the same too. On reaching my room, she rang me up and informed me that I would be charged for 'only' one day and not as per what she informed me during check in. When I returned at night, I found the room empty - devoid of all my belongings. The lady at the counter did not seem to have a clue (I had to stand in the queue for this too!) - after about 10 - 15 minutes, she gave me a different room key and then I realised that they did not pay heed to my request for not wanting a room change. The lady at the counter also informed me that I would be charged for 2 full days and that the early check in option would not be valid. I disagreed and was informed that the Manager on duty will get in touch with me the next day. All this took me another 30 minutes (@ 10 pm!). Come the next day, the room bell rings at 7.15 am and I am startled to see the Manager with a 'bouncer' accompanying her. She tells me that the previous day's conversation is on record where I had agreed to 'charge for only one day'. What she meant was that the early check in rate will not be applicable and that I will be charged full day! Suffice to say that, on a hectic 2 day business trip to Singapore, the only thing I did not have is REST! I also heard many people who complained that the rate they paid included breakfast whereas they were not allowed in. The rooms, decor, fare on offer for breakfast were really good ... but the service was too poor for me to give a better rating!

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Saurav-Roy
Reviews.Content: If you don't want to pay too much during the peak season but want to hold on to your standards, you might chose this hotel. Let me start by saying that I spent 4 nights in this hotel and christmas. The good thing about this hotel is the location. Apart from Mustafa being on the rear side (2 mins walk), the place is centrally located and also well connected by bus, tube and taxis. Most of the hot spots would be 5-10 mins by Taxi and so you shell out less. I arrived at the hotel at 8 am while the hotel had its standard checkin time at 2 pm. Despite being a GHA member and requesting an early checkin 3 months prior to arrival, I had to go through the usual dance and fish of the reception staff to get 1 room. By the way I took my family so had 2 rooms booked. It was certainly not a welcome gesture that I had. The reception staff kept fooling me by asking more and more time in units of an hour every hour till 2 pm when they finally gave the 2nd room. I had booked a tour to Sentosa from the same hotel and that departed at 2 pm and hence requested that I need to freshen up before going out. No rationale or logic seemed to dawn on the reception staff. Besides there are a few guys on the front desk who are pretty rude and actually not suited for hospitality business but also there were a few ladies who could atleast empathize with you if not help you out of the situation. The rooms were nothing great. Old furnitures, old carpet, old 1980 type television set, no phone in the bathroom and avoid looking at the curtains carefully - for you might see blood stains and other dirty stuff. Walls were more or less clean for my room. Bathroom was redone and hence wasn't that bad. Lighting was appropriate but quality of toileteries was sub-standard. Breakfast was good. They have a decent menu to choose from and the quality of food was also satisfactory. I didnt eat anything else in the hotel. Wifi was free for me in the rooms. You have to crib a little for the complimentary water bottles (for GHA members - water bottles was complimentary). The travel desk in the hotel (RMZ tours) is good. They pick you up from the hotel and take you on guided tours. I did quite a few tours with them and was happy with their behavior and quality of the tours. The guys charge you reasonably for the tours and if you plan to make your arrangements you won't save much. Besides, the hotel itself, there is a mall (City Square Mall) opposite to the hotel apart from Mustafa. Take a round trip around the hotel, you would find a lot of eating places. There are a few telephone booths on the road side offering you the easiest and cheapest mode of calling - insert coins and talk. Ah.. dont forget to prefix 019 before dialling the country code. It's not mentioned there in English. Overall Singapore is a good place to visit especially your kids would love them. If you can spend a little more than Park Royal, you can choose from Pan Pacific or some other hotels on the Orchard road may be preferrable but season time things could be very different :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Manika_Gupta
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 days in Park royal, Kitchner road from 26th Dec - 30th Dec and our experience was wonderful. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Hotel was very neat and clean as expected. Overall a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good for short stay in Little India and very close to Mustafa shopping”
Reviews.Author: smartaus
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights in early December 2011. Room is comfortable. Had problem with Air-con, was pretty cold, tried to increase the temperature and finally switched off. Still there was cooling in the room. We didn't complain to get it fixed for our short stay. Common area carpet is dirty. Free parking is added advantage. We checked out and was given on request extended parking for almost half a day - at no extra charge. Free wireless internet - slow at times and the connection only worked, if the ipad is close to the main room entrance and not on all places in the room. For Indians who wants to stay in Little India and also do shopping at Mustafa which is next door, this hotel is ideal. Perfect for Vegetarians, as you have lot of Indian eateries around Mustafa. Book in advance to get a better deal. We would like to come back.

Reviews.Title: “New Year Stay”
Reviews.Author: kategerry
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from 29th December to 2nd January and is the 2nd time that we've stayed here. We took advantage of their festive deal and got a superior King room with free sparkling wine, breakfast and complimentary biscuits. The room itself was large and airy with plenty of storage areas. This hotel is located in the Little India area of Singapore. It's right next door to the Mustafa Centre, which is a 24 hour shopping centre. The area itself can get a big crowded, especially on Sundays as this is when the migrant workers get their day off. Being 6ft tall and blonde, I certainly got a few stares whilst walking around Little India, after a while it didnt bother me as I did stick out like a sore thumb!! There is an MRT station across from the hotel and this allows easy access to the major tourist areas of Singapore, ie Orchard Road, Clarke Quay, Marina Bay. It's a very cheap and quick way of travelling round Singapore and you get a 1 dollar refund when you hand back your ticket, which only costs around 2 dollars!!! During our stay we visited Marina Bay and the huge hotel with the skypark running across the top which looks like a big boat. I would recommend that you visit the skypark, it costs 20 dollars and is well worth it, the views are extraordinary, you get a 360 degree view of Singapore, beware though, if you have a drink in the bar here, they charged us 36 dollars for 2 small bottles of tiger beer, this is about £18. It was worth it for the view alone!! Talking of alcohol, Singapore can be very expensive if you want to go out for a drink, especially the more upmarket areas such as Clarke Quay and Orchard Road. Right next door to the hotel is a food court area, which has seating outside and this is where the locals drink. You can get a large bottle of Tiger beer for under 6 dollars, which is around £3, we drank here all the time and on talking terms with the staff. Across from the hotel is a shopping mall which has a fantastic food court. I had the most amazing bento box with terriyaki chicken, miso soup, jasmine rice, salad and tempura prawns for 5 dollars!!! I've eaten the same thing in Glasgow and paid over £10 for it. It was amazing! There are also some fantastic Indian restaurants in this area which are great value for money. When I return to Singapore in the future, I'll definately stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Not upto the mark”
Reviews.Author: sur p
Reviews.Content: I stayed for about 12 days during last month. Though I could not find any real problem , I somehow felt that they can treat the customers better. Apart from the Wide smile, and Have a nice day greetings they really never cared of some ncecssary things.Please not that if you reach early morning, you will have to wait till afternoon (12 - 2) to get your room if you have not booked it for the previos day itslef. I landed at 6 am and had to wait all the way till 1pm to get my room. The staff at the reception are never bothered for any matter. All they know is to give a cheeky smile and tell sorry for the inconvenience caused and they are back in business. They dont care who you are. Breakfast is the same stuff for all the 12 days. Not even a single menu has changed. I wonder whther is that how it is supposed to be in all star hotels. While checkign out only I came to know that I can avail a membership offer when I stay upto about 10nights. I said that I just stayed here 11 nights and whether I am entitled for that. They said no, as I did not fill up that form while checking in itself, and my 11 nights does not count. Ridiculous. I did not knwo it before. And coming to the plus points: Very safe. you leave your golden ring on the table, it will stay there till you come back, untouched. Middle of little India and Mustafa shopping option. eleive me , it is worth to stay close to that. MRT train station just as you cross the road. really helpful if you want a cheap and faster way of commuting.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Do It”
Reviews.Author: SAKA4
Reviews.Content: My family of four and friends with a family of five booked four nights here, the hotel was emailed requesting non smoking and connecting rooms to accommodate the children with the parents. When we arrived to check in, no record of the request was found and four rooms on several levels were offered. These room were not yet available even at 15:00hrs when check in is 14:00hrs. Staff were not very helpful to either family in relocating to suitable rooms. We ended up with our children sleeping a couple of doors down from our room, which was not ideal. We had just come from the Federal Hotel in KL where although older, the staff were fantasic and rooms were superior. We will not be staying at a Parkroyal in Singapore again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: AviatorDXB
Reviews.Content: Hotel is laocated aproximately 20-30 minutes from Changi A/port, next to Mohomed Mustafa 24hr shopping mall. Reception and concierge staff were friendly (Although some concierge staff could do with a smile), however appears "Lost" when an out of the way question about the city is asked. i.e. "what time does shopping malls close in Singapore/ Any late night restaurants open at this time (At 22.30hrs)" ect. Every staff member would provide contradictory info, we finaly chose to find our own way as we felt they clearly did not have a clue. Rooms were above average, Clean and in perfect functioning order. Room service was just average and reasonably priced. Attention to detail was a missing factor in this department. i.e Fresh "milk" was forgotton with our breakfast order and needed a reminder. Very good in terms of security as a key card is required to even access the floors. Hotel also offers an elevator for disabled travellers from ground level (Car stop) upto the lobby which is a few steps away. There is also a baggage belt from car stop to hotel main entrance which I found innovative. Another obvious shortfall was the cleanliness of hotel elevators. trash which included combs, key cards, paper was often seen inside elevators. We wanted a screwdriver to fix a toy, we wanted porter service. we asked for all these via the hotel operator and services were provided at record time. Appreciated it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly acceptable”
Reviews.Author: TheloniusAgain
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a week on business in 2011. Hotel is well run, clean, safe, and in a great location. No problems with staff, elevators, or billing. Hotel is very close to the MRT subway. Didn't try the hotel restaurant because the hotel is located immediately adjacent to hawker stalls on Kitchener Road that offered really good authentic Indian food.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, good location, decent amenities.”
Reviews.Author: George313
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed for 4 nights from 21 to 25 December. We opted to take 2 Orchid Club rooms which came with complimentary breakfasts and use of the Orchid Club lounge, including evening cocktails. I am surprised that Billi_BNE felt that the Orchid Club lounge staff couldn't be bothered with her. We found the staff in the Club lounge to be warm, friendly and extremely helpful to my whole family. In fact, I would say that they were the ones who made our stay extra pleasant. In addition, I dropped a bunch of keys in the lobby when I checked out yesterday. I only discovered my loss after arriving home in Sarawak last night. I emailed the hotel this afternoon and, a couple of hours later, I received a call from Ms Cindy Wong, the Guest Relations Manager to inform me that they had found it. She promised to courier the keys back to me the next day. Now, that's great service for you. The location of the hotel is good because the MRT is so near. It was a direct MRT ride to Vivocity in Harbourfront and, from there, a short hop to Sentosa. Very convenient. Likewise, Mustaffa Centre is directly behind the hotel - lots of bargains. City Square is just across the road. I agree that the hotel breakfast is nothing to shout about. It was bacon and eggs for me every morning. After 3 days, we decided to forgo the complimentary breakfast to try the local food around the hotel. There are eating places all round the hotel and I advise you to try them out. If I have one gripe with the hotel, it is the shower. Even on the Club floor, the shower is in a narrow high bathtub. Because the tub is narrow, you will keep brushing against the wet shower curtain and I find that quite unpleasant. Surely for the Orchid Club floor, they can install proper shower rooms. All told, the location is good, the amenities is just okay but the friendly and helpful staff is what will make me return to the hotel on my next visit. Hopefully, they will have done something about the shower curtains.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location @ Farrer MRT ~ Access to Orchard Rd & Airport”
Reviews.Author: Newo
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel next to Farrer MRT station and one stop to Little India. New shopping centre opposite and many other shopping arcades on nearby streets. Rooms were clean comfortable in excellent condition. Excellent hot and cold buffet breakfasts Lunch and dinner menu choices. Very good buffet dinners Tour desk in lobby. Stayed August 2007, October 2008 & April 2009. Business x 3 & Solo Will stay again and recommended to family, friends and business colleagues.

Reviews.Title: “Little India”
Reviews.Author: tfgclub
Reviews.Content: For a Park Royal this was a massive disappointment because I am sure we were the only non indians staying here. Our travel agent booked us here by mistake and what a mistake it was! The only upside was it is next door to the all night Mustafa shopping centre. The inter connecting rooms were bizarrely set up. You enter both rooms from the first room of two single beds and a fold out bed. There is nothing else in the room apart from the beds and a gap which opens onto the main room and bathroom. Both rooms were mouldy and musty and I had management clean the room again before we went back in. Apparently no other family rooms available. Fittings broken in bathrooms, toilet running continually and the kids had to tramps through the main room to use the one toilet during the day and the middle of the night. The old out bed resembled something out of the dark ages and had to ask for it to be swapped due to the mattress collapsing. Staff on front counter were average. For anyone out there this is located in Little India - Singapore

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel, perfectly located”
Reviews.Author: jai_vish
Reviews.Content: I visited Singapore sometime back. There I stayed at the Park Royal. It's a good budget hotel located right in front of the little India and the Mustafa Mall. Rooms were clean and spacious. Breakfast buffet was also good with decent spread. However, the staff was not very co-operative. Our flight was scheduled to land after mid-night and therefore requested my travel agent for an early check-in. He told me that he had done so and the Hotel has agreed for the same. We reached hotel at around 5:30 in the morning and requested for early check-in, but got our room by 11 only. I asked my travel agent to contact the hotel but he told me that they don't have rooms and will be available only after normal check-in time. So just advice others to confirm there room etc., beforehand. Apart from this I did not face any other major problem and had enjoyed my stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Staff don't really care”
Reviews.Author: Billi_BNE
Reviews.Content: Great location, but clearly the staff culture is not to go the extra mile with guests. As other reviewers have mentioned the location is good, opposite a new small shopping mall and a MRT station. Head the other way and you can experience Little India and lots of great smells and little shops and restaurants. However the hotel is way off the mark in terms of it's brand. We stayed in Parkroyal Malaysia prior to this stay and we were extremely let down. We opted for Orchid Club level, and this was a waste of time. We were put in a room that looked like the decor hadn't been upgraded since the 80's. Shower over a high bathtub anyone? Bathroom that was tinier than those you see in European cities. The mattress on the bed was like wood - I love hard mattresses but this was ridiculous. The Orchid Club lounge was like a small function room, again with peeling carpet and dated furniture. The food selection was average and the staff really couldn't be bothered with us. Clearly management hasn't empowered the staff to go the extra mile or use their initiative. In the four days we were there we never saw any staff member at the gym and a number of pieces of equipment weren't working, but we had no one to tell. We were supposed to get a paper, and we got one on one out of the four days we were there. No big things on their own, but they all added up to a lack of interest in guest wellbeing. For a 5 star brand this is unacceptable, they are certainly more of 3 star level. As part of the Parkroyal brand, the level of furnishings and staff helpfulness is at odds with other hotels we have stayed in from the same chain. You chose a chain based on the expectation that the management have built a similar culture in each property which will pass through to the staff and in turn they way they treat the guest. Not sure if I will chose Parkroyal again based on this experience. To their credit the manager contacted me immediately after I completed their survey, however that is the only follow up I've received i.e. the usual standard we are sorry for your experience speil. When will we start to see real results i.e. if you pay for a product and the product doesn't do what it's supposed to (like a computer or similar) then you get a refund. Hotels get to keep the revenue you provide them, even if they don't provide you with the type of service they market themselves to deliver. Anyway Singapore is a great place to spend a few days, lots to do - the Flyer is fun, and the Zoo is amazing. The little restaurants around Little India are a wonderful surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but the hotel is just average”
Reviews.Author: A_Screw_Loose
Reviews.Content: We thought that we got a good deal, but Parkroyal at Kitchener is obviously selling location first and hotel comfort 2nd. Pros:- 1. Directly opposite the MRT Station Farrer Park (Purple North East Line) - This is quite a convenient MRT station to be at as it is two stops away from Doby Ghaut interchange, same line as Little India & Chinatown (shiny trinkets for the ones back home) and same line as Harbourfront (towards Vivo City and Sentosa) 2. Directly opposite the City Square Mall . Never hurts to have a mall right opposite the hotel, especially for digestion pills after the fantastic chilli crab at Mattar Road! Also 7-Eleven is right around the corner. 3. Little India - If you have a hankering for Indian cuisine, then you are at the right spot! Also Mustafa Center is nearby which has almost everything. Worth to pay a visit! Cons: 1. What Wi-fi? 2. Breakfast menu is very average like straight out of Asian Hotel 101 - got your dim sum, fried eggs, bacon, cornflakes. Nothing exciting catches the eye and the taste-buds 3. Superior room feels like a budget hotel - Hard mattress, no hair dryer, tiny CRT TV, noisy aircon, no weighing scale, no complimentary mineral water bottles provided. Also toothbrush only upon request! Also I got a corner room, with its sharp angles poking at my imaginary chi flow where I sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good location, let down by poor food and staff”
Reviews.Author: TezzMezz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights while on a business trip. First the positives: - Large and clean hotel. - Excellent gym and equipment - Steam bath is good too - 5 minute stroll to Farrer Park MRT station - Close proximity to Little India (which is a pro and con in itself) - Very convenient 7-Eleven store just down stairs - 24 hour Money Changer nearby - Free WiFi! - Well-appointed rooms with amenities, stocked bar fridge, working desk, in-room safe, iron & board. Now come the areas where they can definitely improve on: - Breakfast was less than inspiring. Definitely not worth the extra S$20. While the spread is not too bad, the food just lacked flavour and oomph. Was quite disappointed. - On some nights, there are express/tour busses waiting for passengers in the area which meant plenty of people walking around the sides of the hotel. Was extremely crowded during that time. - I had a room right at the edge (Deluxe?) on the 18th floor and the WiFi signal was kinda weak. - Checkout staff was robotic. A smile and friendly remark would go a long way in the hospitality industry. - One evening, i walk down to the gym area in search of the steam bath. I went down wearing the hotel-provided in-room slippers (those white cotton ones). Just at the door of the gym, I asked a staff member where the steam bath was. She just motioned at my slippers and said "Not allow". Not an acceptable response (even if I was going to the gym in those slippers, which I was not) I would stay here again, but would try to negotiate for a room only rate without breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel in budget”
Reviews.Author: SASHA W
Reviews.Content: simple and ok but decent hotel for staying short nights and to walk around little india and do shopping nearby for all latest gadgets and supermarkets but best for north indian and Malaysian to singapore cuisines

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel to stay in Little India!”
Reviews.Author: amitbakhru
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel... seemed like the best one to stay in Little India. Very well located. Just one block from the nearest MRT station (subway). Easy to get a cab. It has a nice lobby and the rooms, although not very spacious, were kept neat and clean. We had a room on the 17th floor which we liked very much. Even though you won't get a very nice view, but still its much better getting a room on the higher floors. Breakfast was good enough with lots of options.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in Little India”
Reviews.Author: NewTrip123
Reviews.Content: It's a typical 4 star Hotel in Little India. My room was not the newest renovated room, but clean, spacious and everything in I needed. Had high floor room with nice view. Very friendly and helpful staff. Internet with reasonable speed. Breakfast was oK, good Asian selection, breakfast room is very bussy and not this nice to have a long relaxing breakfast. MRT station nearby (entrance in opposite building), convenient to go everywhere in the city or just take a taxi. My special price/package was good value for money for Singapore 4 star Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not what was promised”
Reviews.Author: SandeepSasi
Reviews.Content: After having read many good reviews about this hotel, me and my wife decided to stay at this hotel for our honeymoon..As a matter of fact, I just checked in to this Hotel and I am having a serious urge to write a review from the hotel room.. We booked this hotel about a month and a half ago for a double room..When we checked in the room today, the staff say they dont have any kingsize bed room free, so they upgraded us to a room with 2 seperate beds..After a tiring travel, and many requests, we are still sitting and waiting for them to change our room and that too without any gurantees..They should not have taken our bookings if they were to cause this much inconvenience..Let me see how this goes..

Reviews.Title: “JamesTK”
Reviews.Author: jamestk95
Reviews.Content: We have visited Singapore in November 2011, the hotel is good. I have seen some people complain about time consuming check-in, but it was hardly 5 mints for our 2 rooms. I would definitely like to stay again in the future and I have recommended my friends. Daily 2 mineral water bottles Excellent Breakfast Buffet. Nice Location - Next to Mustafa Shopping Centre and. Popular for Indian tourists, with Indian Restaurants, Food court. Bus service is available to Kulalumpur.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Ankit2011
Reviews.Content: We visited Singapore in November 2011 and to our delight, the hotel was as good as we heard about it. Initially we were given the corner room with 2 single beds (joined together), however on request, the room was changed to the one having superior king size bed. I have seen some people complain about time consuming check-in, but it was hardly 5 mins for us. Would definitely like to stay again in the future. Become a GHA member before staying to enjoy free internet and 2 mineral water bottles every day. Pros: 1) Excellent Breakfast Buffet 2) Nice Location - Next to Mustafa Shopping Centre and close to Ferrer Park MRT Station

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: lenny37
Reviews.Content: Hotel located along kitchener road, amidst little india. Popular for indian tourists, but not exclusively. The popular mustafa centre is 5mins walk away. Right across the hotel is the city square mall and farrer park mrt station. Very convenient for shopping, restaurants, food court ect. Rooms are decent. Bed is comfortable. Deluxe rooms are well renovated and modern. Breakfast spread is very good. Rooms come with free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “extremely busy hotel”
Reviews.Author: vb05
Reviews.Content: Extremely busy hotel,perpetually crowded foyer ,apparently this hotel is a preferred choice for conferences and meetings etc..Staff is overworked,keen to help out,though.I stayed there because of lack of availability elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “"Best place to stay in Little India"”
Reviews.Author: AbhishekRanchi
Reviews.Content: Location wise best hotel for Indians specially vegetarians in Singapore. More then 35 Indian food restaurant within 5 Mins walk from hotel. Quality of service is not great but rooms are Clean , neat and decent. Checking Inn is very time taking. All markets like Mustafa Market, Bugis Mall, etc are very near by.

Reviews.Title: “Club rooms are small and tired. Customer service is low.”
Reviews.Author: BB37
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 8 nights at this hotel in a very tired club room and will not recommend this hotel unless you want to be in the middle of "little India". Very poor customer service.

Reviews.Title: “A luxury hotel in the most convenient location in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: shobhashkumar
Reviews.Content: We had a 5 night stay in Hotel Parkroyal on Kitchener Road in Singapore. We were on a family sightseeing trip to Singapore. The one and only unpleasant thing that we faced in this hotel was on the very first day when we checked in. We had a confirmed reservation and we reached hotel by 11 AM after a long journey from Mumbai via Kualalumpur. We were very tired and sleepy. The reception staff told that we had to wait a couple of hours as the room was not ready. It was so painful for us as our 4 year old child desperately wanted to sleep. At one moment we felt regret booking at this hotel. Finally we got the room key at about 2 PM. Our all uncomfortable feeling vanished when we entered the room. The superior room we booked was very spacious with king size bed and a large drawing area to move around. Room was extremely clean and the toilets 100% hygenic. The staff were very courteous and guiding. Hotel serves buffet breakfast in which a lot of indian vegetarian dishes were available. The negative point was that everyday the items were same. But the dishes were tasty and hygenic. One of the most important plus points of this hotel is its proximity to Little India. Since we are south Indian vegetarians, the location proved good for us due to its closeness to some of the most famous south indian veg restaurants in Singapore such as Komala Vilas, Ananda Bhawan etc. Just behind the hotel is Singapore's famous super market Mustafa Centre where you will get each and everything. In totality the stay in Park Royal was very pleasant and comfortable which is still being cherished by us.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location...”
Reviews.Author: abhishek_nambiar
Reviews.Content: First thing which comes to mind is : Nice, clean & awesome location. It is a good hotel situated in the heart of little india. Rooms are quite decent, neat & clean with bath tubs :-) Checking in could take quite some time as lot of people book this hotel. I got a shock when during check in they asked for 600 SGD for two rooms as deposit (refundable)!! I had come only for 4 days & all my tours were prepaid, so i was carrying only 800 SGD. But they agreed to take only 200 SGD after some talking. Buffet breakfast on this hotel is quite goood but personally i did not like the indian food they served in the breakfast. Things like vada, sambhar, idli did not taste that good but i guess i was not in india :D... Hotel being in little india has lot of eating options near by. esp. for vegetarians lot of options are there like sarvana bhawan, sagar ratna,etc etc.. lot of indian joints giving indian food at reasonable rates. But personally i did not like the food at sagar ratna :-( I would recommend sarvana bhawan as food was really good & tasty.. Travelling is also not a problem as the nearest MRT Farrer station is quite nearby, actually just opp the hotel. Avoid taking taxi's as these will cost you a lot & travelling is easier & cheap with MRT. Overall it was a nice place to stay, comfortable & good location but opt for a room other than the base / standard one..

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel for tourists particularly who would like Indian food and do shopping in Mustafa”
Reviews.Author: petanimal
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is very near to the most happening place for tourists in singapore for shopping Mustafa 24 hours shopping center. Musthafa center is in the backside of the hotel and people actually see the tourist spots in the day and do shopping in the night staying in Park royal. The morning buffet is the best buffet food i have tasted abroad, lots of indian cuisine foods, and plenty of continental varieties only regret was the restaurant is too crowded in the morning hours and seat availability is sometimes a problem. Also the tables and floors were not clean because of too much rush in the morning hours. the hotel ground floor had some shopping and travel agent which was helpful in my further travel to indonesia.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: Kunal5988
Reviews.Content: If you are an Indian, you are gonna love this place, because this place is adjacent to little India and you can find all kinds of Indian food (specially Vegetarian food). The 24 hr Mustafa mall is right behind the hotel which i think is the best place to sho for cheap products in singapore. The rooms were neat and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MIRAHEgypt
Reviews.Content: The hotel is average in terms of rooms , restaurant , staff , but the worst things are : 1- the corridor between room & lift smells like mold , it's really awfull !!! 2- When i get into the room , the air condition was very high and u have no choice either u get a flu & that's what happened to me or u shut it completely . 3- the pillow cover's wasn't clean & I had to write to room service a note to change it . 4- It seems that some of the receptionnists are trainees so sometimes they cannot give u a direct or clear answer for what u ask , although there are some qualified ones that can really help you .

Reviews.Title: “Best for Indians”
Reviews.Author: shyam105
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in Little India. This is the best hotel in little India. Close to Indian resturants and the famous Mustafa it is an idal location for Indian who come as tourists. There is a Metro station right opposite which can take to all parts of Singapore. The Buffet Breakfast spread is good and has some Indian dishes also.

Reviews.Title: “good place for people who like indian food”
Reviews.Author: pramod1313
Reviews.Content: excellent place to stay , as we are indian and purely vegetarians so this hotel is surrounded by indian restaurants of all kinds that is...south indian , north indian and for breakfast i would recommend murugan idli which is right behind park royal. also there is mustafa shopping centre , right behind park royal where everything is reasonably priced and they have a lot of variety.

Reviews.Title: “Upset”
Reviews.Author: starlite88
Reviews.Content: I came in here to view the opinions on this property, but saphire4 seems to have gone off tangent he probably needs to be exposed more perhaps the Chinese individual thought he was dumb I seriously doubt sapphires English is anymore superior than his considering he found it more comfortable in his communication with an Indian gentlemen. If he wanted exemplary standards in service he should have checked into the hyatt or shangri la, in life you can't have beer budget with champagne dreams. I think his review is baseless and shows prejudice towards another ethnicity.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in a nice location”
Reviews.Author: saphire4
Reviews.Content: Park Royal is a nice hotel located near Farrer Park MRT Station. It is also very near to Mustafa Center and City Square Mall. I stayed in November and faced only a few problems. Firstly, the Chinese guy in the frontdesk was dumb. He spoke poor English and had bad communication skills. I later came after 4 hours and spoke with another Front desk guy who was Indian and very helpful. Secondly, the mattress was not comfortable at all. Thirdly, the TV channels in the hotel were bogus. Instead of showing good news channels like Al Jazeera, C.N.N , good movie and entertainment channels they showed the hopeless and boring ones. The swimming pool in the hotel was good. Mostly I liked the location of this 4 star hotel. It is close to Farrer Park MRT Station and also near Mustafa and City Square mall. Actually Farrer park MRT is located under the City Square Mall. There are lots of places to eat withing the walking distance of the Hotel.. The Hotel was crowded with tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: MagnJohn
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights with my 2 small children and their grandparents We thoroughly enjoyed our holiday Staff very friendly and helpful, pool area very nice, kids loved the splash pool Would definitely recommend this hotel to any family on a holiday stopover

Reviews.Title: “Nice place- good location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Anutosh
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our friends and family. Very nice property, centrally located. The Farrer park MRT access is across the road. we arrived around 9 am and they allowed us to check in early which is excellent service. The rooms are clean and quiet. This is more than adequate for the tourists or business people alike who are out the entire day. The travel desk is well informed and helpful. We wanted to explore on our own and they guided us well knowing fully well that we may not book the tours etc through them. Good professional approach. Proximity to eating joints, city mall (across the road) and Mustafa on the other side is an added advantage. Little India is walking distance which has many vegetarian joints. We wanted but couldn't manage to try the hotel restaurants. Will keep that for the next visit. Free Wi-Fi was available throughout the hotel though the connectivity speed was not that great, but useable. We found the place good and value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice place”
Reviews.Author: StrawbsvanHardi
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a 3 night stopover in Singapore. It was great. We arrived at 8am and had emailed in advance - they allowed us to check in early which was brilliant service. The staff were superb throughout. The hotel isn't 5 star luxury but that is reflected in the price. It offers exactly what you need for a city break. We were on the 19th floor and the room was really spacious, good views of Singapore. The breakfast was excellent. So much choice. Location on the edge of Little India was great (and near MRT stop) but taxis are cheap in Singapore so it is easy to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Beauty with Luxury and Comfort!”
Reviews.Author: jackie_rup
Reviews.Content: PARK Royal on Kitchener road is one of the most amazing properties in Singapore for travellers who need luxury as well as comfort and privacy at an amazing prices,also if you book your room well in advance, you get an amazing discounts as well on parkroyal website, best for Indians who want to live in a nearby or where community persists, very near to little india, Mustafa market and even convenient with local transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: tayalmanu
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week and found it very comfortable. The room was spacious enough, very clean and well maintained. The staff was very courteous and helpful. The hotel is just perfectly located - Mustafa is right at the back, Little India and many Indian restaurants in the vicinity (walking distance) and MRT station also just 3-4 minutes walk away! There is a mall right opposite to the hotel so all shopaholics can spend time there. Hotel offers a nice buffet breakfast with many choices. Overall, a very good stay and I would recommend this to others.

Reviews.Title: “Heart of Little India”
Reviews.Author: Anil29
Reviews.Content: Great location next to the Mustafa Centre which gives the best Forex rates. The hotel is a stone's throw away from the place. Courteous staff and very helpful in meeting your needs. Got a room on the Club floor which is exclusive to Members. Good Breakfast. Rooms very very spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Best aircon in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: MrsHotrox
Reviews.Content: Upgraded to this from a very seedy hotel a block away and were delighted with the improvement. Located in the bustling Little India area, opposite the City Square Mall, the Park Royal is an oasis of calm in a mad, jostling part of town. Cool, spacious lobby, helpful staff, nice clean rooms and a lovely pool. The room rates were not cheap, but it was worth the extra money for a clean, modern room with all mod cons. The aircon was a real necessity in a steaming city like Singapore and in fact it was so good I had to put on an extra layer one night! Would definitely recommend, but worth chasing down a deal on the price.

Reviews.Title: “Lovery Hotel will start here again”
Reviews.Author: Sorrynan
Reviews.Content: this Hotel is Lovely very close to Trains over the road that takes you where ever you want to go the room was big. A Lovely big king size bed .Food was good.The girls at the front desk was great with our tours Lovely big Motel.Well start there again. Judy. Wauchope NSW

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed it”
Reviews.Author: Kelly P
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Singapore. We found the hotel to be quite spacious and comfortable. The room fit out was a bit tired to be honest but it was spacious and the linen was good. The pool is really nice, the staff were always friendly and helpful. It's well located. Suggest you book directly through the hotel for a much better room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for Australian family with teenage boys”
Reviews.Author: OzfamilyPerthHills
Reviews.Content: This was a good experience for our family as the rooms were spacious and divided into two sleeping areas, two adults and two teenage boys. This hotel was superbly located close to the MRT and Mustafa Centre. The breakfast was a good start to the day and had everything we needed. We appreciated the colourful diversity of Little India and enjoyed the vibrant nature of the Hotel as a choice destination for Indian Travellers, even though we are not Indian. The rooms were a quiet haven at the end of each day of exploration and the pool was a lovely place to unwind and cool down. The staff were efficient and helpful and at all times provided us with a welcoming atmosphere. We recommend this hotel to fellow Australian travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: praveenrp
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Parkroyal on Kitchener for 6 nights at the Orchid Club room. We were on vacation with a 3 year old. The hotel is conveniently located and has easy access to the MRT (2 mins walk to the ferrer park station). Right behind the hotel are a variety of Indian eateries (Anand Bhavan, Saravana Bhavan and a number of other indian restaurants) all withing 2-4 mins of walking distance. Shoppers will have a field day with Mustafa center, the 24 hour center is right behind the hotel. The hotel was clean and comfortable, the staff were above average. The buffet breakfast had a lot of variety. Vegetarians have options as they make good Pratas (similar to the Kerala Parota, but smaller and much nicer) and Stew and some south Indian breakfast items apart from the continental breakfast options, fruit, juices, cereal etc. I must say that the Orchid club was convenient with Coffee, Tea, juices and cookies available through the day. It also includes hot snacks and alcoholic beverages from 6 in the evening for a couple of hours.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel for Shopping Lovers & Business Travelers”
Reviews.Author: Theea_11
Reviews.Content: Really Excellent hotel for those who loves to shop and for business travelers. The hotel is just beside Mostafa shopping center which is 24 hour open. Excellent service Very reasonable. Having all facilities which is required for any Business travelers. Rooms are very clean and breakfast is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Only family hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Leaellen
Reviews.Content: This was the only hotel we could find in Singapore to accommodate a family of four. There are two separate sleeping areas in the family rooms, so plenty big enough for a short stay. The MRT across the road is very close and gives easy, wonderful access to all parts of the city. The rooms are in need of a coat of paint but other than that, clean and tidy. Worst part was the buffet breakfast in the downstairs lobby - very little Western food and of pretty poor quality. Being in Little India, the majority of hotel occupants were Indian, so the food was pretty much catered to their needs and not westerners. Our booking through Qantas included a 20% voucher off a-la-carte food purchased, however they would not accept this for breakfast. We would not have paid full price for the dreadful food if we had known this. Go across the road to the shopping mall for breakfast and you will find better quality and cheaper food.

Reviews.Title: “Quite good value for 4 star in Little India”
Reviews.Author: OliviaSpencerBower
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Parkroyal on Kitchener as part of an SIA stopover. It is at the top edge of Little India, in the thick of it really, and most of the customers seem to be Indian package tours and some Australians. If you like Little India it is the place to stay, but if you want Orchard Road shopping it rather too far away. (As the guide books recommend, you need to use taxis to get around if you are on a short stay, so this need not matter much). Little India is a strongly mono-ethnic zone (with mainly men visible) and is not very tourist-friendly for visitors with different background. The hotel is showing its age a bit, but is comfortable enough. Like many such hotels it is hard to get double rooms, as opposed to twins with a fixed console between the beds. The beds were soft enough and the airconditioning unobtrusive. Wifi was free and available without password or registration, which is a big plus, given the number of hotels that see this as an opportunity to charge extra. There was a lot of fussing over bags which may be fine if you have a lot and need help, but if you are an independent minded traveller travelling you would rather take them to your rooms themselves, and not have to wait for your post-12-hour-flight shower. Breakfast at Sing$24 for continental breakfast and $28 for a full one is bad value in our book, so we did not try it. Staff were fine. The lounge had a good singer and accompanist in the evening as we were waiting for our transfer, which made it well worth the price of the drink.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: grj11188
