Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located close to the Farrer Park MRT station and Mustafa shopping center. The rooms are large and well appointed and include free wi-fi. The gym is modern and the pool a nice way to relax after a hard days work. The staff are warm, friendly and attentive to detail.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, great location hotel”
Reviews.Author: rc28
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during the Singapore Grand Prix, so no discounts, but we did get a free buffet breakfast. Staff are very friendly and very helpful. Housekeeping staff do a good job cleaning the room. Breakfast was included and was great, lots of variety. Hotel lobby is updated, however, the rooms are looking a bit tired. Rooms are clean. For a couple of days the free wifi dropped out in our room, but worked in the hallway. Internet download speeds were very good. Airconditioning was very effective, but thermostat didn't work, so the room got very cold! Easy to switch the A/C off. Location is amazing, very short walk (<5mins) to Farrer Park MRT, across the road from a good shopping centre and 5 mins from Mustafa's 24 Hr shops. Lots of food locations around, from restaurants to Hawker stalls. The gym is extremely well equipped with lots of cardio gear. Although this hotel is looking a bit tired, it is in a great location and good for families.We had a family room, which consisted of 2 rooms (1 with King bed and other room with 2 singles). TV in each room with 1 bathroom off the king bedroom

Reviews.Title: “Nice Staff - Terrible Room”
Reviews.Author: soptom
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 1 night stay (thankfully) at this hotel. We arrived around midnight and to be honest were not expecting much as the hotel wasn't as pricey as some of the others considering it was Grand Prix weekend. We realised that a twin single room had been booked in error and the staff did try to change it but were not able to. We were shown to the 8th floor and when we got to the room I was horrified with what I saw as I still did not expect it to be quite so run down. The furnishings, carpet etc looked like they had not been touched since the 70s. The linen was stained and although the bathroom had been done up it was obvioulsy done on an extreme budget as it was a substandard job. Our best surprise was still to come - I was so exhausted I thought just close you eyes forget the decor and go to sleep. The bed was the worst I have ever had the experience in sleeping on, or rather not sleeping on - it was like sleeping on a concrete slab. I ended up trying to tuck the duvet under me to at least try to soften it a little! I am apalled that a hotel would let rooms out in this state.

Reviews.Title: “Never stay in this hotel.Doggy management. They delected my last comment.They will spoil your holiday.rooms are horrible”
Reviews.Author: appu t
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot and this hotel is horrible hotel I have ever stayed. Just name is hotel but runs like motel. Rooms are so old and horrible and service, no one smiles neither will help with your luaguage. The best part is I left the comment in August 2011, and the management delected that comment from the trip advisor so that other travellers dont see and know the truth. I believe all the good comments are done within there management to attract more guests. They spoiled my holiday to Singapore. I was there for 2 nights and every night I stayed it was horrible and dirty.It was suppose to be a family holiday but the hotel spoiled it infact I am never going back to singapore just because of Parkroyal singapore.- The general manager should know that he needs to act rather than do nothing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Easily Accessible”
Reviews.Author: zap10020406
Reviews.Content: The place is really nice, but April-June/July is not a great time to be there cos its filled with Indian families with a lotttt of children and makes the entire place extremely noisy... Great breakfast spread... 5 mins walk to the MRT, 2mins walk to Mustafa Shopping centre (24-hrs) and a whole lot of other Indian food joints... Check-in/Check-out takes a bit of a time and the hotel needs to have more elevators, cos the waiting time for an elevator can go as high as upto 20-mins during their peak season...

Reviews.Title: “Terrible room, rude staff, food poisoning”
Reviews.Author: jock h
Reviews.Content: Booked a double room, on arrival was informed that they did not have one but we could change rooms in the morning when one became available. Spent terrible night in room with some loud machine emmitting a loud pitch sound all night. (hair dryer and various other bits and bobs did not work) In the morning male staff member extremely rude and stated that moving rooms was not an option as the hotel can never guarantee that you get what you book for.(???) For 3 days I begged to be moved to no avail. On checking out after another conversation with the manager I was given a complimentary lunch in lieu of double room /room with things the worked/ room without noise. That was a disaster - first time after 25 years of annual vists to Singapore I got really bad food poisoning. NEVER AGAIN

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: shidduj
Reviews.Content: It was a nice hotel, with good staff and service. However I was not happy with the way front desk worked. No smiling people there and always busy and making people wait. Rest was best. Restaurants and food was great. In the heart of city so connectivity was also not a problem. Will stay in park royal if given a chance again.

Reviews.Title: “nice place to stay if you like to be in little India”
Reviews.Author: kamathrk
Reviews.Content: Park ROYAL is located in little India. In fact the so called Mustafa shopping center is right next door to the hotel. It is also very close to the metro - Farrer Park station. You can take this line to go to Changi airport or Vivo city mall, from where you can go to Sentosa island. . I stayed in the hotel for 5 nights.front desk staff is nice. I wanted a single queen size bed and it was not available on the first day. They took my request to transfer me the next day to the room with queen size bed, which they did. Room was of decent size, not too small and not too large. Somehow I did not like the bathrooms and interiors. It was not upto the 4 star rating. If you sign up for their membership program, you get two complimentary bottles of water per day. You can ask for it while checking in. There is TV will many channels, a kettle with sachets to make coffe, tea. if you want to browse internet, it is available at a small charge. Breakfast is available in the ground floor and it is really really really big spread, You can get anything from south indian Idli, vada, dosa to sausages, baked beans, hash browns, noodles, dumplings etc.,, Breakfast was my biggest meal when i stayed at this hotel. If you want to try any other Indian restaurants then every thing is at stones throw. there is Komalas, saravan bhavan, sangeethas, etc.,,There concierge service to hail the taxis etc.. There is a travel desk, if you are interested in organizing a tour of singapore. You can use their laundromat for about $14. In fact the washing machine is so big that I could fit in my weeks cloth with one load. You can use swimming pool and gym. Swimming pool is also decent size. If you are interested in message and reflexology, the services are available at a cost. They also organised to keep the luggage and send it directly to Airport since we were checking out and going Star Cruise for 2 nights before flying back to India. Therefore, we did not have the headache of carrying the bulky suitcases on the cruise. Off course this service comes at a cost. Finally, my recommendation is that if you like to stay closer to little India and do shopping leisurely at Mustafa this is the place. But as you know, since little India is not so happening place and is bit crowded, if you like to stay in posh area get yourself booked in better hotel at Clark quay area.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: blueplanettraveler
Reviews.Content: I was there in 2009 during F1 weekend. It's near MRT station so going places is easy. If you like Indian food, there are many small Indian restaurants that will suit your appetite and budget. From the cheap to the more expensive. Right across the street there's a mall that has Sushi Tei, my favorite sushi place!! For Singapore, the hotel is not too pricey, as everything else is in S'pore, but it's always fun to visit as you have lots of things to do and places to see. I was alone but they mistakenly put me in a 2 beds room, but moved me the next day as soon as one available, so it was very nice of the staff. Just a tip, please allow enough time to check out as the line tends to be long and it's a bit time consuming. Just to make sure you have plenty of time to get to the airport or wherever your next destination may be.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: KoushikChakraborty
Reviews.Content: Hotel was situated in a nice location.Nearby was Musatafa Mall which remain opens 24*7.Near to Little India.Rooms were ok but what was bad was the policy of water in the room.Only if you sign up for membership,you are entitled for water and that too only 2 bottles per membership.price was bit high compared to amenties.Overall it was average.

Reviews.Title: “In the works...but some of them are trying their best!”
Reviews.Author: Life101
Reviews.Content: The Hotel and some of its staff are there without doubt to show what customer satisfaction is all about ....one in particular Ms. Radha at the Orchid Club Floor. I found her level of providing service on par with the likes of the Ritz and others....so watch out Parkroyal she might get poached.... Some of the fallbacks of the Hotel is the location of the Orchid Lounge if you are not lucky enough to be in the rooms that take you to the Orchid Club Clounge you have to change lifts. The biggest challenge I feel that Management has to address immediately is that of the Housekeeping Department....it NEEDS WORK lots of it ...could be that the person on the 14th floor did not have her bearings right.....but a lot of shody housekeeping on her part...lack of floor cleaning, lack of cleaning in GENERAL!! Coffee mugs should be cleaned on a daily basis but afraid that was not the case in our one bedroom suite... The Breakfast Buffet had a healthy spread but for people with special requirements or diets the F&B department need to seperate the meets from the vegan dishes. For instance the Pork sausage was in the same area as hash browns and other foods that could have been consumed by vegans or indviduals with speacial diets....however due to the fact that the meats were placed in an open offering area it is very likely that the tongs used to pick up the meat dishes were being contaiminated with the veg dishes....as such for strict purity reasons this was not feasible for some. The Flat screen offered in the room was a bit small I think around 30" but was sufficient for viewing ....had NO ISSUES whatsoever with the NET it worked well and gave great broadband speed.... The pool is not temprature controlled but was clean, there is a small kids pool which does not light up in the evenings, the GYM had upto date equipment Overall I would like to stay here again but Management need to take some indviduals on a customer service crash course.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, even late at night!”
Reviews.Author: MikePax
Reviews.Content: We arrived late at night and the staff were fantastic, especially with us having a 3 year old in tow. Will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Love to stay again when go back to Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Puspal
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well decorated. We had a 3 nights stay here. Support stuffs are helpful. Though some people have problem understanding / speaking English, still they are very welcoming and cooperating. I got early check in this hotel after landing Singapore by the early morning flight of Singapore Airlines, with my wife and kid. Foods are too authentic Singapore food. Still you will love the taste and quantity is more than enough. We took the deluxe room in 17th Floor. The room is mid sized. Clean and well maintained. Bathroom and wardrobe is also well maintained and clean. Room service, cleaning are in time. They are reliable. Good and clean swimming pool,Gym and Restaurant. The breakfast is a feast of foods ranging from south Indian to continental and Chinese and many more. Cab booking facility from hotel is also good. Mustafa shopping plaza is almost behind the hotel. Location of this hotel is fantastic, if you have your family particularly with kid.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel with poor service”
Reviews.Author: Wanderl00st
Reviews.Content: Not a great hotel. Its located in a very crowded area in Singapore. To top it, the service quality is poor to say the least. Would not want to stay in this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: leefee
Reviews.Content: Located in Little India. A must to walk down the Serangoon Road and checkout the colours and aroma (those with sensitive nose might need to take caution). Conveniently next to the Mustafa Centre where you can shop 24-hour. More shopping with the City Square Mall, which is also right next to the hotel. Jump in a cab and ask for Bugis Village. Here, the sells practically everything. A nice place to shop, less crowd compare to Orchard Road. The nearest MRT station is less than 500m away. Booked a Deluxe room for 190SGD (with breakfast). The room were equipped with internet access. Appreciate the complimentary fruit, chocolate and drinking water.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: CanuckinDhaka
Reviews.Content: I apologise for the late review but heh, better late than never ! Park Hotel on Kitchener Road is a solid choice. Hotel has been renovated and rooms are good. Only thing I noticed that could be improved was the lack of sitting space in the lobby. Pool area was pretty much empty so we had the place to oursleves everytime we went. There are rooms to change into which was very convinient. What makes this hotel so worth the money is the location. It can't be beat. I ate breakfast the first day and it was very adequate. The usual egg stations where you can get eggs any way you liked, good choice of breads, cereal, juices, several hot dishes. However, i noiced after several outings that the immediate neigbnorhoold was dotted with little eateries and cafe shops. As a result, I started skipping breakfast and instead frequented these local eating spots. You always know its a good thing when the locals are filling up the place. One place comes to mind is the small kopitiam on the right side of the hotel on the main street which eventually leads to Mustafa, the 24 hour department store. I ate breakfast and lunch there for like 5/7 SIN dollars and it was great. Great Keema and naan fresh off the tandoor. There is a new chic mall right across the street. Those of you who want to stick to the traditional Western fare, are going to love the choice of all the fast food joints. But if you feel a little more bold then there is a great food court serving local cuisines ( I can't remeber the exact floor but its the top most - just go up the escalators till you are hit by all that fantastic aroma.) And if you need to get on the MRT than Ferrer Park station is on your left just past a big Vegetarian Chain restaurant. Very close.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent hotel.... very central location....really lovely....”
Reviews.Author: gemini_lou20
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the ParkRoyal back in mid January 2011, on our way back to Northern Ireland, it was our choice of stoppover, recommended by our travel agent, after a long flight from New Zealand....... on arrival, first impressions were, wow, what a stunning hotel.... and that opinion remained the same!..... when we were there, all the beautiful decorations were being put up for the New Year celebrations..... simply incredible, a huge effort goes into this, no expense spared to have the hotel looking amazing for this celebratory time of year...... a definate must see!.......... The entrance porch and lobby, were imaculate, so many wonderfull floral displays of Orchids.... have since bought these on arrival home too!......... we arrived late evening and the staff were so so helpful, polite and courteous....... nothing was a problem..... our family party consisted of 5, so we had 2 rooms, both very spacious, spotlessly clean, really lovely. As our next flight was late the next evening, and checkout being mid morning, the hotel are very good at allowing you to vacate your room, but hang about until you are ready to leave for your flights, they do this by having secure storage for your baggage to be held, enabling the use of all hotel facilities, pool, lounge, bar, dining room etc..... and room for changing/showering in. The hotel is an easy very short walk from the main big City Center Shopping Mall, I dont think I have ever been anywhere as big, this is a totally eco friendly shopping centre, solar power.... etc etc.... set in beautiful gardens....really lovely, and so much to see inside....so many places to see and visit, sadly we werent there long enough to do very much..... but what we did pack in we loved.............. again as this was the 12/13th January.... all city centre shops were preparing the most wonderful decoratations to welcome the New Year, so its a lovely time of year to see Singapore............... we spent our full day that we did have, shopping,sightseeing, spending time at the lovely pools..... then enjoying a lovely meal in the restaruant before late departure, even then , they have a shuttle service to the airport which is great, and they even come into the waiting lounge and call your name!!! All in all, we would highly recommend this hotel, beautiful surroundings, so clean, luxurious, the staff are a credit to the hotel, with outstanding hospitality, what a welcome..... well worth the visit.... we have the most wonderful memories and photos that will be with us forever of our, all beit short stopover in Singapore, and the ParkRoyal enhanced those memories..... thankyou...

Reviews.Title: “Impersonal service , lack of organisation”
Reviews.Author: PookyBath
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a record of our booking through Travelmood, but did not have a room available for us. We waited nearly 2 hours in a tiny lobby after an 11 hour flight with 3 children. The family room was clearly already booked and eventually we were given interconnecting rooms with a double bed in each- I still had to contact reception to get them to bring another bed for my youngest daughter. After complaining to the duty manager, I was offered a late check out as compensation and then complimentary breakfasts for the 2 days we were there. Generally the service was poor and the welfare of guests does not figure highly in this hotel. Would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay in park Royal Kitchener Road”
Reviews.Author: Santy123
Reviews.Content: We booked the Park Royal for our family stay in Singapore. We chose this hotel based on the recommendation of a friend. W staed therer for 5 nights and overall we were satisfied with the hotel and it met our expectations and requirements Location - The Hotel is located bang in Little India and perhaps the only decent one there(depends on our definition i suppose). It is surrounded by a host of India restaurants which open early and close late. So food was no problem for our kiddo who is rather finicky. Recommended especially for people with specific veg requirements (though we are not). Komala`s restaurant is just a few metres away. The metro station is just opposite the hotel. Mustafa is just behind if one wants to shop buy anything. Most cabs stop in front of the lobby and that is convenient too. Check in process was quick and smooth, given that we had pre booked and paid in advance. Room - We paid a very slight premium and got a room on the 18th floor. The advantage we found out later, is that there are2 separate lifts which service 18th and above floors which is a distinct advantage. The room was comfortable, compact and clean. The view was good and not facing another building(it was overlooking serangoon road and an open ground behind it. Service - was prompt and polite. When we speid a nail that had come loose on the floor, it was immediately attended to. No other reason to ask for housekeeping. Food - we never had to eat in the hotel, given the location. But the impression(high level) of was leaning towards chinese cuisine (not the type served in India) and a bit expensive. We also booked a sentosa tour through the hotel, but it was just a generic tour which we were part of. Never got a chance to check out any other faciities. This hotel for Indians atleast is about good rooms, decent service and location, location, location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: caroledean
Reviews.Content: Good Hotel and in a good position,very close to Little India some good bargains and nice Temples where you are very welcome (nice people)also just around the corner is the underground where you are whisked away to the city center,take $20/10 Dollar bills for the ticket machine then you will get change very easy to use, also the breakfast was excellent,there is a swimming pool on one of the floors

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: vanda25
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights. We got a big room with sofa. Got this deals from singapore stop over. We would not stay there anymore. Hotel is just ok.shower curtain was very smelly so we asked them to replace it to new one. AC was good but the price is a bit too high for the hotel value.

Reviews.Title: “Our 2nd stay in this hotel and will definitely come back”
Reviews.Author: EfamilyPhnomPenh
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay at Park Royal - Kitchener Road and we booked (again) the family room which was convenient to accommodate us (We're a family of 5 with 1 teenager and 2 young children), but an extra bed will still be required. The hotel is located in Little India area, and MRT Farrer Park is just accross the street, which is very very convenient to explore Singapore. City Square shopping mall is just next to the MRT station, it has a supermarket and a number of places to eat. Room was clean and has the basic ammenities. Our request for extra bed, room service, etc. were entertained in a timely manner. Service in the front desk during check-in and check out was reasonably fast. Staff at the concierge were very helpful in answering any queries you may have.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel overall is great, surrounding convenient for shopping and food”
Reviews.Author: ChanML
Reviews.Content: Location of hotel is just opposite a shopping mall and MRT station. Lots of food choices available within walking distance too. Coffee house served pretty good buffets with lots of choices.Only drawback is on Sunday where groups of people tend to hang out around the main road of the hotel. If you don't mind that, everything else is fine. There are some nice chinese restaurants within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “We loved our stay”
Reviews.Author: preetiNits
Reviews.Content: It was a wonderful stay at ParkRoyal hotel, the hotel is near to Indian shopping and eating outlets, you can enjoy very nice stay. Eating joints are large in number and one can go on a walk to visit near by Mustafa Mall. Hotel is good with nice service staff. Breakfast is enjoyable too. Stayed in July 2010 (a little late to write review :) ).

Reviews.Title: “24 Hrs Shopping.”
Reviews.Author: pratap48
Reviews.Content: It was the end of the tour when everyone was planning for shopping for their near and dear ones.We checked in at Parkroyal and came to know that the Mustafa Shopping centre 24 hrs is next building.We enjoyed the day sightseeing and latenight when we returned to the Hotel we went to the Mustafa market and enjoyed the shopping till late night and anyone from our group felt if felt sleepy was asked to go and take rest in their room the rooms were so near.The hotel is good and we could do the shopping for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “very well located”
Reviews.Author: gaurav32
Reviews.Content: came after staying for two nights at siloso beach resort found the rooms better than siloso where the rooms are cramped and old.park royal is very nice hotel centrally located we were given complimentary upgrade to club rooms which i will highly recommend as the rooms were new and also had seperate lifts so no waiting as it is usually in large hotels. was close to many indian restaurants which we liked as being indian vegetarians food is a problem.could not do breakfast as flight was early in the morning but my friend who had a late flight told me that the breakfast was very good.only improvment required is at the reception as the staff was not very good in english at check inn and also at check out and check inn took a lot of time the counters for check inn was dealing check out.keys to one of the room also not worked in between and had to change them.booked this hotel directly through the park royal website and would recommend everyone to do so as it was a pleasure and got best rates compared to agoda bookings etc

Reviews.Title: “Hotel well placed in Little India”
Reviews.Author: Pratik1911
Reviews.Content: This Hotel being placed on Kitchener road has a wide variety of Indian cuisines near by and also " Mustafa " - 24 hours opened mall enabling shopping at any time. Hotel is very clean and maintains standards as per GHC Group. Nice place to be in...

Reviews.Title: “Definateley Would NOT be Returning!! Hotel Very Dated.”
Reviews.Author: travellors019
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 day stay at the Park Royal Hotel in Singapore.. Followed by a week in Langkawi. The Park Royal was just not 4 star standard. We had an upgrade to a suite on the 14th Floor, and it was of poor decor and smelled very mouldy!! Curtains did not close properly, and carpets were very worn. if this was an upgrade, I dread to think what the standard rooms were like. There are only 3 lifts in the hotel, so the waiting time was at least 5 minutes if you need to use the lift. ... And no Staircase!! One point which we thought was quite amazing... There are no seats in Reception at all, other than 2 child- like open wicker ones .Whilst waiting for our daughters to join us either at night or in the morning , we were ushered to a strange room , behind the concierge, almost like a bus station seating area. The breakfast was like a bun fight every morning!! There must have been at least another 200 guests all queing for food or coffee at the same time. Whilst there was a vast array of food , it felt like you were queing forever in a very noisy cafe. There are so many other fantastic hotels we could have stayed in, and with competition stiff in every business, The Park Royal needs to update thier standards!!

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: familyfivePerth
Reviews.Content: I was all prepared to write a reasonable review of this hotel, but not now. I'll start with the good stuff - all the staff with the exception of administration staff are lovely and helpful, very polite and happy to please. Breakfasts great and the rooms were reasonably well kept (though a little old). No bed bugs (a plus)! One warning though, the edge to the baths are very high and as a person on the short side I found them very hard to get in and out of. Something to think about if you happen to be disabled in anyway. Close to MRT and fantastic shopping mall across the road. Had a great stay - until we went to check out...... We were told that our accomodation bill was outstanding despite being fully paid to the travel agent back in Feb. The admin staff at the time promised to get it sorted out and get back to us via email as soon as possible and that nothing would be charged to our credit card as the number had been 'dumped' from the system. That was a lie ! After two days waiting for some type of communication regarding the investigation of where our money went I checked my credit card statement. Low and behold they had charged us over $4000 ! It is several days later and still no response from the hotel even after sending them an email requesting some correspondence regarding the mix up. They had no authorisation to make this deduction and have so far still not answered my email seeking to resolve this problem. Luckily the travel agent we dealt with is helping and the bank is lodging a dispute against them. Why didn't they alert us to the problem as we checked in? In our 10 days in Singapore we could have had it sorted before we left. This has been extremely stressful for our family. We had a great time in Singapore but this has definitely soured our experience. Stay there again ? - Never again....

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: soitzme
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Park Royal, during end of March, Positives, the hotel rooms are neat clean, well maintained, next door is Mustafa, and all the indian restaurants - Komalas,Anandha Bhavan, Hot Chips (as we are from south India, it was very helpful), and there is a mall bang opposite to the hotel. The room service/restaurant staff are nice, and help you with any suggestion on shopping/navigation around Singapore. Negatives of the hotel, the front desk/reception personnel are too busy, we had to wait for about 2 hours to get a room. I was dozing off at one of the 2 small sofas available at the lobby. There are nearly no furniture at the lobby for you to sit, therefore, cant wait for your bus/ptour pick-up at the lobby. I dont know why the hotel couldn't think of better seating arrangement. The food, is not good, I'd say not worth the money. They do not bother to clean the spill overs quickly, and it becomes a mess soon, as people walk by. In total, it is a good hotel to stay at if you are going to eat outside, if you would write-off the check-in delay.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother coming back.”
Reviews.Author: Brillio
Reviews.Content: Understand what wizard_of_nous and ozgirl73 have gone thought. Checking in after a long flight and waited in the Q for 30min no room after 4pm? After 30min go back to the counter Q again ,many India’s in the line like the whole flight touch down to this hotel. My turn came and it's as if i own the chinese lady manager a living i require a big bed and ended up she given me 2small bed(I require bigger bedding is I’m heavy on weight) didn’t have a good sleep for the 4days I was there., I'm a paying guest shouldn’t she at least give me some form of respect?. The person who help with my luggage is good but the one who check me in left me a very bad impression of this hotel. While resting in the room someone tried to open my door even when its latch i open, its two young ladies who happen to manage to open the door get a shock like me. No security in this hotel. Safebox not working have to bring my passport and valuable with me on my arrange tour in the evening. Tried to give it to the counter for safe keeping but they do not accept. You call this 4star hotel? Lift is very busy in the morning, Could not get on it many time and have to wait for a long time before i'm able to get into one. Breakfast is good but very busy (people stand by the bread counter and eat it with the bare hand.) Checking out was terrible. I was rushing for my meeting i Q at the checkout counter and the counter serve the people check in instead of the checking out. I told a gentleman who is at the lobby that i need to rush and he approach 2ladies who seems to be manager in the lobby and speak in Cantonese among themselves asking him to tell me just wait * AS A MALAYSIAN INDIA WORKING IN HONGKONG* i can speak better Cantonese than those two fools. Can’t be bothering to Q anymore i just left without paying and my company arrange for the bill to be billed. Overall will not bother to step into this hotel again and I have spoken to my company to arrange for this hotel to be remove from the prefer hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good customer service & clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: TineyWeenie
Reviews.Content: Staffs are polite and helpful. There was once an incident that took place in the room, where the save box which I have kept my valuables in just won't opened as I was about to checked out. I panicked and quickly called the front desk for help. In less than a minute, the door bell rang and 2 guys wearing black suites stood in front of the door to offer me their assistance. They introduced themselves as the Duty and Security Manager, both local Malay. Straight away they tried opening the save but it just won't open so the safe box technician had to be call down. After the technician managed to open up the safe, the Duty Manager extended my check out time as an apology.

Reviews.Title: “Good service and clean room”
Reviews.Author: AgnesCPM
Reviews.Content: We have booked the late gate away package here. Due to that, we have option to upgrade to deluxe room or 20% on F&B or spa. We choose the room upgrade and been informed deluxe just been renovated. Indeed it was and the room was spacious and clean. It's also easy exit to Farrer Park LRT. The only dwn side is it's near Little India and lotsa of Indian around the area day/night . Other than that overall satisfied with it.

Reviews.Title: “Good place for Indians to stay in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: anindyasen
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel many times in Singapore both for business as well as with family & it was always value for money. Especially, for Indians looking to stay in Little India for reasons of getting Indian food in the vicinity. The hotel has the added advantage of being situated right behind Mustafa Shopping Centre for those who would fancy shopping there.(And most Indians predictably do) The rooms are modest and if you choose to book with Breakfast, then the hotel provides a lavish breakfast spread in the morning. What is good is they provide a lot of Indian menu in the breakfast like Idli, Vara, Partha, etc., which most Indians enjoy having there. The only letdown is since the hotel is usually always full, so you have many people queueing for breakfast at the same time. The hotel is equipped with a lovely gym & swimming pool & has a very good business center. And if you are a GHA Member, then you get additional benefits of two bottles of mineral water each day & free Internet which is always a plus. Overall, I would always recommend Indian travelers to this hotel as value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible dirty hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ozgirl73
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that I have stayed at this hotel in the past and was satisfied by my stay. But this experience was a sharp contrast to my previous stay. This hotel might have a nice lobby and good breakfast but the room I was given was very dirty. Carpets and bedding was stained. There was dust on all surfaces and you could hear the generator/air conditioner machine in stereo surround sound. Very difficult… to sleep. "Non smoking" room smelt like smoke. Surely you can get a better hotel for the same price. The reception staff was rude and thought they were doing you a favour by letting you stay at this hotel. Obviously very popular with the Indian crowd because of the location. I stayed here for the location. Many indian restaurants in the area. Komala Villas and Anand Bhavan are just around the corner. Mustafa Centre is right behind the hotel. There's a MRT station close by too.

Reviews.Title: “Messed up service yet were able to make up for it”
Reviews.Author: nishant p
Reviews.Content: You checked in to a room which is already occupied. Very sad start to our four day stay at this hotel. They did apologize and sent us complimentary fruits and chocolates but we had a harrowing time as we didn't have a room for 2 hours. Point by point analysis A. Breakfast is awesome B. Location sucks. Too crowded and for travelers coming from India, DO NOT stay here. You are here to experience Singapore and not little India until and unless you cannot survive without Indian food and Indians around you. For non Indians, no problem. C. Room service is decent D. Check in experience was horrible. E.

Reviews.Title: “A passable hotel with excellent suite rooms”
Reviews.Author: Tarun_v
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel since i was on a restricted budget. On check-in at the hotel, I resented their ordinary category rooms and had upgraded to a superior category room, which are located on the higher floors. The superior category rooms are newly refurbished and very comfortable. The hotel is conveniently located opposite the train station, but i will prefer a hotel on Orchard street or in Sentosa on my next trip to Singapore. The room service is good, and plenty of eateries are located in City square mall opposite the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stonecoldwhat316
Reviews.Content: I am from India Stayed here for 5 days Positive points Great place located in little india Indian restaurants nearby Mustafa shopping mall nearby Clean rooms Great service Lift is fastest I have seen Swimming pool is free Tourist buses pick u and drop at hotel itself Negative points I didn't like breakfast that much

Reviews.Title: “Transit Stay in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: NZTourists_11
Reviews.Content: We were on a 2days and 2 nights stopover in Singapore last April . We find the location very convenient for transportation and shopping. The food served was excellant especially the Asian breakfast and the frontline staff was very friendly and helpful. We find the room quite comfortable and clean especially for a 4 star hotel in Singapore. Overall we enjoy our stay and we will recommed others to stay during their visit to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in little India”
Reviews.Author: amadeus52
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 4 nights and got a really good deal of $129 for deluxe room through visa card promotion at hotelclub. The deluxe room were upto the expectations, the toiletries provided were ample and the beds were very large and comfy. The location was central for indian food lovers and shoppers in search of mustafa. However for western and fast food the city square mall was right opposite to the hotel along with farrer park mrt station. The staff were good and polite specially the front desk and female staff, however some male staff who were roaming in the lobby looked more like secret agents looking over the facility rather then welcoming guests. That was the only thing which goes negative!

Reviews.Title: “This was our fifth stay at the hotel and we are already looking forward for the next one”
Reviews.Author: freqtraveller_14_07
Reviews.Content: Everytime we visit singapore we make sure to stay at this hotel .This hotel can be reached in less than half hour from the airport .Convientnly located , They have rooms specialy designed for families. Breaskfast choices are a plenty (includes authentic indian dishes as well). Customer service is good.Shopping is just few steps from the hotel (Mustafa is located right on the back side of the hotel) and the MRT station can be reached by foot. Rooms are well maintianed and in the event your room is not ready at the time of check in , The customer service team takes care of you .You can enjoy a welcome drink of your choice while they get your rooms ready .

Reviews.Title: “Terrible for Westerners”
Reviews.Author: SBradyE
Reviews.Content: Crappy room, horrible location, and the bathroom is appalling. I could hear everyone around me and the elevator every time it was used. Needless to say the next morning at work I felt like a zombie. Friendly staff though.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in 'Little India' for Indians!”
Reviews.Author: Wb0y
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a trip with friends last year. The hotel is convineintly located in Little India- hu of Indias in Singapore. Though Little India is not the best of places in SP (we indians!) But the hotel was really nice to stay. It had variety of Indian food and the breakfast buffet was really amazing. I would recommend this to anyone looking for a stay for few days in SP. ps. For shooping freaks...Mustaffa was just across the street :D

Reviews.Title: “Adequate but not a good location”
Reviews.Author: exchips51
Reviews.Content: We will not be staying at this hotel again. While the staff do their best the location in "Little India" is not one of the better areas of Singapore and is not conducive to those who might like the odd walk. The breakfast room is appaling more due to the guests than the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay for which the entire family loved it”
Reviews.Author: vbsm
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 8th floor of the Hotel. It is very conveniently located amidst various shopping destinations as well as variety of eating outlets. The service is very good both at the front desk and the room service. The overall ambience, convenience, best price and the grand breakfast are some of the features which makes the stay at ParkRoyal very memorable to the entire family.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay - but only on club class floor”
Reviews.Author: harpreetsapra
Reviews.Content: if you like you hotel to be quite, secluded and romantic - this is NOT the place for you. The hotel is a factory where Indian guests are produced by hundreds every hour..I stayed on the club floor away from the maddening crowd. The club floor is lovely - 19th floor, with a lovely view of the little india..the breakfast is simple but very well made. club rooms come with unlimited supply of cold drinks / juices etc in the dining room and unlimited booze and snacks for 2 hours in the evening..staff is friendly, rooms are simple but very clean..

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Convenient ParkRoyal”
Reviews.Author: mel-man-india
Reviews.Content: On our first visit to Singapore as a family, we were lucky to be get a ParkRoyal Kitchner Road as our hotel of stay. The agent promised a great stay and great it was. While the start was wobbly (a long wait for check-in inspite of pre-informing early arrival), post that the quality of facility and rooms was very very good. We were upgraded to a Family room and that was very convenient. The Guest Relations manager - Sally Ann personally saw to it that we were taken care of. Our trip required a 3 day break for cruise and then a return to Singapore. We came back to the hotel for the remainder of the trip. The breakfast spread is very elaborate with excellent multi-cuisine choices. The swimming pool (with a separate kids pool) and gym facilities are very good. The best part of the hotel is however its location. Its close to the shopping hub that has Mustafa and City Square mall in the vicinity. The MRT stop is right opposite the Hotel (Farrer Park) which make very convenient rides to Sentosa and aroundabout. Overall a very good hotel in a fantastic location.

Reviews.Title: “I Loved and i"ll be back”
Reviews.Author: viral2502
Reviews.Content: A good hotel to go. THIS hotel is situated near mustafa market and everything is near from this hotel.THE food of the hotel is hygeinic.The rooms are clean and tidy. The swimming pool is also neat.I LOVED THE service of the hotel the manager in all a very supporting caste.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful room and shopping expeirence”
Reviews.Author: sairituus
Reviews.Content: Me and My family checked-in at this hotel on 26th May 2011,we were astonished to see the size of the Family room offered to us,It is almost around 500 Sqft carper area,Such a large room in Singapore is amazing.It is in the close prozimity of Great 24hrs shopping centre Mustafa,just walk down from the lobby you enter the mustafa shopping mall.The rooms are very clear and well maintained and this hotel is up to the mark with every facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting Experience, but probably won't stay again”
Reviews.Author: Hammondkiwi
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated at the edge of Little India, right next to Mustafa's, which has to be the most interesting department store experience in the world and highly recommended, perfumes are the same price or cheapor than duty free, and they stock everything from food through kitchenwares, clothing, electronics and even traditional Indian, Malay and Indonesia clothing, it is open 24/7, nothing like shopping in a crowded store at midnight and the co-located restaurants' food is great. The hotel staff were absolutely great, helpful and very polite, but the hotel mainly catered to coach loads of tourists from Malaysia, who were without exception pushy and rude, the whole hotel was overcrowded, with whole extended families staying in one room and one morning it took me 30 minutes to get a lift to the lobby and I ended up arriving late to my business meeting. Before I stayed here, I had never heard a lift overweight buzzer before, but in the Parkroyal on Kitchener it was a regular occurance. On check in, my prebooked Kingsize room was unavailable, so I was given a room with two singles and moved the second night to a kingsize room next to a noisy liftshaft, and on the 3rd night finally to a quiet kinsize room. Ate in the restaurant one night, but food was pretty average, whereas outside the restaurants are much cheaper and the food is stunning.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and lovely interior”
Reviews.Author: TecHythe
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Park Royal for two nights on our way out to New Zealand. The hotel was well situated next to a brand new shopping mall and a short walk away from the underground station. We arrived late after a long haul flight from the UK. As soon as we arrived the staff took our baggage to our room for us while we checked in and collected the key. We were very jet lagged so went to the night safari before coming back to the hotel to go to bed late at night. The room was basic but suited our needs and had a good bathroom The next day we got up late to find that the brasserie was about to close but we still went in and had our breakfast. The staff refunded us the price of the whole meal because they felt we did not have the full breakfast selection. We were very pleased with this act of kindness of the staff and they should be recognized for this. After which we thanked the brasserie manager who was grateful for this deed. We then took the very short walk over the road to the new shopping mall which was full of great shops. We were not sure what to do for the rest of the day so we went down to the reception to talk to the trip advisor who was very helpful. We decided to go to Sentosa Island and we got back late at night and the hotel were happy to let people walk in and out at such a time. Before going on back to the airport we took advantage of the swimming pool from which we ordered some Singapore snacks. At first there was no one at the service desk and we had to wait for a while. We then ordered the food and had to wait a surprisingly long time for it to come. We got the food eventually and it was very nice. Whilst a member of the group was checking us out we visited the gift shop which was full of wonderful souvenirs. After buying some small things from the shop we got into the taxi which was waiting right next to the hotel. All in all we had a very pleasant stay at the hotel and would recommend it to anyone visiting Singapore. (unless you can afford a room in Raffles!)

Reviews.Title: “very nice place”
Reviews.Author: rr_38
Reviews.Content: Hello, I would like to recommend you a very nice hotel in Singapour. I stayed there 5 nights. Crew were very very nice and helpful. My room was very nice with a great view (19th floor). You can reach every place in town very easely. Breakfast is wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Good city hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlexMaria74
Reviews.Content: We ( 2 adults and 2 children 2 years, 9 months) stayed 2 nights in ParkRoyal in Singapore on our trip back from Bali. We were positively surprised as to the spacious room we had got! Friendly staff, nice bar, breakfast of everyone's choice (however like a canteen with no atmosphere). Short walking distance to metro and big shopping centre across the hotel with many restaurants/ food-court/ shopping/supermarket etc. We didn't use the hotel pool but it looked inviting.

Reviews.Title: “thanx for making my trip memorable”
Reviews.Author: ankur09
Reviews.Content: the best hotel in my whole trip.nice rooms,good breakfast n especially staff is hellfull.

Reviews.Title: “Staff Really Cannot Do Enough for You!”
Reviews.Author: Quin01
Reviews.Content: By far the biggest selling point of this hotel is the staff and the fact that they cannot do enough for you! I found the rooms to be slightly inferior, but the other public areas of the hotel were decorated with more contemporary style. The hotel was expensive, especially room service and the breakfast rate, and the food served was definitely not worth what was being paid. Overall, though, I found the staff so helpful and friendly, this tends to overshadow any slight negatives with the property. I usually find comments such as these a little 'cheesy', so it does take a lot for me to make this kind of statement.

Reviews.Title: “Great Option to Accommodate a family of 5”
Reviews.Author: graconbay
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at this hotel because it offered a family room that could accommodate all 5 of our family. We found there were very few hotels in Singapore that could accommodate more than 4 people, unless you chose to pay for 2 rooms. Even then they won't guarantee that you will have adjoining rooms. The Parkroyal on Kitchener was an excellent choice because we were able to have our 3 young children sleep in one room and we had a separate king size bed in another room. There was only one bathroom. The rooms themselves are a little dated but very clean and spacious. I certainly wouldn't recommend it for honeymooners but it was perfect for our family. They had flat screen TV's which included an Australian news channel. The pool area was good - it had a large rectangular pool plus a large round wading pool. The breakfasts were fantastic and managed to please our young fussy eaters! There is a new shopping centre across the road which has a small supermarket. The supermarket stocked most western foods and I was amazed to even see Vegemite on the shelves (a god send for Aussie travellers). The MRT Farrer station was close by but we had no need to use it because the taxi's in Singapore are very cheap and plentiful.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel if you want to feel like you are in India”
Reviews.Author: kzstash
Reviews.Content: I had to stay in this hotel for 3 nights and to be honest it's hard to fault it because the rooms are pretty clean and comfy, there is free internet and the staff are really friendly and helpful. However you do get a feeling that you are in India whether you are inside the hotel or when you walk out. Having people eating omelet with bare hands during the breakfast can be quite off putting. The breakfasts in general are extremely crowded and there are queues to get food. You do get a bit of cultural shock when you see behavior of some guests and people outside. It has certainly shown a Singapore in a different light. I wouldn't come back there myself and wouldn't recommended to my friends, and I guess it's a pity that a good value hotel with extremely helpful staff gets such a reputation because of it's guests.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay - great location to everything”
Reviews.Author: justygirlnz
Reviews.Content: Booked through Agoda website and arrived around 7pm. Staff was very nice and helpful. Location is excellent - mall and MRT station across the road, 7-Eleven around the corner and many places to eat. The Mustafa Centre is very close, anything you need could be found in there and it is open 24hrs. Ordered room service once and it was promptly delivered. Also received two free small bottles of water each day during my stay. Internet access was great - no dramas there. If I was to be picky, the only two minor things was that the room looked much more modern in the pictures and instead of one big bed, I received two twin beds which wasn't much of an issue as I had great sleeps!

Reviews.Title: “Great place in Little India”
Reviews.Author: pvee
Reviews.Content: We got a grate rate at this hotel. This was a guaranteed rate without breakfast. Our flight got their really early but they gave us a room by 9am which was nice. We had breakfast at the Komala's restaurant a short walk away. There's also a toastbox in the City mall opp. Parkroyal. Love the toastbox breakfast. The breakfast at the Parkroyal is a grand buffet for which they charge $20 if its not included in your rate. I've eaten this before and its real nice. But this time since it wasn't in our rate we ate all our breakfast's outside. My brother who was travelling with me fell sick during this trip and it was very convenient because we had a doctor who practices on the groundfloor of the hotel. There's also a 7-11 and the Mustaffa center is 1min away. All in all a great location and a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in. Nice location helpful staff nice ambience”
Reviews.Author: ashray70
Reviews.Content: Very nice and decent hotel with very nice location. All shopping areas like Mustafa, City Mall are close by. Good Indian eateries are also close by. The ambience is very good and the staff is most helpful. I was able to get my room by 1pm though the check in time is 2pm. They did it on request and were very nice about it. The room was good though a trifle small for a family of three. Furniture and all others things were nice, the toilets were clean and everything was in place. The breakfast was superb and starts very early too at 6am. Everything was perfect about the place and it was a really pleasant experience to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Not a hotel for family with children”
Reviews.Author: startravel01
Reviews.Content: We have been to Singapore a few times now and we always stay near Orchard Road or Clarke Quay area. However, this trip we chose to stay at Park Royal at Kitchener road and it was a big mistake. We are a family of four and we pre-booked our accommodation through a reputable travel agent in Sydney. When we arrived at the hotel after a 8 hour flight, we were provided a room with 2 single beds even though the hotel had the booking details which confirmed 2 adults and 2 children. When questioned the response of the staff were rooms are provided subject to availability and this is the best they could provide. It was obvious that the hotel was overbooked. After having no luck with the staff at the front counter, we requested to speak to the manager. The person at the reception went to the back office to get the manager and came back and said that the manager is too busy to see us and we should settle with this room. We were really frustrated by this stage and demanded to see the manager and the manager finally came out after about 10 minutes. After a heated discussion suddenly they were able to find us a room with a king bed and a roller away bed. They then tried to charge us for the roller away bed. Overall very dissappointed with the hotel and management. Room was not clean and dusty.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location (Especially for Indians), Excellent Hotel but You need to wait to get a room”
Reviews.Author: Adarsh_India
Reviews.Content: I am from India and went to singapore for Honeymoon. 1)Location: I would suggest this hotel because of its excellent location. Mustafa Centre and Little India are adjacent. There will not be any worry for Indian food as there are hundreds of Indian Restaurants at just walkable distance. 2)Room Quality: All the rooms are renovated and are very modern and pretty comfortable. But the rooms are not getting ready at Checkin time hence i needed to wait atleast an hour to get a room which is very tiring job ,especially after travelling many hours in a flight. Moreover i checked in two times in a weeks time and two times i got a twin bed instead of Kingsize bed (even after i requested for a kingsize bed before hand) which is frustrating. other than this the reception staff were quite friendly and handled well. 3)Breakfast: Breakfast menu is very wide and good thing is that it contains lot of indian items.

Reviews.Title: “A pretty good hotel but just a little disappointing in one or two areas”
Reviews.Author: FMBHamilton
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night recently on the way back to New Zealand and chose it because of the good reviews it had received on Tripadvisor. After a 15 hour flight I was very tired when I arrived but my room was not ready. However the staff on reception were very helpful and they managed to sort a room for me within an hour and they upgraded me to a deluxe room. There was nowhere to sit in the lobby whilst I waited for my room and I did think the lobby area was a bit lacking in character. There was a basic sort of sitting room off to one side where I had to wait. Not what I would expect of a four star hotel. My room was nice and the bathroom was clean and modern however I found the beds to be very firm and not very comfortable. I thought the pool area was very nice. I ate in the restaurant in the evening and the staff were attentive and the food was pretty good although I thought the drinks were quite pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect Choice”
Reviews.Author: ParekhDeep
Reviews.Content: i was on my honeymoon from india. i had done a lot of research prior to doing my booking. as in location of the hotel, nearby places, good indian vegetarian restaurants nearby, comfort, class & value for money. this hotel fulfilled all of them. reception staff were friendly & gave us a complimentary room upgrade. swimming pool is located on the 6th floor of the hotel & is a nice open place to relax. mustafa centre was visible from our hotel room. the hotel staff was very helpful. hotel was very clean. breakfast had a good indian touch and gave a pefect start for the day. indian vegetarian hotels like Komala villas, Anand bhavan, hotel komalas and Kailash parbat are at a walking distance, we stayed at Park Royal for 5 days & was very much satisfied with everything.

Reviews.Title: “Parkroyal Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Le-lady
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hotel on a stop over from Australia back to the UK, the staff were most helpful and pleasant, my room was spotlessly clean and very large. Although breakfast was not included in my original package, I did have breakfast and I was not charged for this, the choice was vast. The Hotel has a wonderful roof top swimming pool were drinks and snacks can be purched very reasonably. The Hotel is situated in the Indian Quarter of Singapore, which is very diverse and fascinating. I recommend the city tour a tour about 3.5 hour if on a short stay in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “good experience”
Reviews.Author: subhash066
Reviews.Content: the hotel is very well located we were early at 8 morning and room given to us by 10. good breakfast spred. best location for indian vegetarians good pool helpful reception disappointments were the old tele with not many choices to watchand secondly a rude call from room service that i am supposed to tip on room service. this call certainly spoilt the whole pleasent experience

Reviews.Title: “very nice experience”
Reviews.Author: tokumboh
Reviews.Content: service excellent even though i arrived at 1 am local time i was very well attended to the room was very well designed., decorated and comfortable i booked part of a package that had a room on the top floor for breakfast , cocktails every evening and just to chill out all inclusive and with free drinks and internet all day. i ate in the resturant only once and it was lovely sumptous buffet. they put fruit and flowers oin the room everyday. good laundry service fantastic all round value for money. all my tours where well booked for me,

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best Hotel in Singapore.”
Reviews.Author: ronnyadonis
Reviews.Content: Been going to this hotel for a few times over a few years now. It is simply the best. Good service and very clean room. Only issue I ever had was due to my early flight I had to wait a while to checkin to room. Not a problem just had bit of Jetlag and tire from over 6 hour flight wanted to rest. The hotel is situated on the perfect stretch of singapore. Mustafa right a few steps away for shopping crasy people. Great staff. Will keep coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Affordable hotel with a great location, but average room quality”
Reviews.Author: SameerG
Reviews.Content: While making our booking, the hotel looked great in the pics, it was in everything else, but the room was not quite up to the mark. The room is aging out in its style, amenities and fixtures. Also we had requested for a double bed room, but the hotel provided us with a room with two single beds. It was quite a fight to get the staff to join the two beds as we were told that double bedded rooms are not available. Also we found that the sheets were not clean and we had to get it changed. Leaving the rooms aside, everything else seemed good, including the breakfast. Also the hotel being right next to Little India added to the attraction.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel for recommendation”
Reviews.Author: pradipcs63
Reviews.Content: Very good location near to MRT, Mall and Restaurants. Rooms are clean and roomy. Breakfast is very good. Staff are coopeartive. Room sevice is good. Free WI Fi Good for long stay I have stayed there several times.

Reviews.Title: “Park Royal on Kitchener Road, a very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: zeehan
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights here and found the hotel to be very nice. The location was excellent for us as we have stayed in Singapore many times, so this was a change for us. Very close to the Farrer Park MRT station, the Century Square Mall with supermarket and food hall, Mustafa Centre. Our room was very comfortable, yes the bathroom is small, but all you need really. The pool area is quite gorgeous and the gym looks well equipped. What struck us was the excellent service and friendliness of the staff, like Singapore of old. We would definitely return to the Park Royal on Kitchener.

Reviews.Title: “We couldn't have chosen better”
Reviews.Author: skydiver3
Reviews.Content: We had been upgraded prior to getting there and were booked into orchid Club rooms. This probably the best move you can make. The room was great, the service was wonderful.breakfast was included in the orchid club room, afternoon tea and a happy hour with free drinks and snacks. two items of laundry per person per day. The manageress Denise was more than helpful, showing us how easy it was to use the MRT which is only a couple of metres away. There are numerous eating places right outside the hotel which is in a really great area. I really cannot rate the service and cleanliness highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shubhangia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Park Royal for 3 nights and really enjoyed the hotel. We had asked for a triple share room and got a very spacious one. The location was just perfect with a lot of Indian restaurants down the road, Mustafa for shopping and the rly stn. just across the street. The Breakfast buffet was lovely. I do so recommend this place !

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, shame it was only for 1 night”
Reviews.Author: sloping_fungus
Reviews.Content: Stayed here coming back from a trip to Australia. Shame because it was a lovely hotel with a trendy decor. There is a shopping center opposite so it was perfect for some shopping while waiting to head back to the airport. ALos the bar done some nice snacks and cocktails! Would love to go back again and enjoy a longer stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: UnderBigHill
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a bit old, but the service is excellent. When we were there, this hotel was fully booked due to an international conference. I believe all the staffs are super busy. However, they are still very attentive and friendly. Due to the function, almost all of the customers having same schedule. The 3 old and small lifts in the hotel just couldn't handle the traffic. Everyone of us have bus to catch at almost same time of the day. We are running out of time! A room service helper passed by and felt our frustration. She came and offer us to use the workers lifts. "We are forbidden to bring customers to these back lifts but I'm sure you needed this very much at this moment" (now this is REAL customer service, isn't it?) On the last day of my stay, we had a half-day-tour so all of us leave our luggage with the concierge. When I came back to collect my luggage, the concierge apologized and brought me to the storeroom. Apparently my luggage was broken during transfer, and they have prepared 2 different sizes new luggage for me to choose as the replacement. The whole process is efficient and I'm satisfied with their service.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: amitabha_s
Reviews.Content: The room was a bit small for two adults and a child (no space for a roll away bed) but the location, cleanliness, service and ambiance more than made up for it. Stone's throw from the MRT, Little India and a mall accross the street - it served our needs perfectly. Possibly a little expensive but that's Singapore for you. The only day we tried to dine there, surprised to find the restaurants closed around 1030pm, didn't bother to find out why- with little India restaurants next door - who cared.

Reviews.Title: “wrongly rated as 4 star.Not more than a 3 star.”
Reviews.Author: tcs88
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Parkroyal in Kitchener after much deliberation and trip advisor reviews. The main high point of this hotel is its location and trust that may be the only reason for it to get a 4 star.We stayed 5 nites . The rooms are just about average .The standard rooms does not have anything to give it a 4 star rating.After the AC in our room did not repair for 24 hrs and adjusting the discomfort,we were given a Deluxe room . I called up the reception twice to check if this INDEED was the "Deluxe" room.The size of the room or the bed(which were not at all any size ,forget King or Queen)was the same as the standard so got wondering what was Deluxe??They informed me that the toothbrush and some such packets in the bathroom was deluxe!!!Ofcourse there were slippers too.! So the room was a disappointment and not expected.Nevertheless the hotel is clean. The food could do with more varieties and options for Vegetarians and the staff could do with better English. The reception was the worst with the long queues.Appreciate that we need to wait whilst checking in but having to wait in queue to be given the key for the new room due to mismanagement and AC not working etc was not acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Good fit for the Indians”
Reviews.Author: UD2792
Reviews.Content: Properly located, close to some of the corporate offices; fairly close to Indian food joints. Courteous staff.. and certainly a high quality food, with Impressive breakfast and deserts. Close to some High end Casinos; fairly priced as compared to VERY VERY EXPENSIVE peers in the vicinity

Reviews.Title: “good place surrounded by indian restaurants”
Reviews.Author: pramod1313
Reviews.Content: we chose this place as we are purely vegetarian and love indian food and this hotel is located in little india and next to mustafa shopping centre where you get everything you need to shop from electronics to clothes accessories , watches etc and you have all kinds of indian restaurants nearby from south indian to punjabi and is easily accessible from any part of singapore

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel. Taste of India”
Reviews.Author: Raj86
Reviews.Content: Good hotel. If you want to feel homelike in S'pore, then this is a good hotel. But I rather would have stayed in city centre. Good shops and eateries around.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great hotel”
Reviews.Author: love2travelLondon
Reviews.Content: Good friendly staff coupled with nice comfortable beds and a great location what more can you ask , This hotel has a metro station just opposite so getting around is easy and very quick in air conditioned comfort , there are many places to eat especially indian food as little india is just round the corner but there are types of food as well so all tastes catered for . Also has a great pool for a nice relaxing swim after all the sightseeing .

Reviews.Title: “Great location backed up by Super Service!”
Reviews.Author: Snapper1982
Reviews.Content: This place has a locational advantage like none other! Situated just off Serangoon Road and 2min away from a sea of restaurants, this is really THE place for people who can't live without Indian food. The service is quick and very efficient and facilities offered made my stay complete value for money. Good: - Right opposite an MRT station in case it is difficult to get a taxi - Food not a problem for Indians - Facilities are top class (Will recommend the SPA there) - Service is very quick and efficient - Pricing is fair for the amenities offered - WiFi Complimentary and very good Bad: - THE pad for Indian visitors so always full - Difficult to get a Taxi during rush hour as it is just behind Mohd. Mustafa - For people wanting to experience SINGAPORE, this may not be the place to stay All in all, I'd recommend this hotel to business visitors as well as tourists given the proximity to the MRT station and availability of restaurants and shopping areas close by.

Reviews.Title: “Good room, average service”
Reviews.Author: Tarun029
Reviews.Content: Great location for Indian food lovers considering the number of Indian restaurants nearby. Being a vegetarian, this was a huge relief in Singapore. Located right behind Mustafa, it meant that I could do my fly-by-night shopping soujourn quite comfortably. Also, the hotel is very conveniently located with regard to the Metro. Farer Park station is right next door. Little India is also at a stone's throw so Indian food was never a problem. So, location is fantastic. The only shortcoming was the average room service. A strange thing was the fact that they even had a Chinese room service staff who could not understand English. To employ such a person as part of room service in a place like Singapore was a bit suprising for me. It was a task to explain to the lady that I needed my room cleaned, but to no avail. The gym was good. Overall the hotel was comfortable and the location certainly takes the cake.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience in a Fabulous Location!”
Reviews.Author: Buddahtravels
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. Went to Singapore for a romantic get-away and got it and more. We love the Indian food and walking at all hours through Little India. It is perfectly safe and there are no problems for single women or women walking alone despite what other reviewers have said. We've done it many times. This is our second trip staying here and felt the Indian/Pakistani men were all very respectful. They are here on visas to work in IT, construction, shipping, labor etc., and know they can be sent back or prosecuted, so there is virtually no crime or problems. As far as cleanliness, yes, Little India is not as clean as the rest of Singapore but it is much cleaner than India! We've been all over India and can attest to that fact. Most people we know refer to Little India as "Sanitized India." We saw nor heard about prostitution or massage parlors nearby. There is a very nice mall in front and in back is the famous 24/7 Mustafa department store. There is also a small attached to the hotel for shopping. Yes, the hotel is pricey and breakfast is not included unless you get a club room. But, all hotels are expensive in Singapore. Singapore is an expensive place to visit. Little India remains our favorite. The service at Parkroyal is excellent. It is a quality hotel and we recommend it highly. There is even a lift at the front for guests who cannot climb the 12 or so stairs to enter in the front.

Reviews.Title: “Not my first choice!”
Reviews.Author: SpankingGT
Reviews.Content: It was a last minute trip and park royal looked on paper but not what was expected. The location is horrible as it is surrounded by massage parlors and prostitution. I guess it would be perfect for an india traveler as it located next to little india with nothing but indian resturants. Hotel staff was not as helpful as they could have been. We were asked to wait 2 hours before we were checked in even though we were there during our check in time. Rooms are cleaned only once a day and that too later in the day. The spa was closed through out our stay. Not the best experience. The hotel is 3 star at the most and as always, you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, So so location”
Reviews.Author: WeeTanWee
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 times so far. Great rooms, clean and spacious, good amenities, good wifi speed, efficient room service even at 4am, good reception staff and service. Perfect except for the following: 1. Location. It's near little india, which is a tourist site of course, but it's really the area where the poorer workers/labourers stay. So it's not ideal for a female traveller as they do stare till a lady gets pretty uncomfortable. It wasn't great for ladies or kids for that matter 2. During my latest visit, there were bloody stains on the tie-string of my bath robe. Awful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel with awesome facilities”
Reviews.Author: AnujMathur
Reviews.Content: Park Royal on Kitchener Road is an excellent hotel, especially for travelers from India. It is located in Little India so there is no shortage of eating options serving food close to the Indian palate. The cleanliness and the service in the hotel is top class. The guests get to use the swimming pool, steam room, gym etc. for free. The swimming pool in the hotel is very beautiful and well kept. The rooms in the hotel are quite spacious and very clean. I am a "Black" level member of this hotel; the facilities and benefits provided by the hotel for their loyalty members is very good. I would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone coming to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: crosswordsguy
Reviews.Content: During my official Visit to Singapore I had a long stay here for 10 days. I shifted from Hotel Santa Grand, Waterfront to PARKROYAL on Kitchener Road as this property was located in Little India which is an Indians delight. Check in took time as a group of tourists arrived on the same time. Rooms are big and beds are comfy but not too soft. Washroom was clean with all amenities. WiFi was complementary but renewing the pass code each day was cumbersome procedure. Mustafa Mall, City Sqaure Mall are just a jump away and Farrer Park MRT is just around the corner. Complementary buffet breakfast was sumptuous. Veg and Non joints like Komalas & Anjappar etc are just round the corner so a lots of choice is available. Swimming pool was huge... and the health club was well equipped. Would definitely recommended to all !

Reviews.Title: “not the best of welcomes”
Reviews.Author: colste
Reviews.Content: We arrived here after sitting for 13 hours on a plane at 7am, checked in and we were then told to wait for our room.....which we did? After an hour I went back to reception and was told by the receptionist whose English had now become non existant that we couldn't check in till 2pm!!! We were left to sit in the hotel reception area in seats that were even more uncomfortable than the plane seats for 6 hours, we were the lucky ones as some travellers had been there since 6am. We had no offer of a welcome drink or even told or shown were we could get a drink or anything to eat. The hotel surely had empty rooms, this the first time ever that we have had to wait till 2pm for our room and we have travelled all over the world and checked in as soon as we arrived no matter what the time was.....so be prepared to wait if you chose this hotel The room when we eventually got there was basic, with a delightful brown carpet...but it was very clean. be warned though if you have a bad back or other ailments these are the hardest and most uncomfortable beds in the world......the floor looked softer

Reviews.Title: “A family favourite for us.”
Reviews.Author: flametrees
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for the 3rd time and are still satisfied with this hotel. Our room had recently been renovated which was nice and we liked the wall mounted flat screen. The room is lacking adequate bench space though and the bathroom, while clean, is very basic. There was a problem when reception tried to charge me extra for a rollaway bed which had been pre- requested and already paid for. However, when I spoke to one of the managers the matter was dealt with swiftly and I heard no more about it. The location is great with the MRT station just across the road so it is easy to get around Singapore. The new shopping centre across the road is also a fabulous addition to the area, especially as its' clientele appear to be mainly locals. While there are a number of restaurants at the shopping centre, our favourite restaurant, Sitara, is around the corner in Serangoon Rd across the road from the money exchange ( which, BTW, is always busy & has really good exchange rates!). Sitara has the best Indian food in a plain but clean eating area that has the best air-conditioning system (a bonus when it is really hot and humid in Singapore) and very efficient, polite but reserved staff. Great food at a great price. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Much improvement in this hotel in last two years”
Reviews.Author: SubodhSohoni
Reviews.Content: I had stayed in this hotel in 2006 and had not liked it much and felt it to be too high priced for comfort. This time I was pleasantly surprised with the service and quality improvement. Room was much better, cleaner, roomier and sufficiently lighted. Service of the reception desk and porters was classically good. I won't mind going back now.

Reviews.Title: “an Amzing experience”
Reviews.Author: midnight_merry
Reviews.Content: When we reached there, the hotel receptionist (some chineese) was rude and not helpful. But then we met the manager who was a gem!! he helped us check in earlier than the scheuled time as we were very tired after the flight. The hotel was awesome and we had a time of our life staying there.It was absolute value for money. Fab Location as the place is called little india with lot of indian food outlets which really helps. The hotel was clean , food was great !! and staff was very good otherwise. Highly recommended to all Indians specially who visit Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, very good value”
Reviews.Author: BridlingtonSue
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Parkroyal for three nights on our way to Australia, it was a welcome break from the long flight. The hotel is about half an hour from the airport. We arrived at 10.30 am room was not ready but by 12.00 we were in it, this differs from some other reviews who had to wait until 14.00, reception staff were very helpful. Room very good on 7th floor, good size and clean. We had three good nights sleep, very quiet. The high spot was breakfast, the variety of food was very good, catering from every taste.
