The only thing to think about is that the dining room gets very busy between 08.30 and 09.00 try and avoid these times as it is difficult to get a table as the hotel is very busy. The hotel is opposit a shopping mall and even if you do not like shopping it is very cool in the humid conditions outside. Overall we had a very good experience at the Parkroyal and would stay there again if we go to Singapore

Reviews.Title: “Already popular with Indian tourist because of its location.”
Reviews.Author: J_Majethia
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 31st night only. Mustafa's stone throw away from the hotel. All the pure vegetatrian eateries are very close by. Hotel has small but functional rooms. Little India is walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, nothing special”
Reviews.Author: MariFinland
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three days in Parkroyal. We had room for 4 persons and size of the room was adequate. Breakfast was sufficient, as well as service. Best thing was the location.

Reviews.Title: “good price in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Sim654
Reviews.Content: i wouldn't real call it a 4 star but it was a decent place . the location was very good. I wasn't very happy with the staff though. The reception staff wasn't very friendly

Reviews.Title: “little India hotel, great pool, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: soloparenttraveller
Reviews.Content: this hotel is 10 minutes drive from raffles place, smack bang in Singapore's Indian community. there is a mrt station within 2 minutes walk. shopping centers all around. excellent pool facilities and laundry facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: RamananGunendran
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent, friendly and helpful staff and in a great location. The staff was very helpful when the need arose

Reviews.Title: “Perhaps the best option in Little India”
Reviews.Author: mohantymr
Reviews.Content: If you can't do without indian food, aim to shop till the wee hours at Mustafa and come back to sleep in relative comfort, this is perhaps the best option.Located adjacent to the famed 24 hour shopping centre Mustafa and within easy walking distance of a multitude of indian eateries including several pure vegetarian outlets, the hotel is convenience personified.The fact that the Farrer park MRT station is just across the road is an added bonus. The hotel is pretty well maintained and the staff is smiling and helpful.There is always someone eager to help you out with your luggage or hail a taxi.The healthclub and the swimming pool are quite good. The rooms are not very cramped as one sees in Hongkong and if needed an extra bed can be put.The rooms come with a work table and chair which I thought was nice. Since we were travelling with old parents who wouldn't eat in a restaurant serving non-vegetarian food,couldn't try the food in the onsite restaurants. Though the hotel appears to be expensive, it is not so when you compare hotel prices in Singapore,which are indeed quite steep compared to Malaysia,Thailand and Indonesia. By the way, the bottled water you will find near the tea/coffee service is chargeable.

Reviews.Title: “Nonsense - I don’t recommend Park Royal”
Reviews.Author: EaInternational
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel for more than 4 times, and found that this hotel is not worth is value. I strongly not recommend this hotel to anyone. Beside its location it has nothing to do with. The hospitality is very poor which they react with guest. I guess they don’t lack for guest so their heads is high but its a trap. I don’t recommend to all my fellow traveller. In the same price you can find a way more better hotels in Singapore even 4 or 5 star. Park Royal is only 2 star or 3 I guess. If you value your money than be aware and think smart!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: PramitM
Reviews.Content: I chose the hotel because of it's location in Little India - next to Mustafa center and easily accessible through MRT. The hotel is nice and comfortable and staff very courteous. There are lots of Indian restaurants in the vicinity. The rooms are nice and comfortable - overall a fantastic place to stay when visiting Singapore. One drawback is the difficulty in finding a cab - you sometimes have to wait for more than 15-20 mins to hail a cab.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: Dolcevita1405
Reviews.Content: I Stayed in this hotel in October location of the hotel is the best part...Very close to Farrer park MRT so travelling around Singapore becomes very Convenient ...Very Close to the most famous Mustaffa Shopping centre so shopping becomes very Convenient If you are an indian and looking for indian food this is the place..because all indian resturants are in a walking distance Overall a very Convinient Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Parkroyal on kitchener road - best location with competitve rates”
Reviews.Author: saurabhu2002
Reviews.Content: Located in the heart of the ethnic district in Singapore, PARKROYAL on Kitchener Road is minutes away from the city’s MRT train station which provides easy access to all parts of Singapore. The 24-hour Mustafa shopping mall and Singapore’s Central Business District are all within close proximity from the hotel. I enjoyed the breakfast and if you are looking for good spicy food, can go to nearby Indian restaurants like Anand Bhavan, etc You can also book travel package for CITY TOUR, NIGHT SAFARI, SINGAPORE FLYIER, etc directly from the Hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel to stay”
Reviews.Author: selvan_koilpillai
Reviews.Content: very very close to shopping mall Mustafas. very good restaurant with multi cusine grate taste. very good spa and steam bath is great. well connected. very safe. spacious rooms with all infreastructures. very good view from higher level rooms. commuting is very easy with lotsof taxis. sorrounded by lots of indian restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: priyamagarwal
Reviews.Content: The rooms and comfortable and spacious as are all the other amenities (especially the gym overlooking the pool is breathtaking). The Business Center and the restaurants are upto the mark. Overall a very enjoyable my first Singapura experience.

Reviews.Title: “great location ... but”
Reviews.Author: calmac7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as a result of a recommendation from our Travel agent. The location was good and Little India is a must see but the hotel is a bit tired. We were particularly disappointed that even though we requested adjoining rooms we were in fact put 2 floors apart. We filled out a questionnaire emailed by the hotel on our return and mentioned this but received no response. The concierge service was very good and those staff should be commended. would I return - probably not, would look in the Orchard Road area next time.

Reviews.Title: “Pathetic reception and front desk at this hotel -- don't rely on them”
Reviews.Author: ctafz
Reviews.Content: This hotel has unbelievably clueless staff. I was visiting Singapore this week and one of my business colleagues was staying here, and called me from the hotel. The hotel staff were unable to trace the room number, or take messages, or connect me to my friend. I must have called up a dozen times on Nov 8, but each time got stonewalled. Then they connected me to someone else with the same surname who has been staying there since Octover 7 but who was not my friend. When I protested, they told me my friend's booking had been cancelled on Nov 2. So I had to wait until my friend made contact -- and it turned out he had been staying there all the time! Amateurish, disorganised, what else can I say? Beware if you decide to stay here, they can't accomplish the simplest tasks.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice for easy accessibility, shopping and Indian Food”
Reviews.Author: MRPMumbai
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideal for family requiring good accessibilty to all parts of Singapore as well as great shopping at Mustafa and Central Mall and plenty of options within walking distance for Indian Food. The hotel is neat and clean and has helpful and courteous staff. The food options at the hotel are extremely pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Good base for Singapore visit”
Reviews.Author: Aberdeen16
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights to spend some time in Singapore before moving onto Thailand. The hotel is clean and the staff are friendly so couldn't find any fault. The only downside we felt was that it's location is quite a distance from the main sights and taxis were required to get anywhere but not really that expensive, and not the hotel's fault. There was a swimming pool but didn't get a chance to try it. Breakfast buffet offered good choice (and plenty Indian choice being in Little India) but there was also a lovely bakery across the road and plenty malls located close by for last minute shopping!!

Reviews.Title: “Really royal”
Reviews.Author: abcal37
Reviews.Content: Located right next to the mustafa shopping centre and easily accessible by car to any part of city, Park Royal has been our favourite hotel in singapore. The service is excellent and we got the best deal through the hotel,which was quite lucrative to accomodate our family of four. We were given a family suite with two rooms. since we reached early at 10 am we still got an early check in without any hassles. The hotel breakfast is a wide spread of different cuisines and we are always spoilt for choice. The staff was very courteous and friendly.They took care of our little needs when asked for( my husband needed a shaving kit as he lost his at the airport).The hotel has revamped its interiors and is looking more elegant since our last visit.Its always our first choice in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HolidayluvaPerth
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed at the Parkroyal on Kitchener for 2 nights after spending 7 days in Langkawi. We have previously been to Singapore 4 times and stayed at different hotels each time and loved it. We found this hotel to be a little run down and it didnt meet our expectations for a 4star hotel or the price we paid. I read a lot of reviews on this hotel before booking - with mixed feelings. Being vegetarian myself (but not my husband), I thought this might be a great area to try despite never having had any problems in the past getting vegetarian food in Singapore. We were a little surprised when we ordered room service for breakfast - my husband called asking if we could get poached eggs on toast and grilled tomato to which he was told that he could only order off the menu and no changes were permitted. So he then told them his wife was vegetarain and what could they offer me and her reply was cornflakes with no other suggestions! We also were turned away from 2 other restaurants in little india when asked if they could do something vegetarian. This has never happened to us before - we've always found the restaurants to be most flexible. We also called into the hotel bar after a night of shopping (around 10.30pm). We sat down and waited to have our drinks order taken only to be told that the bar was closed while other patrons had drinks. On the plus side - the hotel does have a nice pool area which features little areas with 2 sunloungers covered by a canvas gazebo with inbuilt fan aswell as a serviced bar offering some nice drinks and snacks. All in all I wouldnt stay here again - was definitely not a fan of the location or the hotel. I think for the same price you can find a better standard of hotel with a bit more life and ambience about it.

Reviews.Title: “Very good option if one is looking for Indian Vegetarian food close by!”
Reviews.Author: DChopda
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very good and surrounded by shopping malls (Not just Mustafa)! Close to the Metro station and within walking distance of a few 24x7 restaurants. Our flight got in very early and hotel check-in was at 2pm, it wasn't a problem since we walked around and found many eating joints! The staff was very helpful, welcoming and organised despite full occupancy. Though it was CRAZY on the weekends since practically all Indians who live in Singapore gather around in Little India...so avoid staying here if it overlaps a weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, service disappointing”
Reviews.Author: SGG2010
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had booked a double room in this hotel for four nights in February 2010 and had paid the whole amount in advance through the travel agent. On checking into the hotel, we were told that there were no double rooms available and were given a room with twin beds. We were very disappointed as we could not go to another hotel because of the advance payment already having been made. After speaking to the manager we were given a double room for the last two nights of our stay. The rooms were lovely and there was no problem at all there. I would recommend this hotel but would ask everyone to make sure beforehand and to confirm the room type directly from the hotel staff before making the payment.

Reviews.Title: “first class hotel in little india Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Melypoo
Reviews.Content: room with lcd flat screen tv/satellite programmes,king size bed,. bath robes, tea and coffee making,bath and shower,fresh fruit provided.large swimming pool with gym.free wifi in all rooms, plus 4 computer stations just off hotel foyer/cafe.bar and 2 restaurants.hotel entrance is opposite Farrer Park MTR station- 10 mins into city centre. rooms can be booked at many of the main travel agents at good discounts.ideal hotel if you dont want to be in city centre,Little India has its own character.

Reviews.Title: “3rd time this year, and still good ! ;)”
Reviews.Author: xREVENTONx
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel once again this year visiting for the Grand Prix, Hotel, Location was as expected from my previous stays, however checking in service was slow this time, waited a few hours before I got a room (although check in was 12pm I believe) I arrived 6 hrs prior, however they got me a room ready within 3.5 hrs. had a sleep in their lobby :) overall the experience from the hotel was decent, if your not fussed and want a place to sleep its very good for that, if you want 18k gold plated toilet seats and diamond encrusted door handles and a bottle of Bollinger and caviar in the fridge, this isn't the hotel for you ;) however if your a person who is seeking something that isn't dirty, or nasty but is looking for a quality comfortable experience in a hotel that rooms have fairly good setups. then this is the place for you! :D

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if you don't have business in the "Little India" area”
Reviews.Author: RyanColombo
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel if you have to be in the "Little India" area or want to spend shopping at the Famous Mustapha center. But if you'd like to get a taste of Singapore this is the WRONG area to stay in. The Hotel in itself was great, go for the Orchid Club rooms which are worth the extra money especially since you get to use the lounge through out the day which well stocked with snacks and drinks, in the evenings they serve cocktails and Sushi. The main gripe I had with the hotel was that the room has connecting doors to the next room and through the door you can hear everything that goes on, As I had noisy neighbors who joked and laughed until the wee hours of the morning, I did not get much sleep. The Free WIFI was most welcome!

Reviews.Title: “Parkroyal is good but ...”
Reviews.Author: ljkjp
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fine for sleeping/taking a bath or shower and there is a good breakfast buffet but the Chinese restaurant, Hai Xiang, will put dishes you did not order on your table; you must pay for these. They also ask you to sign a second receipt when you pay by credit card. This looks very much like an authorization to charge the bill to your room - I refused to sign this even after they said, "Oh, just a quick signature for our financial records is OK". They were insistent that I sign - I saw no reason to sign a second time. The food was mediocre. The only other gripe is that WiFi is NOT available in your room, as erroneously advertised, but there are "hot spots" inside the hotel - try near the lifts. Parkroyal is better than the York Hotel and the location is great - the City Square Mall, opposite, has a supermarket and lots of FOOD COURTS plus the usual shops. MUSTAFA CENTRE, behind the hotel, is an emporium but without alcohol. Nearby restaurants are mainly Indian - includiing vegetarian- inexpensive and good. The MRT is less than 5 mins. away.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gerold-Vienna
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is close to the subway (about five minutes walk). The room is very cosy and clean, also the staff is very helpfull and friendly. I book with breakfast which where I could choose from indian, japanese and continental offers (I always had japanese and afterwards indian - not the other way round ;-) After a sweaty stroll through the city enjoy the pool!

Reviews.Title: “Just loved my stay there”
Reviews.Author: ankit4814
Reviews.Content: Park royal on kitchener road, Singapore was the best hotel we stayed during the course of our honeymoon in SE Asia... the suites were classy and comfortable... staff was courteous and the food was gud too... being centrally located in Singapore also helped.. and the location is esp gud for Indians as the area has a lot of indian outlets too... out n out the experience was very satisfying for me...

Reviews.Title: “overpriced and rundown”
Reviews.Author: wanderer_au
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I've ever felt the need to write a bad review for a hotel. Rooms were clean but old , very run down and many things broken. Drains in bathroom smelt strongly of urine. Spare blankets unwashed and extremely smelly. Food very overpriced, and so were our rooms. Staff mostly very helpful and pleasant and pool/gym good but AVOID this hotel. We have stayed at much better hotels in Singapore for less. I think Parkroyal have spent money doing up lobby and nothing else. Other Parkroyal (on beach) much better hotel all round.

Reviews.Title: “Nice average hotel”
Reviews.Author: plumb209
Reviews.Content: Hotel and room were tidy. was expensive and bar was overpriced. the staff were very helpful and the food was good. Good location to explore little india.

Reviews.Title: “very disappointing - over priced”
Reviews.Author: scuttleb
Reviews.Content: This was to be the grand finale to a wonderful gathering of family from all over the world. What a let down. One room booked for three eventually had a fold-away camp bed delivered. In one room the bath emptied very quickly not down the plug hole but through the tiles on the side of the bath over the floor. Tiles around the pool were dangerously slippery. A dinner for 4 adults and two small children cost over $300. The rooms and corridors were musty and in need of refurbishment.Have informed our travel agent

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 50_s0methings
Reviews.Content: Room was clean if a bit dated. First impression was brown and drab. But room is large and facilties fine. Staff are very friendly and helpful. Even gave me a birthday cake. Public areasare better than the rooms. We didn't eat in hotel so can't comment on food. It is very close to Ferrer MRT so very convenient and you can eat in Central Mall for very little. If you can get a good deal then it is a very acceptable hotel but don't expect 5*

Reviews.Title: “terrible rooms!!”
Reviews.Author: Yuvraj21
Reviews.Content: i was with my parents and we were given such a bad room. it had ugly old carpet on the floor. sucha put off!!!! location was ok if you want to be around little india, theres a new mall opened rite opp the hotel... mustafa mall just behind... food was good at hotel. but overall room was BAD!!

Reviews.Title: “What a tip”
Reviews.Author: Brisbanebrian60
Reviews.Content: On transit back to Brisbane and needed a night at this hotel. Booked over internet after seeing such wonderful pictures but was absolutely horrified at the state of the hotel. The foyer was tired and old looking but the rooms were by far the worst I have ever experienced. Walls were dirty, not marked but dirty, the rooms were barely furnished and the airconditioning in my brothers room didn't work in Singapore in August. Breakfast was a total joke and we all booked via there website only to have problems checking in. Also not the best part of town to stay in. I would never recommend this tip to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “An Indian experience”
Reviews.Author: Auris57
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for our stop over en-route back to the UK from Brisbane. It wasn't our preferred choice at the time but all that was available at the time. We booked a family room which was large enough for three of us. The room was spotless and being on the 16th floor gave us a good view over the city. Room service was excellent but on the pricey side. We spent much time round the pool area, this was fine but there was little shade and the pool side was very slippy when wet. Breakfast was included with our room rate and this was an experience in itself. By the time I had queued and got my fried eggs, everyone else had eaten their food! One major plus for us with this hotel was the location. It was handy for just about everything, even 24hour shopping if your that way inclined. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We loved the little shop in the lobby. One negative thing was the stair case leading up to lobby, not good for some. Overall we had a pleasurable experience but would most likely stay elsewhere on a repeat visit.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience”
Reviews.Author: SriramG
Reviews.Content: I had stayed in Parkroyal hotel on kitchener road during my trip to Singapore. We selected this hotel based on the excellent reviews it had received. Its Centrally located in Singapore with easy access to the MRT. The service offered is excellent. The rooms were posh and clean. The room service was very prompt. Overall an amazing experience and total worth for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: MidlandsJoanne
Reviews.Content: Spent a wonderful 4 days here. Staff very friendly and helpful. Breakfast great. Bar, relaxing and good choice of bar meals and deals on drinks. Plenty of sun beds round pool. Located in Little India - Mustafa, market behind and loads of restaurants offering good value for money meals. Metro across the road from the front of the hotel offering quick and efficient travel to city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Little India on the doorstep”
Reviews.Author: frithnow
Reviews.Content: We chose Parkroyal on the basis of other reviews here. As mentioned in other reviews it is pretty well across the road from Farrer Park MRT Station. For shoppers it's sandwiched between the incredible Mustapha Centre and a new shopping mall. The new mall has plenty of western and tame eastern food for the unadventurous. For gourmets, and in particular vegetarians, the proximity to Little India is fantastic. The pool got top marks from our 6 year old (we sampled three hotels on our trip). It's big and deep. The change rooms have lockers unlike some other hotels. The gym has a nice outlook over pool and looks as though it has had a recent freshen up. The rooms are comfortable enough, but suffer from adjoining doors with poor soundproofing. We asked to move after two nights next door to a man who conducted phone calls at high volume well into the night. The hotel was accommodating in this regard.

Reviews.Title: “A convenient place for business and shopping”
Reviews.Author: satishskrish
Reviews.Content: Located near Mustafa, it gives you the convenience for shopping till late in the night. All types of cuisines at a stones' throw is another plus point

Reviews.Title: “A city hotel”
Reviews.Author: Amit_Mittal
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Singapore on family vacation. Reached Singapore in afternoon from Langkawi. On arriving at Singapore was greeted by an agent who transferred us to the Hotel Parkroyal on Kitchener Road. The hotel has a modern facade just like all other buildings in Singapore. It is situated right outside the Farrer Park Metro Station, in one corner of the Little India. On the back of Hotel is the famous Mustafa Departmental store. So it is most convenient for Indians who are traveling on their first tour/ vacation outside country. Being on the one corner of Little India there are lots of Indian Restaurants offering vegetarian food at convenient price. The Hotel lobby was small, but it seems that they have purposely kept it small and have created a separate lounge for visitors since it attracts lots of visitors waiting for their transfer or various Singapore city tour. We had to wait for our room as the check in time is 2:00 PM. There is nothing to write about the check in process since the associate on reception worked in mechanical manner with no emotions or expressions on face. We were given a room on 7/8 th floor with a view of the swimming pool on 3rd floor of the hotel and the city line outside it. The rooms were simple with no frills. The bath rooms did not have any guest towel, in repeated reminders to the Guest Assistance, it took long to get the same delivered. The breakfast at hotel was sumptuous and elaborate.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel Stay”
Reviews.Author: jagjit_singh_makar
Reviews.Content: I stayed at ParkRoyal during my honeymoon in Singapore and it was simply amazing. It has great services, it's very close to little India, close to metro station, amazig food...all in all it is great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, service standards lacking”
Reviews.Author: MAPai
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for our honeymoon. We got upgraded to an executive room so don't know how the standard rooms are, but the executive rooms were nice and spacious (we did notice cobwebs however!). There was a fruit basket on arrival but we didn't get newspapers. The hotel seemed really crowded, we had to queue up for almost 20mins before we could check in, and similarly at the coffee shop for breakfast, service was slow, the staff seemed rushed and the tables looked dirty. We were even seated at a dirty table and had to wait for them to clean it up. The location is good, in case u're looking for some bargain shopping, coz it's right next door to Mustafa's. You get reimbursed the GST for anything you buy there and their currency exchange rates are good. There's also another mall across the road as well as a metro station. The hotel is in Little India, so for Indians, that's good as there are many Indian restaurants around if you feel a bit home sick or are a vegetarian.

Reviews.Title: “My June 1st week in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: kousalya
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Hotel Park Royal in Kitchener Road. Adjacent on the Hotel's side is the Traditional 24x7 and ever expanding Mustafa shopping centre and right opposite is City Mall, the newest addtion to Singapore's showy shopping centres. Religious Walk spots in the Serangoon road are the South Indian Hindu temple and Isalmic mosque. For business meets Suntec and Singapore's CBD is 10 minutes away by Taxi. For fun travellers MRT's pink line is just in the Serangoon - Kitchner Road taraffic signal. Internationaly popular South Indian eating branded hotels are one after another. Certainly a good spot for stay both for business as well as leasure travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Professional Hotel close to shopping area (Mustafa, Bugis Street etc.)”
Reviews.Author: rajkul
Reviews.Content: Me and my colleagues had to visit Singapore for a week long conferences. Though it was booked by the inviting company and expenses paid by them, I would next time book it for personal reasons. It is rightly priced at around SGD 120 for the facilities provided. However I did notice many people returning without booking or had some issues with bookings as the hotel is mostly booked. Hence you might want to book it in advance before checking in. Did not have any hassles in particular at the hotel and the staff was quite friendly however checking in took 30 mins, could be my bad luck as most of the guests were checking in then. You may also want to note their check in time mentioned on their site which is around 12:00 if I am not mistaken. Connectivity: You may take a MRT (Mass Rapid Transport) i.e. metro rail, from the Changi airport till Ferrer Park station. The hotel is at 2 mins walking distance from the metro station which implies excellent connectivity for any place around Singapore through MRT. Since it is close to the city/commercial area location is quite suited for the ones looking for something close to offices. Specially for Indians the nearby locality rightly called 'Little India' suits well for food and other requirements. Overall the hotel would not upset you on any part unless you are looking for luxurious amenities which you could find in other five star hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, quiet room”
Reviews.Author: Janulik
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel very good, our room was on 14th floor and was very quiet, one of the quietest we've ever been in, bathroom had a bath which was very nice. We also had nice views across the city. I also liked that you can switch the room AC off completely if you wish.The staff were actually friendly and the check in and check out didn't take long at all despite I can imagine it can if there is a large group of people waiting. The bar area downstair is nice. We didn't have breakfast in the hotel so can't comment on this. We found the City Square Mall opposite excellent for breakfast with Toast Box, Kopitiam, Banquet, Coffee Bean and more to choose from. The MRT Farrer Road MRT station is a short walk away and is accessible from the City Square Mall shopping centre from B1.

Reviews.Title: “Singapore Surprise”
Reviews.Author: NabbuNuts
Reviews.Content: Date: 30 April 2010 We booked this hotel as it was in Little India near Mustafa centre. It is really nice place with good service, helpful staff, nice ambience and tasty food also. We have seen other hotels in Singapore and talked to friends who stayed in other hotels. I recommend this hotel as it is better than others for all of above plus it's location is d best for vegetarian Indians specially.It is very conveniently located. It is luxurious and very good value for money. MRT, Taxi, cab, sight-seeing, other booking facilities are available. They could have provided complimentary mineral water once a day, rather charging too much for it. Apart from charges it is very good option.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel and best location”
Reviews.Author: brijesh460
Reviews.Content: it is one of the best hotel which i have seen. its a five star property. location is good. Mustafa, a shopping centre famous in Singapore, is behind this hotel. Breakfast quality is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Service & cleanliness & No Value”
Reviews.Author: Rajatkn
Reviews.Content: I checked-in on May 25 and checked-out on May 29 and this was my worst stay ever globally in any hotel. The ordeal started with the check-in process... though the hotel has 4 check-in desks, 2 were operational, despite of the fact 5 people were waiting in the check-in queue either to check-in or to check-out or for assistance. It took 45 minutes for me to check-in.. alright atleast I checked-in. I booked the hotel on Apr 20 and have specifically requested for King Bed, got the written confirmation of same, but when i checked-in, they said that they do not have king bed available and i had to accommodate in a twin bed room. Imagine, with a small child (sharing bed), how will we accommodate with twin beds. They were not ready to upgrade and were more keen on me taking an extra bed for the child at a price... cross selling. I spoke to the reservations manager on duty and she was very rude (unlike people in the hospitality industry) and was not willing to accommodate me in a king bed room. After 2 hours of argument, she was willing to change my room next day into King Bed room. Atleast I got something for rest of my stay... She also mentioned that they will join the beds and attached is the picture of the room after they joined the beds. Apparently, when they changed the location of beds, the entire floor was dirty. their cleanliness staff does not clean the under bed area... We somehow spent a night and were looking forward to a new room next day. Next day, we got our rooms in the evening when we returned from sightseeing and apparently this time we got King Bed, but the furniture was broken, TV not working, Shower panel not working properly... we complained again and the staff replied that you always complaint and never compromise... what an attitude of a hotel staff. We are paying to listen to all this crap... Neverthless, we decided that we will never return to this hotel and will write a strong letter to the hotel management. I wrote to the hotel management and still waiting for their answer. I do not recommend this hotel to any of the traveler. You can get much better hotels at better prices, but this one is not worth your money. We are staying in a hotel for service, cleanliness and comfort, else we could always go and stay in a dormitory...

Reviews.Title: “NRP_PARKROYAL”
Reviews.Author: nrprasad_78
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a very convinient place for Shopping, as this is situated stone throw from Mustafa Shopping Centre, Transport Etc. This is very ideal for stay, specially for South Indians as this located very close to restaurants, who serves south indian foods. Actually I went for SPA section ( Body massage) & I found it was very expensive & compared to other Hotel/ Outlets, nearby this hotel. In fact I'd asked for a discount which was declined by the Hotel. Probably they may loose customers, if they don't review their tariff for body massaging. NR PRASAD BANGALORE, INDIA

Reviews.Title: “Recommended anyday...”
Reviews.Author: PraksMumbai
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at Parkroyal on Kitchener Road thru a known contact in Singapore for 4 days (May 23 - 26) for a holiday. The biggest USP of this place is its location, the heart of Little India. For a vegetarian like me and my family, this was a blessing since a good no. of veg. Indian restaurants (Saravana Bhavan, Komalas, Ananda Bhavan) located nearby. Also just behind this place is the 24 hour Mustafa shopping centre. Since its open throughout the night, one can always hop in at the wee hours and shop rather than putting in daytime. Another advantage of Mustafa is that they offer the best currency exchange rates in Singapore and accept most of the known currencies (Indian Rupee included) The service is quick, friendly and with a smile The buffet breakfast spread is good even for vegetarians. The rooms are clean and the housekeeping staff really efficient. Overall, great service with just one word of caution on the tour desk. The travel / tour desk is manned by staff (very specifically, Mala from RMG Tours) which seem friendly but do not really mean to deliver. My experience was bad when I booked for our Universal Studios tour thru them. Mala did not bother to tell us that every visitor at Universal Studios is entitled for meal and souvenir vouchers worth SGD10. It was only after we returned from the place did some fellow hotel guest mentioned this to me. When Mala was asked about this she was curt and said that they are not supposed to tell this to the visitors and it is the responsibility of Universal Studios to inform the visitors. My only issue here is then why should any hotel guest opt for booking thru this Tour desk if the basics are not informed. Barring this incident which leaves a sour taste, overall experience was good

Reviews.Title: “verygood”
Reviews.Author: deepak1979
Reviews.Content: the location is good,as there are many good veg. restaurents and shopping malls near by . every thing about the hotel is good, exept the reception staff, they were never smiling.

Reviews.Title: “good but could have been better”
Reviews.Author: PuneAsh
Reviews.Content: 1) Location : Its good for indians and veggies, several indian restaurants nearby. The MRT station is nearby and buses to the city/elsewhere are available from nearby bus-stops. And for shoppers, mustafa is next door, though not sure if you get very cheap deals. 2) Taxis are very readily available, the hotel staff helps you fetch taxis 3) Rooms, especially on the upper floors, are neat and tidy. I got special rates (and free breakfast) since I had singapore airlines boarding pass. 4) Breakfast is lavish with a mix of continental and indian, though the menu doesn't change much over days. 5) The hotel is very strict with checkin/checkout times. I don't believe the hotel was full, yet the hotel made me wait till the the checkin time (2pm) after I had reached early. The checkin/reception is quite often a bottleneck with long waits in the checkin queue.

Reviews.Title: “Be on the go and not stuck at the hotel and you´ll be happy.”
Reviews.Author: twosides
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Park Royal, with a side trip to Kuala Lumpur over New years eve, twice. Upon arrival in Singapore and upon returning from KL. Helpfulness of the staff seemed to be mainly dependent on the rush of customers they were exposed to, though there weren´t extreme negatives. I had an individual I did not know leave messages for the room number daily, and even though I told the staff I did not care for them, they were still forwarded. Some of the rooms are basic and well used, but all the rooms we lived in had bath tubs. After a long day in Singapore heat I found them nice with AC and the beds comfy. Be wary of the rooms with the connecting doors (unless it´s your own two parties), they are merely blocking views, not noise. Internet is pay per hour. During the first stay and per request we got switched to a much nicer room close to the pool. That didn´t work after our return. The hotel was almost overbooked - if you plan to go around holiday time, DO reserve in advance, and reconfirm, if you leave for a while - so there was no choice but the dreaded door room. It was louder, but we survived. Try the pool. We had robes, slippers, and fresh towels. It´s not exotic, but you´ll like it, and I found the seating areas inviting. There is also a fitness room adjacent, but I did not use that. Breakfast is o.k., if a bit of a stretch, as it tries to accomodate European, American, African and Asian tastes at the same time. For a supply of fresh fruit other than daily melons, make the short trip around the corner to to Mustafa's shopping center. If you find the restaurant pricey, by all means don´t stay in the hotel to eat. Asian folk just LOVE to eat, and you find cheap and cheapest foodstalls and restaurants all over Little India. At a little African place at a nearby corner we had more fresh food cooked under our eyes than we could clean up, and for next to nothing. If you prefer vegetarian, Indian places offer variety. And if you absolutely need a burger, by all means, this can be accomplished too. I don´t recommend sticking with an average hotel kitchen, if the sounds and smells of Asia are waiting right outside your doorstep. And there is always the underground close by, if you think you need to go farther, or fancy a somewhat more upscale surrounding. It is probably wise to expect some construction in progress somewhere close to the hotel. Singapore seems to be hustling, bustling and moving constantly. Nothing will stay the same for long as far as buildings go. But don´t let it keep you from enjoying what´s to see in Singapore. Immerse yourself, instead of staying put.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: SABokke
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the middle of the "Little India" area of Singapore and has good access to the MRT and there is a shopping centre across the road which seems fairly new but for me the only worthwhile thing at the centre was the wide choice of places to eat. Overall I was disapointed with the hotel. The room was clean and reasonable size but thats where the experience ended. For me the worst was the dining area (I only had breakfast there) which was complete chaos every morning. There were almost always no teaspoons for the coffee, They sometimes ran out of coffee cups, there were not enough glasses for the juice, the butter was put out frozen solid and completely unusable, the coffee machine (a nice benefit normally) made lukewarm coffee. That being said, there was a fairly extensive choice of food. The room walls seemed to me to be made of cardboard, I had a lot of noise from the neighbouring rooms and was woken up several times by the noise and you could hear the room doors slamming from all the neighbouring rooms when people left their rooms. The +20 minutes it took to check out just put the icing on the cake, good thing I was not in a hurry........

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but front desk can do better”
Reviews.Author: Maheep1969
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights with wife and 2 kids. I had booked a family room online. On reaching the hotel at around 10 in the morning, i was told that check in time is 2 pm. My younger son (10 years) was not feeling well, so i requested the front desk if they could give him some place to lie down. The person (Rally) rudely turned the request down, saying that we could go to the pool area. We enquired twice or thrice if the room was ready before two pm, but were told that it was being cleaned. I asked them to hurry up due to the condition with my son, but the response was rude both times. t their rooms on time At 2 pm, I checked again and was told that the "room will be ready in another 15-20 minutes". Then i lost it. I told them that the hotel check in time is 2 pm and i want a room NOW... The front desk was still hesitant so i asked them to call the Manager. She came and was gracious enough to give us two connecting rooms on the Orchid Club floors. But the experience was bitter. The Rally guy was downright rude. The lobby was full of aged persons and family with young kids all waiting for 2 pm to pass. God knows they got the rooms even then or not. The front desk really needs to get its act together. The hotel was full of Indian guests and I felt that they were the most ill treated. Pity for a good hotel on a great location...

Reviews.Title: “A very good experience”
Reviews.Author: lucem
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is very good. There is an MRT station a few metres away, a new shopping mall with good eateries opposite and Little India behind. The rooms are a good size and the beds comfortable. Staff were helpful and courteous. The swimming pool was a good size and there was a separate small shallow pool for children.

Reviews.Title: “Best Affordable hotel In Singapore”
Reviews.Author: AJMore
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with all amenities .Excellent location bey near to Mustafa shopping centre. Excellent staff and food.One of the best place to leave in Singapore.i was there for almost a month.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Frostiesf
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a Singapore Stopover Holiday, staying at the Parkroyal on Kitchener Road. What a wonderful time was had by all. My 9 month old was thoroughly spoiled by all the staff - especially at meal times. (She misses the attention since returning home!) We were caught up in the flight disruption due to the volcanic eruption and the staff could not have been more helpful. Throughout the time even when there was no information they made it their business to try and find out from Singapore Airlines if there had neen any updates. They did their best to extend our stay within SIA guidelines which we managed to do for an extra night. We were sad to leave. The fact that my two parents (pensioners) look forward to visiting Singapore again is partly down to the friendliness of everyone at Kitchener Road. The hotel itself was in an excellent location to the metro and we travelled around well. If you needed anything then you had a new shopping centre across the road and the Mustafa Centre round the corner. You could buy anything 24 hours a day. We changed money at this centre and got a very good rate. We look forward to visiting again and exploring more of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Large Hotel, Good Quality, Good Service, nothing special”
Reviews.Author: PaulFarnhamUK
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located in Little India in Singapore. Very Large 23 floors. It had a nice outside large pool area. Staff were really nice and helpful and you felt they tried to do their best for you. We had a large room with 1 double bed, 1 single bed and 1 roll away. The room was very spacious, but quite expensive (Over 400 SGD/Night). I would recommend it, but I am sure their are better hotels in singapore in better locations. We had to get taxi's anywhere interesting.

Reviews.Title: “really good facilites and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: daisyEssex
Reviews.Content: enjoyed our 2 night stay just around the corner for Little India with a wealth of restaurants . the breakfast was excellent and staff very polite-rooms clean, quiet and well furnished. would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, good food”
Reviews.Author: Amarin83
Reviews.Content: LOCATION: Very near the farrer park MRT and right next to the new shopping mall. SERVICE: staff were friendly and helpful. however, the front desk person took some time to check us in. Overall, I would give 100% for effort. ROOMS: The rooms were nice, comfy and clean. Some of the amenities such as shavers and toothbrushes were not readily available in the bathroom. and the walls between rooms are too thin...I could hear the next door neighbour watching TV all night. BREAKFAST: breakfast buffet at the "spice brasserie" was fantastic. I loved the variety.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: kittywills
Reviews.Content: nice hotel clean and comfortable. location may not be to everyones liking but we loved it in little india. only ate one in the hotel a sandwich by the pool expensive and maybe the worst sandwich i have ever eaten. Street food from bar at corner of hotel fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Experience Was Great !”
Reviews.Author: xREVENTONx
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Park Royal on Kitchener Rd early Feb 2010. Foyer is very nice design, staff helpful sometimes, reception a bit slow and all over the place (as if your purchasing a meal at a busy McDonald's but a busy McDonald's would possibly be faster) Rooms were quite average, bathroom was the best part of the room, very Contemporary Designed, and linen was good, but I believe the Family room's are getting a renovation soon or in the process of doing it. facilities such as the gym are stunning, and pool is fantastic, very clean and crisp. if your looking for a hotel and not fussed then this is the one for you.

Reviews.Title: “Very flashy facade - basic rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Halletwood
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a long way from the centre but the tube train is realiable and easy. The approach and arrival at the hotel is impressive. I wish the bedrooms matched. Ours was basic, the air conditioning noisy and, worst of all, the fridge did not work. The engineer assured us it did work, if we took all the contents out and left the outside door of the box it was housed in open. Fortunately we were only using the hotel as a base in which case it fulfilled its function. The internet was out of action (we were told we could go down the street to the internet cafe instead), the Spa non functioning and the meals (which we didn't eat) expensive. All in all, over-rated I fear.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Must for all Indians.”
Reviews.Author: vicky_mamc
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to singapore with my wife. As both of us are vegetarians, we wanted a place where we would be able to find good Indian vegetarian food, which is usually a problem in most of the countries. I was suggested this Hotel by one of my friends, and we were really amazed to see the facilities available near the hotel. Lots and lots of Indian restaurants nearby, 24-hr Mustafa opposite to the Hotel and MRT station at walking distance. What more you want..we had an excellant time in Singapore and Park Royal Hotel had a big role to play in that..Would surely visit there...

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, slow service”
Reviews.Author: hothotelbunny
Reviews.Content: pros: -room and bathroom is clean. -housekeeping, concierge and restaurant staff are friendly and with smiles most of the time. -clean pool and well equipped gym -mrt station within walking distance and a mall right opposite hotel cons: -unhelpful and unfriendly front desk/office staff. -VERY SLOW SERVICE! we arrived at the hotel at half hour to midnight and we waited for a good 35 minutes for our turn to check in. the best part was that there were only one person in front of us at the queue! whenever we asked for something to be delivered to the room, it takes at least 25 minutes, even if it's only for a pair of slippers! -internet key-pass has to be refreshed every 24 hours and whenever we call the operator, they are rude and sound like we're a hassle to them. such unprofessional service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: barty11
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Hotel very early in the morning about 7am after a 10 hour flight. Due to the Hotel being full previous night our room was not ready until 930am. Not a major as we dropped our bags and went for a stroll through Little India. When we returned to the hotel we were upgraded immediately which was great as we were on our honeymoon. The staff were fantastic especially the front of house staff checking us in, very nice and happy to help with anything. We stayed for 4 nights and breakfast was included every morning. The breakfast was great with a huge selection of all sorts. Seen the hotel is located in Little India, there are alot of different nationalities staying so the breakfast catered for all nationalities. The location of the hotel was great. The MRT underground railway was just across the road which you can take to all parts of Singapore, little India on the doorstep, shopping, foods of the world, everything very handy. The Pool was very nice and clean. After a hot day it was great relaxing in and beside the pool. Pool staff very freindly also. All and all it was a very pleasant stay with a nice room, Hotel Staff very helpful and always smiling. Ps: if you time, go to the Zoo. Great day out and probably the best in the world

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JeanetteM
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel but a little noisy at night with people returning to their rooms. Staff were very good and helpful. Forget trying to take out money from a ATM on a Saturday. Each machine had an approximate queue of 20 to 30 people. Apart from that I did like it. Singapore is very clean and has a wonderful botanical garden. We went on the Singapore Flyer which is similar to the London Eye only bigger and we also took in the city bus tour. All in all I was really surprise how much I liked Singapore and would go back without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a Stopover”
Reviews.Author: EnglandPepsi
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights so that we could explore Singapore.. We found it to be comfortable and despite reading that the staff were not too friendly we had no problems with that at all. On arriving at the hotel after a long flight I realised that I had left my hand luggage in the transport from the airport. The staff very kindly got in touch with the driver and it was duly returned to the hotel. I could not thank them enough as this is not a good start to any holiday. We arrived early in the morning and the room was not ready until11.00am but this could be the fault of the holiday company and not the hotel. After a 12 hour flight it would have been great to be able to get into a room. When we finally got a room it had a strong smell of smoke and we had specifically asked for non smoking rooms. I suppose you will always get guests who still smoke despite being asked not to. We asked to be moved and at first they said could the room be sprayed but we said no and were finally given another room. The downside was that it was not available until 3.00pm!!!! When we got the room it was worth the wait because it was much better decorated than the first room (which did not look too good at all with paint peeling off the ceiling). Even my husband, who thought that at first,I was being fussy, agreed that we had made the right decision in asking to be moved. We did not eat at the hotel as we were out all the time but the rooms were very clean and tidy. It was a very good location for sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Nice, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: brianp021
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel very clean rooms, Nice KIng sized bed.The location was good for the MTR, which was just down the road from the hotel and a day ticket was of good value We had breakfast in the hotel which was of good value but a lack of western food (no cold meats or cheese) A good choice of oriental food if you are in for that kind of thing in a morning but, curry is not up our street for breakfast, There was hot western style food but limited for choice. We did not eat in the hotel at any other time, we found a nice cafe in China Town cheap with large portions and cheap beer. Reception and portering services were great. Overall it was hard to find anything really wrong with the hotel all the staff were polite and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't make the grade with its Club Facilities - but pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: OzinJakarta
Reviews.Content: This was a quick trip to Singapore from Indonesia on a "Visa Run", so no business appointments. I selected Parkroyal on Kitchener Road which is located in "Little India" but still easy access by public transport to all areas. There is a new Shopping Centre opposite the property and Mustafa Centre with its 24-hour shopping around the corner - plus some really interesting restaurants catering to all tastes. I had secured an Internet Price of S$220.10 (including Tax/Service) which was a significant saving on the Published Rate for an Orchid Club Room. Even at this reduced rate, the Orchid Club was still only very average value-for-money. Check-in was in the 19th Floor Orchid Club Lounge which was handled efficiently by friendly staff. My Room 1918 close to lounge was well-appointed and recently refurbished; there was flat-screen TV with good channel selection, great single lounge chair with foot-stool for relaxing - also comfortable office-style chair and internet connection (free unlimited broadband) providing an excellent work-station for the business traveller. In-room electronic safe is large enough to hold a laptop and there was an abundance of coat hangers (often missed) plus iron/board. Bathroom is well-appointed but quite small. Towels were of good quality but no face towels provided (was told by Duty Manager that "guests used to steal them so we don't put them in rooms any more"). The toiletry selection was incomplete and soap (only one piece in a room reserved for two) was inappropriate size for a "premium room". After my complaints to Duty Managers on two occasions about "in-room" inadequacies, there was a full complement of toiletries (this time for two guests) following the morning room make-up - they had also managed to "find" two face towels. In the "Orchid Club" the "signature orchid stem" was missing from the room - although a selection of fresh fruits was provided. Orchids - so prevalent in Singapore - were also nowhere to be seen in the Orchid Club Lounge, which is really quite small - causing tables to be placed very close together (more like a coffee shop than a club lounge) and with very limited lounge-style seating adjacent to the television/reading area. There was just one laptop computer for (complimentary) use by Club guests. If you are planning to stay here and expect Club Lounge facilities commensurate with those found in almost any hotel offering this service - but more importantly if you are coming from Parkroyal Kuala Lumpur - you will be shocked to say the least with the gross inadequacies you will find at this property. The "all-day refreshments" offered were just Coffee/Tea and Cookies. The evening "hors d'oeuvres and cocktail" between 18.00 and 19.30 were in one word "horrible"! Forget any aspirations you may have about there being a choice here - two "dim-sum" varieties in double-layer chafing dish (warm at first but cold when burner went-out and wasn't replaced) with lower layer stuck to banana leaf and impossible to remove without falling apart), a "fried ??" served cold on small aluminium foil dishes (no china here!), Corn Crisps and commercial Salsa made-up the "selection", NO International Cheese platter here either - just individually-wrapped "Bonbel" and "Babybel" (ok...they DO come from France) with Water Crackers and one variety of Dried Fruit. Staff in Club Lounge are all extremely friendly and do their best under what could be described as "extenuating circumstances". Breakfast the following morning was equally un-inspiring (no kitchen so no choice of fresh-cooked eggs) so I had breakfast in Spices Brasserie Cafe which had a reasonable selection and unusually-good coffee. I returned to the Club Lounge for Coffee and Pastries. Standard Operational Procedures are virtually non-existent at Parkroyal on Kitchener Road. I had arranged an appointment with the General Manager to discuss the problems I had encountered. He is extremely personable and has been at this property for around six months - is also very aware of what is needed to "bring his property up-to-speed". He explained that the Parkroyal Group is going-through a "re-positioning" exercise and is under a recently-appointed CEO. On my return later in the day to my room, I found a bottle of excellent Red Wine and a hand-written note from the General Manager thanking me for my feed-back - a positive sign that the property is in good hands! It may be that demand is insufficient for this property to operate a "fully-fledged" Club Lounge. Its owners must decide to either elevate the standard of facilities and services to an acceptable level - or disband the Club concept and return the rooms into regular inventory simply as "premium rooms" without "club extras". As it is right now, I expect that there is a very low incidence of "repeat" business and even less "referral" business for the Orchid Club. The warmth and sincerity of the Club Staff and its very helpful Club Manager - plus the genuine enthusiasm demonstrated during my meeting with the General Manager - would be sufficient for me to return to this property on my next visit to Singapore. I should like to believe that my next report on Parkroyal will be much more positive.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: NottinghamCyclops
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel twice - once for three nights and again a week later for two nights. The first thing to understand is, that this is a transit hotel and definitely not a holiday hotel. Both rooms we stayed in were not very clean and the bathrooms did not smell too good. The walls in the room were a bit tatty and despite having spent a week in Borneo - this was the only place where we were both bitten by "insects". The pool is adequate. The bar is almost always empty and at 14 singapore dollars (£7) for a small beer we realised why. The evening concierge staff were not too interested and we had to unload our own luggage from the taxi. We were told it would be delivered to our room - after almost an hour I went and fetched it myself, no one stopped me so I could have taken anyones luggage. I reported a faulty clock in the room on our first night - it is probably still not working - no one came.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Nadiavd
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights, our room was on the floor with the pool right outside. The staff were superfriendly and helpful, the room was smallish but clean and the outdoor pool was great. Spa was closed which was a shame. Location was good, close to metro and shopping centre.

Reviews.Title: “A very large, comfortable hotel with fabulous views from our room”
Reviews.Author: bobmac0825
Reviews.Content: In 1983 my wife and I stayed here for 6 nights and found it to be perfect for our needs. In those days it was named the "President Merlin Hotel" and appeared to be very new. Our room was large enough, very comfortably furnished, and faced north-west which allowed us wonderful views from our very large windows. The staff were friendly and efficient. We did not eat there, preferring the foodhalls along Serangoon Road. I realise that this review is very much out of date but the hotel looks at least as pleasant as when we stayed there 27 years ago and that may indicate that the standard has been maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Find”
Reviews.Author: MM007
Reviews.Content: Nice clean hotel, Friendly staff, nice clean rooms, good food and facilities. The only problem is the location. the place to be in SIngapore is Orchard Road or around and this hotel was a short taxi ride away. If you are ok with that, then this hotel is brilliant

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, great price”
Reviews.Author: Yousuf007
Reviews.Content: If you like to stay in Little India near Mustaf shopping then this hotel is the best. Newly renovated. Very nice hotel with stylish reception, rooms etc. Big swimming pool, specially large kid's pool. The breakfast variety was huge, but more changes should be done on the menu, otherwise it becomes boring with same options, though lot. Very crowded, have to wait to get seated. Large Indian crowd. The hotel rate is the best for such class of hotel, 4.5 star :) The concierge staffs are very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Abominable”
Reviews.Author: mundanemuser
Reviews.Content: This is one of the worst hotels I've ever stayed at. To begin with, the reception area and lobby are extremely small. When we arrived at the hotel, it took us almost 3 hours to check-in, because there was a huge group waiting to check-in before us, and the staff were so boggled that they had no clue about what was happening around them. Once we were allotted our rooms finally, we realised what a huge mistake we had made selecting this hotel. The rooms were extremely compact, and with the beds occupying most of the space, they looked very congested. Even the paint on the walls was peeling off at some places. The bathrooms were kinda suffocating, as if you've been confined to a closed-space and neither were the toiletries satisfying. Even the kettle lying in one of our rooms was not operational and when we complained about the same, nobody bothered to replace it. Although the hotel is situated in a convenient location, with the mustafa centre as well as the MRT station nearby, but frankly, it is not worth the pain.

Reviews.Title: “A mixed review....”
Reviews.Author: MelPai
Reviews.Content: I have mixed felings about the hotel. On Arrival, we had to stand almost 20 mins in a queue to check in and although there are 3 counters at the Desk, at most times only one was manned. However on being told that we were on our honeymoon, the very nice lady at the Desk Nadiah, who spoke english very clearly and was quite courteous, upgraded us all the way from Superior to a room on the Executive floor. The lifts in this hotel are terribly slow and there is no indicator to show you which floor the elevator is stuck at currently, so you just have to wait for an undefined amount of time. The room was very spacious probably because it was a corner room, but my husband notice cobwebs on the ceiling (of a room in a 5 star hotel, and that too on the executive floor?) The Bathroom was large and spacious. The waiter who brought our room service order was trying to solicitate us to write good feedback about him on departure, even repeated his name a couple of times so we wouldn't forget, which we found very unprofessional. On the day of arrival, we stopped at the main restaurant to have a cup of tea while waiting to be assigned a room. We were seated at a dirty table and after waiting awhile, thinking that they would come back to clean it, we had to ask for it to be done. We were served tea in a mug, and as I couldn't find a place to keep the tea bag, I asked for a quarter plate, and would you believe it, they picked up a used plate from another empty table which had fruit peels on it, emptied it onto another plate on that table and brought the plate to me to put my tea bag on. Totally unprofessional for a 5 star hotel. The hotel is located right across a Mall and Metro station (Ferrer Park) and is right besides Mustafa where you can buy almost anything at bargain rates and get the best exchange rates too. There are plenty of restaurants close by within walking distance. All in all, the hotel was ok, but since they consider themselves to be a top rated hotel, I wouldnt recommend the hotel for someone expecting that high level of standard.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: Malcolm777
Reviews.Content: The staff were reasonably nice but not compared with everywhere else in Singapore which we found to be an amazingly freindly place. The Bed was so hard we had trouble sleeping. The bathroom smelled, was not clean and did not even get cleaned when the room was made up during the day. The televisions are old and pictures are poor. When asking for a wine at the pool bar we were told it would take half an hour to get a glass plus they charge extra to drink by the pool. The only good thing about the hotel is the new shopping centre accross the road.

Reviews.Title: “very clean we preseted hotel”
Reviews.Author: whiskeyjim
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Park Royle from the 30 Dec 09 to 2 Jan 10. The hotel was very welcoming from the moment we got there, the check in staff were very friendly and spoke very good english. The rooms were very spacious and very clean,with a very good shower in the bath room.A nice touch was a news papper left on the door handle every morning. The breakfasts were to a very high standard the wasnt much you could not have.If you didnt want to eat in the hotel there was plenty of good food outlet all close by which seemed to be open 24/7. The mtr was only a 3 mins walk away which would take you to any part of the city you wanted and was very cheep and the best way to travel.All in all i would recomend this hotel to any one.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, would only stay here in Singapore.”
Reviews.Author: Whildjohn
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for four nights during a Far East tour. Staff were superb, very courteous, friendly and nothing was too much trouble. Food in the restaurant was superb. The hotel is ideally located near the SMRT subway in Little India. Well worth a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: damudi
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel Rooms very comfortable well furnished and quiet Good quality and range for breakfast and other meals Good location for touring around singapore

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Hotel but wouldn't return”
Reviews.Author: localgal38
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night whilst in transit on the way to Australia. We were late arriving as our flight was delayed but the restaurant was still open. However 2 cheese sandwiches and 2 coffees were rather expensive. Room was sufficient for our brief stay but bed was very hard. Hotel appeared clean and staff were friendly, shame that the same could not be said about some of the other guests. Opposite the hotel is a brand new shopping centre filled with places to eat and shop, so dont eat at the expensive hotel restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay if you want to be near Little India”
Reviews.Author: Ozgirl73
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel from 9th Dec for 2 nights. It's in a great location if you want to be near Little India and Indian food. The hotel itself was clean and the staff were efficient. I got there around 9am in the morning and was told that my room wouldn't be ready until 11:30am. But in the meantime I could use there luggage storage facility and I could use the shower in the gym. Well, let me tell you that the shower was awesome. There was soap, shampoo, towels and a hair dryer. I was very happy to use the facilities and then go and have some breakfast before returning for check-in. There was an MRT (Ferrer Park) entrance and a brand new mall across the road. You could catch a bus stop for bus to Orchard Rd about 5 min walk away. Also very convinient was the 24 hour shopping in Mustafa Centre which is right behind the hotel. Within a few mins walk were Komala Vilas and Anand Bhavan - veg restaurants. There clientel at the hotel mainly appeared to be Indians. The room itself was a good size for a single person or a couple. In fact I believe it was on the large side for Singapore hotel rooms. The area surronding the hotel always felt safe even late at night. I give this one a thumb up!

Reviews.Title: “Exotic service, food and ambience”
Reviews.Author: Shyams
Reviews.Content: I happened to stay for the first time in Parkroyal hotel in Singapoire and I should say that they provided an excellent customer service to me. No matter what time of the day or night it was, their attendant was outside my room within 5 minutes of my phone call if I did need something from them. Their food, especially the moring breakfast included so much variety that I really felt as though I was in India and having home made breakfast. the taste was so delicious that I don't have words to express the same. Everytime I went around in the hotel, whether its the reception, lobyy, etc. it was quite cool and enjoying. I should say that this hotle deserves to be one of the best hotles in singapore.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Travelinwkids14
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. We were with both sets of our parents (in their 70s) and our 2 boys (7 and 9) for 5 nights and everyone agreed it was a great stay. The rooms were a good size and one child could stay for free in each room (we bought a couple of AU$20 mattresses from Mustafas next door as the hotel charge for a foldabed was ridiculous). The kids liked the pool and it was a nice place to relax for us all after a hard days shopping. The staff were efficient but not very friendly (our comparison is that we had just come from Phuket where everyone smiles). The MRT was close by and a good cheap way to get around. Mustafas is well worth a look and there is also a new shopping mall over the road. We will definitely stay here again for our next Singapore stay.

Reviews.Title: “REALLY GOOD HOTEL AND NOT REALLY GOOD STAFF HELPFUL”
Reviews.Author: KENNYJOHN
Reviews.Content: we stayed in this hotel for 3 nights after leaving Pattaya in Thai land we have been many palace and different kind of hotels. This hotel 3 star was ok and room was nice and huge really good space and condition room . The location was good and easy for all but the little thing a bout the staffs. I thnk it is not good to say now but need to improve.

Reviews.Title: “average stay”
Reviews.Author: anilkakkar
Reviews.Content: my date of stay was in Aug 2009.... Well to start with i had a bad experience with the staff at the reception on the day i landed. The staff at the reception was not even hospitable enough. Due to some technical faults my credit was not functional at that moment though i had made reservations prior my departure from my home country through my agent from his credit card who was willing to pay my travel but the hotel staff was not listening to me and finally when my card worked they charged me. I had only one source for shopping that was my credit card and my limit was finished on the same day...i stayed there for three days and only the last day i got my payments cleared through my agent and then i could shop... but lost shopping for the first three days and i repent till now... but one thing i think which everybody likes about the hotel is the breakfast.... and i would say it was not the best deal i got..

Reviews.Title: “Great for an experience of little india”
Reviews.Author: rjwalker
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was a good size with comfortable chairs to sit out on plus a small table and a mini bar we used as a fridge. The room was kept very clean and tidy during our stay. The pool on the sixth floor is a good place to relax, free towels and excellent showers. Being placed on Kitchener it is a long way from the centre of Singapore but this is not a problem, the MRT station is a 5 minute walk, clean, air conditioned, easy to use and unbelievabley cheap and it will take you every where. The hotel location is right in little india, great for walking about in and eating out in the evening. For the real thing try the eating place on the corner of Kithener and Verdun, sit with the locals on plastic chairs and tables and enjoy a real curry. Shopping opportunities are excellent as the hotel backs onto Mustafas shopping complex, open 24 hours and worth a visit just for the experience. A modern complex has just opened in front of the Parkroyal with a supermarket, loads of places to eat and boutique shops. An excellent hotel with helpful efficient staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: Itch-4-Travel
Reviews.Content: My 5th trip to Singapore and I wanted to stay somewhere a little different from my previous trips (when I stayed at either Sentosa or on/near Orchard Rd). The Parkroyal on Kitchener Rd is in the heart of Little india and the hustle and bustle is a wonderful contrast to your at-times sterile Singapore. We were fortunate to be there during Deepavali celebrations and all of the streets were wonderfully lit up, a real sense of celebration. I understand the hotel has been recently refurbished - it looks great. Rooms are on the small size but well equipped (LCD TV, wireless internet etc). We got a Club Room on the Orchid Floor which among other 'benefits' entitiles you to hors douvres and cocktails/wine/beer in the Club Room from 60.0 to 7.30pm each evening. We didn't really make the most of this as we were typically away from the hotel at that time, however on the couple of occasions we did partake we noticed that the service was well-frequented. Breakfast buffet was excellent -although coffee from the machine was insipid (but I have never had a decent coffee in Asia yet!) and there was not a good selection of fresh fruit, surprisingly. Pool area and gym were good, although a small complaint was that there were only 6 sun lounges on the deck - not enough by far! Service all round was excellent, from the baggage boys to the concierge. Check-in service at the Orchid Lounge was efficient. All in all, well worth checking out. Good value rooms and great location. The Farrer Park MRT is 100m away and of course public transport in Singapore is second-to-none so once you are on the MRT you can get almost anywhere on the island quickly.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant and near underground”
Reviews.Author: MANUQUINE
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in this Hotel and although the surrounding area was very busy outside the Hotel itself was good - clean and although we only had Breakfast the food was also good. The biggest advantage was it was situated 2 mins from the Underground which obviously could take you anywhere !!! Remember and cash in your ticket on the underground for a $1 return as this is an excellent idea to save litter.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: B.E.BANKS
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Parkroyal - Kitchener Road for a couple of nights in September on our way back to the UK. Considering that the majority of clients are in transit and are only there for a short stay, the attitude of the staff is to be commended. They treat all the guests with a very pleasant and friendly attitude. We had a midnight flight out of Changi and so extended our room stay until 6.00pm with no problem. We had an excellent last meal in the Spice Brasserie before leaving for the airport. The hotel is a two minute stroll to Little India. Just around the corner from the hotel in Verdun Street is a great India/Nepalese restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Good transit hotel”
Reviews.Author: NZSid
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel on 2 Sep 09 (room 1229) and 9-11 Sep 09 (room 920) when transiting through Singapore. Overall, I thought it was good value for money (S$140 per night). The hotel is located S$25 from the airport by taxi. The nearby MRT can be taken to the airport but you need to swap trains twice so may not be suitable if you have heavy luggage. The rooms met my expectations i.e. were clean and well appointed. The only issue I had was that the second room I used (920) was located near the lifts and was very noisy. Other guests wandering the corridors woke me both nights between 3-4 AM. Also the walls of this room seemed thin as I could hear everything occurring in the room next door. The hotel has an excellent outdoor pool area and fitness room. It also has a cozy bar with excellent staff. I only used the dining facilities once, but was impressed by the buffet dinner. I understand that the breakfast buffet was also impressive but perhaps not value for money. This is a busy hotel and the foyer can be hectic at times. I enjoyed my stay and would definitely consider returning.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for Indian Travellers”
Reviews.Author: madbullram
Reviews.Content: The Park Royal is an excellent hotel for Indian Travellers bcos: 1. MRT train station is 2 mins walk 2. Mustafa shopping center is 1 min away 3. Bugis shopping area is 10 mins walk 4. Bus stop is 2 mins away 5. 50+ eating outlets offering idli vada, to tandoor platter to western cuisine, all priced from 3$ to 15$ Apart from these, the Hotel Decor was very elegant and contemporary and we loved the interior designs. The bathroom toiletries are sad, better to take your own shampoos, moisturizers etc Front desk was excellent, we had requested for quiet room in the highest floor possible and it was all ready when we arrived. It was a very pleasing experience. Bell desk too good, we checked out at 12 noon, left the baggage with the bell and went shopping till 5, came back and picked them. It saved us unwanted hotel bill just to keep our luggages. Excellent hotel for travelers and tourist and in particular South Indians!

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but nice”
Reviews.Author: Talvi
Reviews.Content: Parkroyal on Kitchener Road is nice, clean and quite well located. We stayed in their family room which was roomy and comfortable. It had two bedrooms separated by a (thin) door. This allowed us adults to chat, whatch tv etc. late in the evening without disturbing our kids' sleep. Both rooms had a tv and one of them a fridge and coffee-making facilities. Check-in service was a bit of a disappointment. We had booked a package which included some special discounts in restaurants and the hotel spa. But when I asked about it, the person handling our check-in didn't know anything about this and wasn't very helpful. It took a lot of time and our confirmation e-mail to settle things out. Otherwise the service in the hotel was ok. Breakfast is great, both us adults and the kids really enjoyed it. It seems that the breakfast restaurant can be *very* full on weekends, though.
