My daughter also said she spotted a cockroach. This wouldn't suprise me. Even though everything seemed very clean and hygienic, I've seen occasional roaches in all kinds of Asian hotels. I guess it's impossible to avoid them completely. Room prices in Parkroyal are quite expensive, especially with breakfast. In most countires, I wouldn't pay their price for a hotel of their level. But I guess the prices are normal in Singapore, where everything seems to be very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel.”
Reviews.Author: wayulooktonige
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Parkroyal for three nights as the final leg of our honeymoon. Staff throughout our stay there were very courteous and helpful. Our room was very decent with a king sized bed and reasonable 'leg room'. It was cleaned every day to a good standard. Our stay there included breakfast which was a superb mix of European, North American and Asian cuisine - excellent! The lobby bar was a little expensive outside 'Happy Hour'. We recommend a local bar just to the right of the hotel entrance which is far less luxurious but much cheaper and far livelier. The hotel is located to the north of Little India, a lively, fascinating part of the city. It is quite a distance from the main city sights however. There is an excellent open top bus tour with a stop nearby though. We would recommend the combined ticket that allows access on the City and Heritage routes as well as a delightful river cruise. Singapore is beautiful, spotless, vibrant yet peaceful. A fantastic way to end our honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, satisfactory hotel.”
Reviews.Author: jcb193
Reviews.Content: Everyone travels to Singapore for a different reason, so I'll keep this short. Singapore is not a city where you often find good hotel deals. The Good: - Well priced - Great location (if you like Little India) - Seconds from the MRT - Rooms spacious, but not very well upgraded - Great walk around vicinity of hotel - The pool is awesome- so awesome, worth the stay alone in hot, hot singapore. The Bad: - Not as nice as you might be used to in the $100 range elsewhere in the world. - Staff were not very responsive. Had to call three times to get mini bar unlocked. - Location can be noisy, and lots of families and kids running around. - Charge for WIFI. Ridiculous. Like $10 an hour, $25 a day. What is this, 1999? - Bed are horribly stiff. Other than that, I would consider staying here again, depending on who I was with.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with excellent rates”
Reviews.Author: dith96
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel to stay in SIngapore. Like many others, we stayed here based on positive reviews on TA and we'll add our "thumbs up" with enthusiasm. They have a wonderful location with close access to the MRT (less than 5 minutes walk). The hotel within walking distance to a big 24 hours shopping mall (Mustafa Mall), local food (from indian to chinese food). The rooms is very clean and comfortable, with very helpful, courteous and friendly staffs. The hotel is amazing. The assistant Front Office manager is amazing as well, and made our journey unforgetable . Many thanks! We really appreciated everything you have done for us. You can not go wrong by chossing this hotel. Excellent hotel with excellent price! We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “average hotel”
Reviews.Author: FAZ86
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in little india with loads of indian food and indian shopping centres such as grocery and indian gold. I would not stay in this hotel or in this area as it is not the best location, however the hotel was stanard nothing special. When arriving singapore it was very nice and posh but arriving in this area did not feel like we was in singapore...I think because we came from Kuala Lumpur we loved it so much and was trying to compare to singapore and as we stayed in Little india which never seem to be the real singapore....... Any ways if you do go singapore do visit night safari which is amazing and do go to Newtons which is a food centre (hawkers) You will find chinease food and belive me the food is excellent and very cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable Value in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: iprahin
Reviews.Content: I chose to stay at this hotel for a personal business trip based on fellow traveller reviews and highly attractive last-minute pricing from the hotel's website. At S$150, my expectations weren't that high, but upon arrival I must say was very pleasantly surprised. First of all, it appears that the hotel was fully renovated in the last 2 years in an attractive modern style. Check-in was fast, friendly and efficient and even better as I was informed of an upgrade to a Deluxe on a high floor! The room was bright & spacious and decorated in light modern tones and had a small LCD TV in the wall. There was also a work desk/chair and small lounge chair. Bed and pillows were excellent. The view was nice too. My only complaint was that the shower was the stand-in bath type (which I don't particularly like) together with the plastic show curtain. Breakfast wasn't included so I ended up having breakfast at one of the multitude of eateries outside. Location was most interesting and convenient in the heart of Little India behind the famous 24-hour Mustafa Department store. The MRT was <5mins walk (Farrer Park). Taxis were also easy to come by. So all in all, a stay that far exceeded my expectations. I would normally rate this property 4/5 but the amazing value for the quality bumps my rating up to 5/5.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money and nice location”
Reviews.Author: Sven444
Reviews.Content: Made a chose for this hotel (were staying there for 10 nights) based on other reviews on this site and was not disappointed by this hotel. The location is not far from ANY tourist destination in Singapore and main shopping centres on Orchard road and electronic department stores like Sim Lin and Funan, very close to Mustafa centre where you can buy allmost everything you want from mobile phone to jerwelry...check its fragrances dept...very good deals and no fakes...also surrounded by colorful and interested indian places..shops, small restaurants where you can east 100% safety for a very reasonable price...10 Singapore dollars for two. Hotel itsels is clean, and looks like a safety place to stay. No problems with check in and check out. So, we are absolutely satisfied with our 10 days staying over there. Pool is OK also for those who want to relax. Staff is friendly and been helpful when I needed to clear some issues on jewelry, shopping and destinations around Singapore. I can reccomend it, if you are looking for a good accomodation in Singapore and I will stay there again if/when I come back to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Good base for exploring Singapore”
Reviews.Author: BexG
Reviews.Content: We mainly chose the hotel as it had an MRT station (Farrer Park) just across the road. Little India is nearby and the Mustafa Centre (24 hours shopping!) is just behind the hotel. The MRT provides good transport links to the rest of the island. Hotel was really nice but our rate didn't include breakfast so we went out of the hotel every morning in search of breakfast. The staff are brilliant and very attentive. The swimming pool was lovely and they provided towels to use.

Reviews.Title: “Panoramic View - Singapore Skyline”
Reviews.Author: chibsy
Reviews.Content: During my stay for a period of stay for 6 nights. I would say it was value for money. The buffet breakfast was awesome, being a vegeterian - there was always something new for me everyday. Hotel is strategically located, so nearby place Litte India was a few blocks away. And to shoot off for Sentosa Island, the nearest MRT station FERRER Park is also just 3 blocks away. The hotel staff were exceptionally courteous and freindly. I would recommend this hotel to any one coming to singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Marvellous hotel”
Reviews.Author: Taintor
Reviews.Content: Great location in Little India just a minute's walk from Farrer Park MRT station. Ideal base to explore all of Singapore. Pool area was lovely and if you are a keep fit fanatic the gym looked 1st class. Plus Mustafa's department store is at rear of hotel. 24 hr shopping-excellent! Try and visit Fort Canning Park and the Botanic Gardens which are an oasis in the city. Night safari was brilliant too. Sentosa was good but there is a lot of construction work going on. All the restaurants we went to were great and were told all were safe to eat in as they are regularly inspected. Alcohol is very expensive though.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: harnid
Reviews.Content: Our company organised a sales conference at The Park Royal Hotel situated in the central business district of Singapore. The hotel is located a few minutes away from the city's MRT train station thus providing easy access to all parts of Singapore. It has 500 & odd spacious/luxurious rooms. It can hold conference for ten to five hundred guests at one time. The hotel has two restaurants which serve you both local & international cuisine Besides having a well stocked bar where you can unwind after a hard day. The staff is courtious & efficient. The hotel has a fully eqipped Gym & a landscaped pool. The hotel really gives you value for money. I stayed at the hotel again when I went with the family. Irecommend it to all travellers who would like a comfortable stay in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Love the rooms”
Reviews.Author: deathflamer
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very good,you get internet access on letting the front desk know,Although the food is not very suitable for indians.There is an indian restaurant very near the hotel.The Mrts station is near the hotel too.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place in a crowded street”
Reviews.Author: jayxd
Reviews.Content: Situated adjacent to the road which has a number of Indian places, this is one place in Singapore where i immediately felt like home. The hotel is elegant and modern. And the service is fast. They immediately handed over my room keys in flat three minues. As you head for the lifts to go to your room, you can make out everything is structured and systematic in this hotel. Just like the entire singapore. You dont find employees of the hotel strolling around just to greet you with a smile and offer you a helping hand. The rooms are neat and clean. No complains about the bed sheets and towels. The view is good from the 10th floor. A huge number of rooms at the hotel.. but still the room service is fast. i think they are atleat four restaurants. seen atleast two on the ground floor. i only had breakfast at the hotel. but the breakfast was good. very good spread. The great part of the hotel is that Mustafa the famous mall is backdoor. so you can finish your shopping at one go Its open all night and i rememeber walking into the mall past midnight. a walk on serangoon road and you will see a number of Indian faces and Indian shops. You can also get some good Indian fare there. But stayed away since i have it anyways at home. The hotel is not situated in the swanky part of Singapore. But if you have a budget constraint then this hotel is a good bet.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay with all facilities one needs”
Reviews.Author: VRJ
Reviews.Content: A perfect pleasant stay for Indian. Very close to shopping MUSTAFA & very convenient for Indians to get VEG Foods

Reviews.Title: “Good and relaxing environment”
Reviews.Author: kalakhatta
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel and is very close to the Mustafa Market in Singapore which is open 24 hrs so you can just hop in to the market whenever you feel like from here. Whenever we went out we couldn't wait to get back to the peace and tranquility of the hotel. Overall I would say this is probably the one of the best hotel we have ever stayed in on holiday.! May be not the most convenient if all you want to do a lot of sightseeing, but if you want to mix a little luxury with the odd trip to other places then this is an absolute must.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ShashiMumbai
Reviews.Content: Its a nice Place to Stay specially for Indians as its near 24 hrs open Musfata Center there are lots of Indian Restaurants near By near to the MTR The Hotel also has lots of indian didhes in the Buffet Break Fast the staff is not very friendly but its ok. The Pool is Nice. Over all the Place is Worth the price

Reviews.Title: “a good hotel in a brilliant city”
Reviews.Author: loreal28
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in the Little India district of Singapore. After a 12 hour flight driving through the streets of Little India is an eye opener but upon arrival at this hotel we were pleasantly surprised by the large and airy lobby area. Checking in was quite quick and easy and staff very friendly. Our room was on the 6th floor, same floor as the spa, gym and swimming pool area. The room was a nice size and the bathroom beautiful, however the room itself was quite basic. Considering we were on honeymoon I suppose we expected a few extra perks but none really received compared to other hotels we stayed in. All in all we were pleased. The food is lovely - we tried the buffet lunch which had a huge variety of food and staff went beyond their duty in particular a waiter who helped us try some typical singapore dishes. Be prepared to pay a bit more in hotels for food and alcohol - a glass of beer during happy hour was 6GBP. The hotel is very close to the Mustafa Centre which opens 24 hrs a day - a big department store with everything imaginable under one roof. The hotel is also convenient to the rail system however we used taxis which were very cheap to get around in which are available right outside the hotel lobby. When in Singapore it is worth visiting the zoo, chinatown and the Singapore Flyer!!! Liked - The food and friendliness of staff. Disliked - no special treatment for honeymooners.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent quality & value if you don't mind the location”
Reviews.Author: Stevo2009
Reviews.Content: The Parkroyal on Kitchener is a large, modern hotel in the Little India district, almost on the corner of Kitchener Road and Serangoon Road. It is listed as a 3* hotel on Tripadvisor, but if I’d not known I would have thought it a 4*. Unsurprisingly, given its location, the hotel is popular with Indian tour groups and travelers, which adds a certain ‘hustle and bustle’ to the place; at any time of day, the hotel lobby was busy with large families checking in / out or waiting for tour buses. The lobby itself is elegant and spacious. On arrival I was stuck behind a family arguing with reception staff about their rooms, but another member of staff quickly arrived to deal with me and my own check in was handled swiftly and efficiently. My room was on the small side, but was comfortable and well appointed with air conditioning, mini-bar and safe. I particularly liked the large flat screen TV built into the wall and the reclining chair. There were a good selection of soaps, shampoos etc in the bathroom and a dressing gown & slippers in the wardrobe. The breakfast buffet was excellent, with a wide selection of hot / cold western and asian foods. The arrangement was very much self service – pick your own table, pour your own tea / coffee (which I prefer anyway). My only complaint was the layout of the restaurant, with tables between some of the food stations meaning that anyone sitting in the central area had to put up with a lot of ‘passing traffic’. I quickly learnt to pick a table close to the wall. There is an excellent medium sized pool directly outside the hotel gym which was never particularly busy. For some, the hotel location may not be ideal, but as a base for general leisure and sightseeing I had no problem with it. Farrer Park MRT station was 1-2 minutes walk away, from there 5 minutes to downtown Singapore and connections to all points of the island. There were plenty of restaurants, food courts, restaurants, mini-marts and internet cafes within a few minutes walk of the hotel. In summary, for those who don’t particularly need to be based in downtown Singapore, the Parkroyal on Kitchener offers excellent accommodation at reasonable prices – certainly more competitive than an equivalent hotel on Orchard Road.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent midbudget hotel in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: writetraveler
Reviews.Content: I'm a professional travel writer and I appreciate an efficient and clean hotel. I chose this one off Trip Advisor and was not disappointed. The rooms are clean and fairly spacious, with nice bathrooms. I asked for a quiet room and the staff gave me a corner room, which was indeed quiet (the hotel gets some families and groups and rooms closer to the lifts might get some hall noise). The pool was a welcome discovery and it's just big enough for lap swimming. The location of the hotel is very convenient, right in Little India. There are, obviously, some great India places nearby, as well as a few Chinese places. The metro station is less than five minutes' walk away as well. I'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience”
Reviews.Author: Real32
Reviews.Content: The property is situated near the place of my work and therefore most conveienently placed.

Reviews.Title: “A Solid Choice”
Reviews.Author: perryw
Reviews.Content: I stayed here under a promotional rate booked directly on the hotel website for two nights at the end of March 2009. The promotional rate was around S$140 per night nett for a superior room and included S$25 credit per day, which could be used for any hotel service except breakfast. Unfortunately, my stay couldn't be credited for frequent flyer points with partner airlines, being a promotional rate. The hotel check-in experience was a good one as the porters and check-in staff were quite friendly and efficient. The lobby was good, there was a separate lounge area which was separated from the main lobby to provide a bit more privacy and comfort. I was upgraded to a deluxe room on a higher floor, which was good of them. The only problem with the check-in process was the amount of time it took for my luggage to be delivered, I waited about 20 mins. However, the luggage porter was friendly. The first thing I noted about the room was its modern design and outlay, the bathroom in particular was quite modern. The room was clean and had a good feel to it. The hotel is located close to the Farrer Park MRT station in Singapore, only about a five minute walk away. So, many locations in Singapore would be accessible through this route. There are many food outlets in the area, not just serving Indian food but also other varieties. Unfortunately, I went to the hawker centre to the right of the hotel upon exit and got a 1.5L bottle of water for S$2.50, when it should probably cost less than S$1. So, I'd be a little careful about the place. Taxis are usually all over the place as well. Mustafa Centre is located very closeby, this shopping centre is well-known in Singapore for their competitive prices and large range of goods. They also have foreign exchange services at very competitive rates. Also, they are open 24/7. I used my daily credits for a dinner room service meal and also laundry. The room service was very quick, the meal tasty and well-presented. The laundry was nicely done and on time. The only problem was that the tray for room service only seemed to be collected the next day. Overall, I think this is definitely the top hotel in the Little India/Farrer Park area. I'd stayed in the Fortuna Hotel a few years back and this hotel is definitely in a different class. The rate was good as well.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Vins_13
Reviews.Content: I have been to Singapore on busines earlier and chose it this time for my family trip for it's excellent location. My family, being Indian Veggies, and shopoholics, it was a excellent location. Atlest 25 outlets to choose from for Good Indian Food and the Mustafa Shopping Centre was just a stone's throw away. Priceing, though, as is the case with all Hotels in Singapore, was a bit steep, but ok. Te Hotel is overall good.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Singapore”
Reviews.Author: EnjoyHoliday09
Reviews.Content: Singapore is just amazing to visit with family & Children. We visited in May, 2006. This hotel has very near by most popular Mustafa Market for 24 Hrs. x 7 days shopping. Endless things / electronics goods you can explore & purchase at this market. This hotel has taxi stand just at the door step where you can get most reliable taxis. Metro railways station is also at a walking distance. Staff at reception is very co-operative. We have also taken the Singapore City tour for around 2-3 hours given free of cost by hotel in their coach with a guide. Great spreader breakfast in the morning a perfect for Gujarati / Indian people. This hotel area is also called as Indian restaurant area. You will get vegetarian Punjabi dishes at near by Restaurants. We have also visited Sentosa Island, Night Jungle Safari, Jurang Bird Park, Science Centre, Snow world, Sun Fountain, Orchard Road during our memorable stay at Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “So refreshing”
Reviews.Author: sri67
Reviews.Content: I have returned back to Singapore after almost 5 years and staying at Park Royal brought back so many memories. Located at such a fantastic location with tons of so many Indian restaurants and just next to Mustafa, Park Royal offered everything a visitor wants. With such a fantastic gym, swimming pool and sumptuous breakfast, stay at Park Royal is worth many times the money they charge. I stayed on the executive floor, so they offered breakfast and complimentary drinks in the evevning. I loved the great view from the top floor, I am waiting for a next chance to get there. Just love their hospitality!

Reviews.Title: “Good and very close to little india”
Reviews.Author: narora2
Reviews.Content: Good: Very convenient location , Room was very good and clean , Food options and shopping options are quiet near to this place, Supportive staff , Good Food and further tour arrangements from hotel are extremely good & organised Bad:Very few choice for Pure vegetarian food and indian food

Reviews.Title: “Wow service in Little India”
Reviews.Author: indiavoyager
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for second time for my parents this time. We (couple) had stayed at this hotel earlier last year also, and the experience has been the same-'wow'. Close to Little India, next to 24x7 Mustafa Shopping Center, close to metro station, Electronics Mall etc- it served our purpose very well. City sight seeing, shopping and adventures were all very convenient from here. Being Indian, Indian food was never more than 2 mins far from here!--well that's about location. In terms of service and amenities, I must admit, it is steal at this price. Well appointed room, bath and good housekeeping made us choose this hotel for second time. Moreover we also got 3 day free ticket for Hippo Bus Tour on booking this hotel through our agent. I have recommended this hotel to several people visiting Singapore and would not hesitate to do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, brilliant location.”
Reviews.Author: agaveplant
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Feb 2009, arriving at 4am from Australia. The front desk staff were helpful, and upgraded me to a deluxe room on the 17th floor with amazing views to the ferris wheel. The room was clean, spacious, beautiful bathroom and amenities provided. The breakfast was massive and catered for all tastes. The pool is lovely and on the 6th floor. It is 50m to Serangoon Rd, 100s of restaurants, hop to the Farrer Park MRT and zoom straight to Chinatown, or walk to Bugis. Something for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “A touch of hospitality made all the difference”
Reviews.Author: GreatSingapore
Reviews.Content: I booked through the internet and while checking in, I encounrtered some problems and was in the verge of erasing the hotel from my list. When I highlighted the problem, I was shocked to recieve a prompt response from the front office assistant manager- Mr Alvin. he was truely helpful and made my stay at the hotel more meaningful and comfortable. I was impressed with his hospitality and changed my mind about the hotel. As long as people like him are around to iron out guests problems, i am sure guests will keep coming back. I am planning to visit Singapore in April amd will surely pick this hotel again. I strongly recommend this hotel to visitors to Singapore. if you have problems get in touch with him and I bet you will have a wonderful stay there. Farah Buruhanudeen

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service”
Reviews.Author: Asif_Ukare
Reviews.Content: The quality and servise was supurb, better than I expected

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic in every way”
Reviews.Author: wyomingman
Reviews.Content: Have you ever fantasied about finding a hotel where you are treated like royalty? We found such a place late December 2007 in Singapore. The Parkroyal on Kitchener Road greatly exceeded our expectations in all respects. The room was spacious and well appointed, the hotel staff most helpful, courteous and friendly (including the desk / reception people!!!). The hotel has excellent restaurant facilities and cater for those with special dietary needs.The hotel is located in Little India one of the most interesting parts of Singapore. We look forward to staying there again in June. John and Wendy Patterson Wyoming NSW Australia

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: lucyboots
Reviews.Content: My daughter & I loved the Park Royal on Kitchener Road. The room was very spacious, the food first class and the efficiency and friendliness of the staff is the best we have ever experienced. Staff were always so willing to help in any way they could and went out of their way to ensure we had a happy stay. We were there for fourteen days so did get to know a lot of the faces and personalities of the individuals. We were very impressed with the cleanliness too. We would certainly use this hotel again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mumroange
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for our stop over on the way to Europe from Australia. Not too sure what we would get not being on Orchard Rd or closeby but we were more than pleasantly suprised by this hotel. We were travelling with our 2 boys and the room was ideal for us. A room with 2 single beds flowing into another with a queen and bathroom. The room was clean and welcoming and we certainly felt comfortable. A great little hawker centre selling fantastic cheap food next door, close to the mustafa centre, sim lim square and bugis street....I would definitely stay here again and recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected twist”
Reviews.Author: Blackburn1980
Reviews.Content: Singapore was an unexpected stopover as a result of not being able to fly back to the UK via Bangkok from Koh Samui. So needless to say, we knew nothing of this hotel, let alone Singapore! Upon arrival, the concierge helped us with our luggage and the reception staff booked us into a twin room. (not an issue as this was the only room available in a hotel that seemed to be taking in all waifs and strays from those attempting to get home from Thailand). The room was located on the 12th floor, adjacent to the lifts and unfortunately for us it was also a smoking floor and the room really really smelled of stale smoke. However, the room was lovely with twin beds, which were a little hard but apparently this is the case with most east Asian countries. We had spectacular views of the city and it was clear the room had recently undergone a series of renovations, particulary the carpet and bathroom, with a shower that was most welcoming. We also received two complimentary bottles of water which again was great as it was some 35c outside! Breakfast was superb. I honestly don't think I've had one quite like it as it met everyone's taste. Excellent! As our check-out time was midday, we were able to use the pool and gym facilities and of course the showers that came along with it as we did not need to leave for the airport until 7.30pm. The staff were very helpful and as we had lockers we were able to dump out stuff and go and see some of this amazing city (which we intend to visit again, this time, properly!). Although we didn't get very far, the smells eminating from the Little India area was sublime and we wished we could have been around long enough to experience the food. The hotel as a whole is between a 3 and 4 star accommodation in my opinion as it seemed when they were busy, they had real trouble ensuring customer services were met and some would say they could have come across as being a little rude (though very much working under pressure). We wanted an extra pillow for the room as my husband suffered from a bad back, however laundry had run out of them, and even if therer were some, they couldn't deliver them as they were closed (it was 10.30pm and we arrived at 10.00pm). When we eventually come back to this amazing city, we shall certainly be staying at this hotel (just on a different level) and I would certainly recommend it to anyone going to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: daisy111
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the renovated room, which was great, everything new, modern amenities and very clean. Pretty good price for Singapore standards. The proximity to MRT is a great advantage, too, as you get anywhere in the city in minutes. We did not find any good eateries around, but again within just minutes it is possible to get anywhere. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: MMDAS
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel- great room, great views. We stayed here for 2N/3D during the last leg of our family holiday and loved every moment of it. The staff is courteous and the hotel is in the heart of little India. It's 2 mins away from the Mustafa shopping complex and awesome food joints. The only thing I didn't like was that the reception wanted a scan of my credit card while checking in even though I had paid for my accomodation in full while confirming the booking. The management should look into this since this attitude may not go down well with many people.

Reviews.Title: “One to be avoided”
Reviews.Author: digitl
Reviews.Content: We spent three weeks travelling in Hong Kong, Australia and Singapore and, of the seven hotels we stayed in, this was by far the worst. Upon arrival we were told that the twin 'Superior' room we had booked was unavailable and that we had been 'upgraded' to a larger 'Superior' room on the 12th floor. The room was dingy with poor quality furniture, a large old CRT TV, and a carpet that was fraying at the edges. The bathroom had grubby grouting along the bat edge, the shower and taps were old and discoloured, the door hinges rusty and the door paintwork in very poor condition. Staff were helpful but those in the brasserie and the Chinese restaurant spoke little English and had difficulty in explaining the menu options. The food in the Chinese restaurant was dry and unappetising and vastly overpriced. The bar on the same floor as Reception was also incredibly expensive and the singer in there had the volume turned up to a level more suited to a stadium gig! When we asked for it to be turned down a little so that we could hear each other talk we were told that the level was fine. The area in which Park Royal on Kitchener is located is a little down-at-heel compared with other parts of the city and some distance away from most areas which visitors would want to see. As a result most trips out start with the short walk to the MRT at Farrer Park. When making arrangements to leave, Concierge told us that a maxi-cab would cost S$45 for the two of us and we would have to pay in advance. Rough Guide says S$7 per person. Overall, a very disappointing end to a fabulous trip.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Parkroyal on Kitchener Road”
Reviews.Author: Jasri
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed for 4 nights at Parkroyal on Kitchener Road, Singapore in early June 2008. It is nicely refurbished and the ambience all over is very welcoming. The room is very comfortable for Singapore standards while the rate is competitive for its class. The staff is friendly, informative and most helpful with sightseeing suggestions. Access to transport is good. Vicinity to shopping facilities & food outlets is definitely helpful when one travels with family members.. The children enjoyed the swimming pool tremendously. Overall I have to admit that the good experience staying at this hotel made my family determined to return for another holiday trip within the next 12 months. We would be happy to return to the familiar Parkroyal on Kitchener Road.

Reviews.Title: “very smart and newly refurbished”
Reviews.Author: Teddy12
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as it seemed to be a good price for a 3 star in Singapore and also had good reviews on trip advisor . We were very pleasantly surprised as the hotel has been recently refurbished and is very modern and swish! We found the check in staff who dealt with us to be friendly and polite and they even upgraded us from a superior to a deluxe room as we were staying for a week . Our room was very clean with a good supply of toileteries, tea and coffee making facilities. We ate breakfast just once and it was very good with a wide cultural choice of dishes but it was quite expensive as hotel breakfasts often are and there are cheaper alternatives in the area. The concierge was super efficient and could always answer our queries . We were directed to a very reasonable and tasty dim sum restaurant a short walk down Hastings road by the concierge. We really liked eating at the food court which is next door to the park royal and if you like indian food you should try it. They have the best nan bread in Singapore! The Mustaffa centre is close by as are a couple of other smaller shopping cenres and using the MRT from Farrer Park station you can be anywhere in Singapore quite quickly and easily. Little India is a fascinating area and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of room descriptions - 'Superior Room' was INFERIOR”
Reviews.Author: DaveyIRL
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very busy the weekend I was there. Despite this and the huge line of people at reception, the reception staff were cold but efficient at first although became much warmer as my stay continued. I had booked a 'superior' room and was given a room which smelled of damp, was dirty, including sweet papers under the bed, had broken furniture and paint in serious need of redoing. [I can add photos of the room if people would like to see them]. It also had an adjoining door to the very noisey family in the room next door.....and believe me I was not a happy bunny. I met with a Manager to discuss my concerns and she told me that 'superior' was the lowest standard room they had at the hotel. Perhaps people booking rooms should be aware of this - it might help them to select a better room (incidentally my (inferior) Superior room cost me 100 euros per night). The receptionist who checked me in reminded me several times that breakfast was not included in a room 'at the rate' I had booked. Given the standard of the room I was rather pleased that I had the option to go out for a nice breakfast. After much discussion the manager upgraded me to a nicer room, which had all of the comforts you would expect a nice hotel to have. I have to say to its credit the second room was so much nicer than the first and had a nice flat screen TV, more modern(!) furniture and a bigger bathroom. The rest of my stay went smoothly with the 'nicer' room being well cleaned daily. [again I have some photos of this room and can add them to the review if required]. The area the hotel is in is called Little India and is full of interesting shops, restaurants, food stalls, markets and Indian temples. At weekends a large number of Indian guys congregate outside the hotel and are very chatty and love talking with tourists. This is a hotel that I think can improve with a little updating and some training of staff in basic customer services skills. I would certainly consider staying here again subject to having a decent room and of course i would put more work into comparing prices of other hotels. If you would like any more info on my experiences of this hotel - or others i have reviewed - please feel free to mail me.

Reviews.Title: “The best in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: tropical-annie
Reviews.Content: I can not recommend this hotel enough! Seriously. I recently stayed there with 4 generations of my family, and everyone’s needs were graciously catered for. Within a day of arrival my son required urgent medical attention. The hotel security staff acted with prompt and caring efficiency, and directed all actions to ensure my son was at a leading hospital in a matter of minutes of informing them of the need for assistance. Thereafter, all the staff were genuinely concerned and helpful as I negotiated care for the remaining members of the family at the hotel (whose ages were in their 80s and 5). No request was too much trouble. All the hotel staff greeted my son like a long lost relative on his return to the hotel 3 days later. While it would be easy to simply say the rooms were wonderful and the hotel fantastic, I found the staff professionalism and genialness beyond anything I have ever experienced in any hotel anywhere. The management should be recommended for their training and attention to detail. I know I will stay at this hotel on all my many return trips to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “A Comfortable Hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: gemmasnook
Reviews.Content: When we were looking for hotels in Singapore all we could find was squalor with bad reviews in even worse locations or expensive chain hotels which we couldn't afford. This hotel was at the top of our budget but it was the only one that fell in between the two extremes. Overall we thought the hotel was good; the lobby and entrance were nice and the staff were very helpful. Our room was slightly dated but we did get one of the un-refurbished rooms (that were going cheap). Despite this the room was still very clean and comfortable. The hotel is not in central Singapore but it is right next to a subway station so you can get everywhere from there. I would stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Little India location made the Parkroyal an interesting place to stay”
Reviews.Author: HertfordshireHels
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Parkroyal on Kitchener Road with my husband and two teenage daughters in August 2008. I wanted to stay in Little India as I thought it would be an experience for my daughters rather than staying somewhere central like Orchard Road. It certainly was that.... we arrived on a Sunday afternoon and the streets were packed with people! The hotel itself was very comfortable and clean and the staff were friendly and helpful - in particular the concierges who were always happy to run around finding us taxis. The rooms and the beds were comfortable, although my daughters' room did smell a little damp. The pool was a welcome oasis after a busy day. The breakfasts were excellent and a great way to start a day of sightseeing. Taxis are a cheap and easy way to travel around the city although we did try the MRT also. A visit to the Mustafa Centre is a must as well as the beautiful temple in Serangoon Road. We loved Boat Quay and Clarke Quay for eating out in the evening and would also recommend a visit to the Botanical and Orchid Gardens, the Night Safari and Raffles for coffee or a drink. Chinatown was charming and we had a great lunch at Old Shanghai in Temple Street. I would recommend the Parkroyal on Kitchener Road if you want to see Singapore from a different perspective.

Reviews.Title: “Park Royal , Singapore”
Reviews.Author: cjocolumbus
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival the staff were very helpfulll and very smart in their uniform. Hotel was big with shop in soviner shop in foyer, Local shopping centre behind hotel. Great place to stay with comfoy beds.

Reviews.Title: “A memorable stay at Park Royal on the Kitchener Road”
Reviews.Author: the_nize_guy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel from March for a couple of weeks. I found the stay quite comfortable and relaxing. The hotel staff are good - and they take care to make my stay a memorable one. I extensively used the hotel sauna, gym and swimming pool facilities. I even used the travel desk to book a short trip to Malaysia over a weekend. After a long tirind day, sipping a Martini in the Lounge bar really helped. The hotel is situated right in the middle of Little India and I would advise all travellers from the subcontinent to stay at the Park Royal. Be it business travellers or those enjoying their leisure moments, Park Royal is one place I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “The Orchid Club reception is very very rude”
Reviews.Author: mylucaluca
Reviews.Content: I booked this club room is because of the Internet Connection package. However it turn out worst things ever happen to me. The club reception so rude after i asked to waive the club package and replace me with the standard room. This is because i can't use thier internet. He never say sorry and show any espression of regret. Not recommned if you are on bussiness stay. AVOID this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: joanne46
Reviews.Content: This Hotel has to be up there with the best. The service was so personal,helpful, and friendly. The room was large, spotless and beautiful.The location was excellent, so close to all the great shopping. I filled in the guest comment form and received a letter from the Manager after I arrived back home.(He didn't offer me a free stay next time though.Ha HA.) But when I am next in Singapore, this Hotel is the only place I will stay. Keep up the excellent work.

Reviews.Title: “A vast improvement post refurbishment.”
Reviews.Author: RogerH
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel when it was the New Park and it was awfull. However after a refurbishment and a change of name it has vastly improved. Our room was on a smoking floor, the corridor stank of smoke but luckily the room itself was ok All the fixtures and fittings were in good order except the room safe which had been left locked by a previous occupant.They gave us a safety deposit box at reception instead at no charge.The reception staff were always very busy and sometimes it took a while to be seen. The pool area was very clean and tidy and the pool was a welcome relief after a days shopping as it stays open until 10pm. There was however on worrying moment when the fire alarms went off one afternoon.We walked down the stairs as instructed on the poster to end up in the shops under the hotel where there was no member of staff present to tell us where to go and all the shop staff were working normally through the racket of the alarms.We found our way outside and walked around to reception where they were also working normally.Once again noboby told us what was happening.It turned out to be a false alarm but it would have been nice to have members of staff tell us what was happening and where to go as there were several very confused people milling around. As mentioned by previous reviewers the hotel is very close to an MRT station and the Mustafa centre (a must to visit) which is now open 24 hours a day and they are building a new mall just across the street which will be open the middle of 2009. We did'nt eat at the hotel so cannot comment on that but watch the prices for food and drink as one couple at the pool were billed S$ 30 for 2 beers!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good for a stopover”
Reviews.Author: RoomGeek
Reviews.Content: First up, we booked our stay through a travel agent who used some sort of QANTAS holidays booking process to get us rooms at a rate considerably cheaper than some other reviewers describe. I'd recommend doing this. You will either love or loathe the hotel's location in the Little India district. We loved it. Little India was an interesting cultural surprise and as vegetarians we delighted in the many cheap and interesting Indian vegetarian food options around. It is a quick walk to the MRT station so getting around was not problematic. However, if you are coming to Singapore for the shopping rather than the food, or if you are easily offended by unusual food smells or poorly maintained footpaths, you may be better off finding a more central hotel. Our biggest gripe about this hotel was having booked a double room and then being given a twin instead. Annoying - and I see at least one other reviewer on this site had a similar experience. Having said that, otherwise the hotel was fine. Comfortable rooms, very polite staff, etc. I would stay there again if in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Perspectives on a two week stay”
Reviews.Author: LondonGenie
Reviews.Content: After two weeks at this hotel, I expect I will have some issues that others will not. Overall, first impressions? Very nice, classy contemporary decor, nice staff, nice room. The location is slightly away from the middle of things, but the MRT and buses are right next door, so getting around is no problem. I stayed here, as I had no need to be closer into town, so was seeking better value. Negatives on my trip? Housekeeping calling me on the phone,'because your do not disturb sign is on', to ask if I wanted laundry delivered. Coming back one night to find Housekeeping had left the security bar flipped over on my door, and the room open. Housekeeping calling on a Sunday morning to ask if I had laundry to drop off. Checking in to realise that the room had no desk chair, and the room safe had been locked open by the previous guest. Rather a meagre breakfast for the price of hotel. In two weeks, they only went beyond melon cubes for fresh fruit on two occasions (once pineapple, the other time dragon-fruit), this in a country where tropical fruit is so abundant and cheap. Enquiring if they had any cheese, I was told that it would be charged as an extra. You did get something of a feeling that they provided nothing that you could walk out with. Compare what was on offer with say the Prince Hotel in KL. I was told that if I checked out early, I would pay one nights room-rate as a penalty. On re-checking this, I was told that this was not so, and offered the managers card in case I had further issues. I had a good stay, but not sure I'd choose to spend two weeks in this location again. As others have said, I'll add that the cost of hotels in SG is now totally horrendous. After add-ons I was paying over US$200 a night, which even a year ago would have got you something really special. Good luck to anyone trying to find a hotel during the Singapore grand prix. p.s. Mustaffa Centre is a must, ended up buying a fridge and washing machine there - definitely good value!

Reviews.Title: “Apalling hotel”
Reviews.Author: UkBumblebee
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. We stayed at this hotel on the way back from Australia. I am so glad it was for less than 24 hours! Immediately on arrival it became apparent that this hotel was very dated and the reception area had quite a depressing look about it with paint work chipped and tired looking. On booking in, there was confusion about whether breakfast had been paid for, for our children (which it had) and this took a while to sort out. We again had this query when we went for breakfast the following morning, but this time it was if any of us had breakfast included! The family room was two adjoining rooms and was dated and tired looking, with wood work chipped and dirty. The curtains were filthy and the sheets had a hole in. The whole presentation was dark, dingy and depressing. One of the robes provided had a stain on the back. The only ok thing about the hotel was the breakfast which the children enjoyed as they could have pancakes freshly cooked. However the ceiling of the restaurant looked like it belonged in a factory with all the pipework exposed. The pool area was ok but all the tables were full of dirty crockery when we arrived for a swim. Overall very disappointing. All of this I will be feeding back to our travel agent.

Reviews.Title: “Fresh and pleasant”
Reviews.Author: YingYang66
Reviews.Content: I was really happy with this choice of hotel. Being located in Little India added a new dimension to my experiences of this wonderful island nation. Arrived after my afternoon flight from Australia. Transfer to hotel went well. Staff were polite at check-in but there was a problem. My booking for a king couldn't be filled due to the hotel being at full capacity during the expo. I was offered a twin. That suited me as I was travelling alone. The only reason I mention this is that they did explicitely state that it was a king room on the booking confirmaiton. Room is very clean and comfortable. They have been renovated since some of the ealier review. Every function was in order. With the weather at the moment, the aircond is producing quite a lot of condensation which is dripping onto the carpet near the cupboard. Reported it to maintenance this morning but no action yet. Yesterday morning I ordered an iron for the room. It took more than 60 minutes to arrive. Fortunately I had made the decision to go to breakfast in the meantime. Breakfast was quite hearty with a range of Asian, European and Indian dishes. I've been having the fresh cooked omelette each morning. The bacon is certainly unusal. Not sure what they do to that. It is very fatty. Brekky has been keeping me going for the day. Location of the hotel is a little out of the centre. Taxi fares to most parts of the city have been in the range of S$5 - S$6. Outside the hotel do try the "My F&B Cafe" (pictured) area 20 metres from the hotel on Kitchener Road. A full chinese meal will be about S$3. Fantastic Indian fare can be enjoyed for around the same price. I tried the pool on Level 6. Even though we are close to the equater, the pool water is still cool and refreshing. The pool attendants can give you a free locker key when they give you a towel. Thanks Parkroyal.

Reviews.Title: “Most, but not all, aspects excellent”
Reviews.Author: cello626
Reviews.Content: Stayed in PR for 2 nights in April. Room was very clean (we were even comfortable letting our baby crawl around throughout the room) and large for the style of hotel. Breakfast (which was included in our rate) is fantastic, with a buffet catering to a wide variety of western and eastern tastes. The hotel is also well located (Farrer Road MRT is across the street and Lavender MRT is about a 10 minute walk in the opposite direction). We were also pleasantly suprised to discover we could walk to the hotel (about 15 min with bags) from Lavender Bus terminus, which is where over land coaches to Malaysia (serving Melaka for example) stop. In terms of standard business ammenities it is slightly lacking (the cost of internet is really high for example). Staff were very friendly but not always great at getting things done (having to call repeatedly over a 2hr period to get the alarm clock turned off in the vacant room next door on a Sunday morning was annoying!) For location and price though this is an excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “It's all good”
Reviews.Author: Melnq8
Reviews.Content: I've visited Singapore many times over the past few years and have watched hotel prices rise at an alarming rate. I now search high and low for good value hotels, and that's exactly what I found at the Park Royal on Kitchener Road. I booked this hotel for an overnight stay via the hotelclub booking site. We paid US $126 for a double room inclusive of all taxes and breakfast for two. We were given a quiet room at the end of the hall on the 14th floor, which was completely non-smoking (yea!). Our room was fresh, clean and inviting. It had a comfortable king sized bed, a desk with comfy lounge chair, a safe, mini bar/fridge, powerful air conditioning, two bathrobes and plenty of space. I loved the lighting - bright lights over the sink and mirror in the bathroom, plenty of lamps and soft lighting in the bedroom. There was a floor lamp, desk lamp, lights under the bed side tables and individually controlled reading lights attached to the bed. The bathroom was modern and spacious with a shower over the tub and ample shelf space. This hotel is located right next door to chaotic Mustafa Center, a 24 hour shopping complex that seems to be busy round the clock. It's also right across the street from an MRT station, so it couldn't be more conveniently located. All one need do is walk out the door to find Indian food, but we chose the restaurant in the basement of the hotel - Jewel of India - excellent choice - inexpensive and really good ($12 nett each for dinner buffet). The hotel breakfast was excellent with a wide array of hot and cold food options. The staff was friendly and helpful and allowed us to check out at 2 pm at no extra charge. I was really impressed with this hotel and won't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy Traveller!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jassyjewels
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for the past 2 weeks. I have mostly positive things to say about our stay!!! Our room was lovely and clean and cleaned daily by housekeeping. We had a lovely fruit basket in our room on arrival. The Porters and Concierge were very friendly and helpful to us. We had our breakfast included in our stay so that was a wonderful start to each day. The spice brasserie breakfast catered to everyones tastes and needs!! I found the food to be plentiful and delightful. The danish pastries were delish!! I think because we had 2 weeks there, we got to know some of the staff, so we were greeted and treated very well. I loved the location as i am not keen on being in the city area. Having the Mustafa centre just a 1 minute walk away was great for whenever we needed anything...and i mean anything!!! This place is the biggest shop i have ever seen and i managed to get lost in there many times! There is also many Hawker centres within a 2 minute walk, so we ate at them a lot and never payed more than $10SING for our 2 meals. The hotel is a busy one, so sometimes waiting for an elevator at peak times was a pain, but i am a patient person, so i just chatted to others who were also waiting. The pool and gym area is just beautiful. Very refreshing after a day out sightseeing. The MRT is so close you can see it from the hotel. Staff are also ready to call a cab for you if required. All in all, i found the Parkroyal a great place to stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice refurb, interesting area”
Reviews.Author: pommie01
Reviews.Content: This is quie a nice place, and good value. The room was a pleasent surprise at this price. - The room I stayed in was newly refurbished. - Very comfy king size bed (pretty firm but good), - New LCD TV on the wall with many channels (most in Chinese) - In this climate you need good aircon, and the aircon in this room was nice and cold. - Didn't eat in the restaurant, but I did have room service breakfast, the full american for $Sing22. Pretty good - and good value. Will try the breakfast buffet next time. - The hotel is right next door to a famous 24 hour department store - you just have to see this place !!! - There area is almost entirely Indian, which is great for food variety. Appears to be quite a safe area. On the negative side: - The area is not really near orchard road or downtowb singapore - so everywhere is a bit of hike. It's not really in town. - The lifts were older, and provided an unimpressive slow service. - There is no parking outside the front door - so it is very hard to have a colleague pick you up. The security guys are very agressive. - The Bell hops are also quite agressive in taking your bags/whether you want them too or not. Really really agressive.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: Crevis
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed with the Parkroyal on Kitchener Road. The beds are like concrete and I found them almost impossible to sleep on. The room was pleasant, but basic. I was very disappointed to be charged $47 for 4 x lemonade drinks in the front bar whle killing some hours waiting for my transfer to the airport. When I explained my concern the reply was very abrupt and unforgiving. The hotel is convenient if you wish to go to the Mustafa shopping center which is truly amazing. My advice, you can do a lot better with your money in Singapore. The best thing about my stay was that it was only for 1 night.

Reviews.Title: “Little India in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: kgmasters
Reviews.Content: This is a reasonably priced hotel located in "Little India", Singapore. The rooms are very clean, reasonably sized. Internet access is by LAN cable and rather slow, but I was able to use SKype. The hotel is adjacent to Mustifas; an amazing department store that sells everything.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: kakkles
Reviews.Content: this is a really great hotel. staff, food, rooms - all very very good. the area feels a bit odd at first (Little India) and its further away from the 'city' areas but it grows on u very quickly. i would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: colleen_lovetotravel
Reviews.Content: One of the Park Royal chain of hotels this Hotel is at present only rated 3 star but it has been newly renovated, & situated close to little india, Seragoon Street and the shopping haven of the Mustafa Centre, The accomodation is clean and comfortable with added little extra touches such as a toothpaste and brush which is not normally supplied in this rating of a hotel. The newly refurbished bars, lounges and dining rooms are excellent and the range and variety of food mouthwatering. The staff are very friendly and whilst unobtrusive are always at hand to assist in whatever way they can. Security again is unobtrusive but nevertheless always alert. We stayed for 6 days and after a couple of days found the staff waitng for us with a smile and greeting whenever we came in or out, ready to assist with bags of shopping etc. The hotel has a gym and swimming pool with bar service for relaxtion after a day of shopping or sightseeing. It is close to transport and only a short cab ride to most areas. For price the value is outstanding and I will happily stay there again on my next visit or stopover Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Worth A Try”
Reviews.Author: PhilyP
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel for two nights on 14th January. A gem in this historical part of town, considering there are no business class hotels in the vicinity. A convenient location with a 24hours shopping centre within walking distance. Booked in on their Orchid Club Floor. Room was spacious and benefits value for money. Service was above average, find that staff did their best to pleased although they were fairly busy especially in the morning and evening. Front Desk was always crowded, thus approached Concierge most of the time for assistance. Like the complimentary laundry and internet. The restaurant was only average with the usual hotel buffets. Transportation is easily available with the MRT a mere walking distance. PhilyP.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at Parkroyal Kitchener”
Reviews.Author: Melvil
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 1 night on Jan2 in their superior room. I paid only SGD 170.00 net rate inc bfast (booked thru travel agent). And I can tell that I got more than I paid. Comparing with other 3star I had stayed in SIN, this hotel got 3*+ rating from me. The room was big and clean, the aircon and TV worked well. Their meals for buffet breakfast also great. The concierge staffs have been realy nice and helpfull. They did a lot better job than the staff at the reception desk. Farrer Park MRT station (purple line) only 5 minutes away and the Mustafa 24hours shopping centre is just behind the hotel. Very convenient location for me due I don't like Orchard Road that much. The most important thing about location in SIN, it should be closed to MRT station so you can mobile easily. Taxi also not an issue if you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel but a bit overpriced”
Reviews.Author: phildal
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the parkroyal with my partner for 3 nights mid-december. The hotel itself was clean, modern and all amenities worked however we didn't feel anything 'stood' out from the crowd of the hotel. There was barely any character and the prices for the mini-bar and in house food was ridiculous! (4$S for a can of coke) The bed was comfortable, however we were not given a doona, there was a fleece blanket and a sheet only. The air conditioning was fine, except it was a little loud. The gym was clean and in good working order and the pool was large and clean as well. The baggage staff were nice to talk too, however the staff on the front desk were not polite, and did not smile once when we checked in/checked out or asked a few things. We didn't eat at the few restaurants in the hotel but given the location (100m from the train station and restaurants everywhere) it was easier/cheaper to eat out. Overall our stay at Parkroyal Kitchener Rd was average; I wouldn't really recommend it as I think for the price you can stay somewhere else with a bit more character and flair.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: vpsharma
Reviews.Content: Date: 15 Dec 07 From: A Tourist to Singapore I and my family stayed in the hotel in the first week of Dec 07, while on a holiday tour to Singapore. We had excellent services offered by their staff, particularly, when I had my car broken down on a rainy day (none of the regular emergency response companies had people to send to look for repairs asap). That is when their Concierge staff on duty (Jason Chan) went out of his way to search and locate a service company to come in speedily and resolve my car's problem, so that we could start the journey back to our home asap. All of us really appreciated Jason's personal involvement to attend to our problem, till it was resolved, despite a heavy rush of tasks that hotel staff has, during evening hours. It is an excellent hotel with great service.

HotelInfo.Name: PARKROYAL on Kitchener Road
HotelInfo.Address: 181 Kitchener Road, Singapore 208533, Singapore
